Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand inventory.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en: Bernice B. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through tertiary education. Bernice sells a variety of assorted provisions in Central market, Kpando, which she has done since 1999. Her husband is a trader. Bernice uses her income for payment of the children's school fees and all the financial needs of the children. Bernice will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bernice plans to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven J., from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, is 55 years old and the married father of four adult-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a motorcab business that offers transportation to local community members. Engaged in his business for over two years, Joven earns approximately 1200 PHP a month.

In 2001, Joven joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC, he is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Joven from GDMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hog raiser.  Her desire to assist her husband in providing the daily needs of their family and in supporting the educational needs of their children motivates her to work hard.  She is married to Felix Jr. and they are blessed with four children, all studying.  Two are in college, one is in high school and the youngest is in kindergarten.  She is already 39 years old and is doing her best to become a responsible wife and mother to her children. She is also thankful for blessing her with a good and loving husband who supports her all the time. 

Nelia wants to develop her piggery business, thus requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP4,000. She hopes that with that amount, she will be able to buy additional piglets and a sack of feed. She is hoping that someday, the pigs she is raising will double in number and she will have a stable business with the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Aita Sene

texts.fr: aita sene W. est parent beneficiaire vendeuse de poissons capitalisant une experience de plus de six ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter  son fond et gagner d'autres marches.son objectif est de mieux assister sa famille a ameliorer le cadre de vie.
texts.en:
Aita Sene W. is a recipient parent and a fish seller capitalizing on over six years of experience in her business.  She's requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her capital and to reach other markets.  Her goal is to assist her family further in improving its living conditions.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund D. is from the village of Banawan, Iligan city. He is 29 years old. Raymund is single. To make a living, Raymund owns & operates a service-based business. Raymund is just starting this taxi services business.

In 2009, Raymund joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to engage in business activities. Raymund is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Raymund from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide taxi services.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Mr. Chhum N., age 36 and his wife, Mrs. Thida Khoun, age 37, have been married since 1994 and have three daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.   
 
Chhum has been selling Phaklov (meal that cook with port) in his village for 7 years. His wife is a hairdresser. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a cart to carry Phaklov for sale and repair the roof of his house.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to carry Phaklov (meal that cook with pork) for sale and repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Yubania

texts.es: La señora Yubania A. de 36 años de edad, se dedica al lavado y planchado desde hace siete años es la forma de estar en su casa y pode cuidar a su hija de 10 años de  edad la cual va a clase, su esposo es mariachi el cual sale por las noche en la rotonda de Bello Horizonte una zona de la capital en donde están los músicos que alegran a los Managuas, sus planes es mejorar su vivienda hacerle las mejoras para darle a su familia seguridad, ella vive en un barrio llamado Laureles Norte, lleva cuatro ciclo en la institución y muy sastifecha por los logros, con este crédito repara su cerco y hará un pequeño muro para mejor seguridad de su vivienda. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los créditos que han sido en gran beneficio.
texts.en:
Yubania A. is 36. She has been working at washing and ironing for seven years. It is a way of being at home and being able to take care of her ten year old daughter. Her daughter goes to school. Her husband is a mariachi. At night he goes to the Bello Horizonte rotunda in the capital. That is where all the musicians who make the Managuans happy are. Her plan is to improve her home by making some improvements to give her family security. She lives in a neighborhood called Laureles Norte. She is in her fourth cycle with the institution. She is very satisfied with the achievements. She will use this loan to fix a fence and build a small wall for better security for her home. She is grateful to Afodenic for the help with the loans, which have been of great benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a small wall

loans.name: Safokhudja

texts.en:
Safokhudja is married with three children. He lives in Isfara and sells spare parts and lubricants. His small facility is favorably located in his countryside is Isfara town. His business is very promising and flourishing. Safokhudja has an individual approach to each of his customers, which has helped him win many loyal clients. He has been in this trade for 13 years. Today he needs a loan of $1500 USD for increasing his inventory. Safokhudja is happy to have access to lending services as additional financial assistance gives him options in his dealings with different suppliers of specific merchandise. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the spare parts for car in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: Favor

texts.en: Favor is married with three children. Her eldest child is 12 years old and the youngest child is six years old. She is 34 years old. Her husband is a pastor.  She sells groceries and drinks in Ughelli, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan of 60,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel C. is from the village of Ibung, Villa Verde, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Rodel is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodel owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Rodel has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rodel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rodel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Isela

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora Isela C. se ha dedicado a laborar mucho para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y para mantener a su familia que depende de ella. 

Actualmente, la señora Isela busca la manera de cómo mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y lo más ideal y que tiene la necesidad es de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y para ello solicita el crédito para dar lugar a la reconstrucción en especial, la localidad donde tiene su cocina ya que no está en buenas condiciones por lo que decidió iniciar esta obra para sentirse muy satisfecha con este logro y lograr que sus hijos se sientan alegres.
texts.en:
Isela C. lives in the town of San Rafael del Sur. She has always worked very hard to bring sustenance to her home and to support her family that depend on her. Currently, she would like to improve her children's quality of life and the most ideal way of doing this is to make improvements on her dwelling. She is requesting financing to bring about these improvements, especially in the kitchen which is not in very good condition. This is why she decided to start this project so that she can feel satisfied with her achievement and see that her children feel cheerful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Mana Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mana está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras y muy competentes que desde muy tempranas horas están realizando sus labores. Ellas son Karla B. Flores quien comenzó vendiendo refresco y luego se introdujo a comercializar  productos de la marca Avon y zapatos, Susana María A. vende tortillas y frijoles, Nelly Socorro Palacio B. tiene una pulpería  y Estela Z. S. comercializa jocotes y pinolillo.

Ellas esperan el próximo año seguir trabajando y progresar para ello invertirán este presta y su dedicación a sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Mana" is formed by 4 hardworking and competent women who rise early to begin their work. They are: Karla B. Flores, who sells drinks and markets Avon brand products and shoes; Susana Maria A., who sells tortillas and beans; Nelly Socorro Palacio B., who has a small grocery store; and Estela Z. Sanchez, who sells plums and pinolillo (a typical Nicaraguan drink made of roasted corn flour and cocoa.) They expect that next year they will continue to work and progress, to accomplish this they will invest this loan and dedicate themselves to their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Saimuhammad

texts.en: T. Saimuhammad is 26 years old. He is a market vendor. He sells men’s shoes and clothing at the market. With over a year of working at the market, Saimuhammad already has enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Saimuhammad is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. Today he is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. For this purpose, he requests $2,700. Saimuhammad promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him. Be an important part of the growth of Saimuhammad’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for selling

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna M., age 37, and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Khiev, 39, (pictured together) were married in 1993 and have three children: one son and two daughters. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.
	
Vanna is a farmer and grows jasmine flowers on her farmland. Besides farming, she also sells jasmine flowers at the market in Phnom Penh. Some she buys from farmers in the village for resale, some are from her own farm. Her husband has been a construction worker for eighteen years, working in the village.

Vanna is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$1,100 to purchase jasmine flowers from farmers on contract. She needs to pay money to the farmers first before the harvest season.

loans.use: To purchase jasmine flowers from farmers under contract

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis Angel A. M., tiene la edad de 55 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. Tiene dos hijos uno de 33 y otro de 27 años.El crédito lo quiere para preparar el terreno para sembrar los tubérculos, específicamente ñampí, la idea es además de preparar el terreno, es comprar cal y otros insumos para poder realizar la siembra. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento a las 5 hecctéras del cultivo y lograr una mejor calidad, para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Luis Angel  trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. 

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Luis Angel A. M. is 55 years old, is married and lives with his wife. He has 2 children, 33 and 27 years old. He wants this loan to prepare his land to sow tubers, particularly ñampí. The idea is, apart from preparing the land, to also buy lime and other products to complete the sowing. Luis wants to give adequate maintenance to his 5 hectares of crops and achieve a better quality of crop to obtain the best earnings possible when it is time to harvest. This is the first time he has sought a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very content with the facilities that they have granted. Don Luis Angel has worked in agriculture for many years. His hope for the future is to give his family a better quality of life and better economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: www.FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sowing tubers

loans.name: Halim

texts.en:
Halim is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and two brothers. He has owned a car-body repair shop in his village since 2007 having learned this occupation from a friend. With his business income, he provides, along with his father and brothers, for the living expenses of the family.

Since its start, Halim’s business operation has grown. Thus he wants to take a loan of $1,200 to buy additionA. new tools to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy an additional new tools

loans.name: Cité De La Gloire Plus Group

texts.en:
Huguettes’s main business is selling vegetables in a market to the west of Kinshasa. She earns $480 per month. Since 1994, she has acquired solid experience in this area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day becoming a vegetable provider in her community. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. 

Huguettes is a trustworthy client of the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying vegetables and reselling them at a profit.

Huguettes is the director of the group “Cité de la Gloire Plus” made up of 26 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her business in order to reinforce the working capital

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 38-year-old father of four. He runs a retail shop and offers telephone services in his shop. He has been in this business for 10 years. He also runs a video production and a photography studio to earn extra income.  He previously took out seven loans from Faulu Kenya, which he used to expand his business and he successfully repaid.   He hopes to grow his business and improve his living standard in the future.  He has requested a loan of Kes 90,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy mobile phone calling cards and phone accessories to sell.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and calling cards

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama T. prepares 'Fante kenkey' (a staple maize dish) for sale and distribution at Abura.  Ama has received junior high education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband works in a soap-making factory. 

Ama has been selling 'Fante kenkey' for some time now. She helps her husband in taking good care of themselves and the children. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution. She hopes to use the new income from her business to save if possible to operate a 'kenkey' factory where she would produce and distribute to customers.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey'

loans.name: Elizabeth Akoth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Akoth O. owns a stationery store in Rongo town. Before starting this business in 2002, Elizabeth use to sell second hand clothes. She says the income from second hand clothing sales was not sufficient compared to her new profitable stationery business. She buys her stock in Nairobi every six weeks.

Elizabeth is 52 years old, married, and blessed with seven (7) children, whom she wants to educate to the highest level. To do this, she decided to join KMET microfinance program. She wishes to get a loan worth KES50,000 to increase her stock and ensure an increase in income.

Her future dream is to expand her business by building and owning rental housing. This would see her become financially independent.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Jeanette De Los Angeles

texts.es: Jeanette De Los Ángeles tiene 40 años, tiene 3 hijos que todavía están bajo su cargo. Empezó a ser comerciante desde muy joven ya que toda su familia es comerciante ella también quiso ser igual y tener sus propios ingresos. Invirtió en ciertos productos como ropa, calzado, cosméticos entre otras cosas, siempre le ha gustado ofrecer a sus clientes una amplia variedad de productos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio y esto le ha ayudado en su vida personal. El financiamiento es para la compra de productos varios, por lo que ya tiene algunos pedidos. Su deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jeanette De Los Ángeles is 40 years old and has three dependent children. As a young woman, she began working as a merchant since everyone else in her family was in the same line of work and had their own businesses. She invested in certain products such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other items. Jeanette always enjoys offering her customers a wide variety of products. She has plenty of experience in this business which has been a great help in her personal life.

This loan will be used to buy various products to fulfill a few existing orders. She hopes to finish the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy a variety of merchandise

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy C., a widow at 58, is making sure that her family has enough provision for its daily needs. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own longganisa (native pork sausage) and dried fish business for quite some time now.
Percy has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance for her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. Percy is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her food business.
To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 17,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying raw ingredients and the minimal equipment needed to continue production. Percy dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can renovate her house, which is going to be her legacy to her only child.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients and equipment needed to continue production

loans.name: Armel Chrysler

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 32 ans,marié père d'une fille de 2ans, par manque de moyen financier il arrette ses etudes au secondaire et il commence  la vente des produits pharmaceutiques en 2002 avec un capital de 4000f.,il s'approvisionne dans les grands depots pharmaceutiques de la place, il vend en moyenne 10.000 frs par jour.

Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir  il va acheter des cartons de glucose; des solutions salees ,des produits de malaria, des produits diarrheiques, alcool, bétadine,comprimés paracétamols,quinines à et autres produits de premieres nécessitées.

Avec les bénéfices que ses ventes vont générées, il va améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille,
Continuer dans cette activité est son soucis majeur, il veut a la longue ouvrir une grande pharmacie ,dans son milieu  social,il est connu  parmi les jeunes qui se débrouillent.
texts.en:
He is 32, married with a two-year-old daughter. He couldn't afford to finish high school, and in 2002 began selling pharmaceuticals with an investment of F4000. He buys his stock from large downtown pharmacies, and his daily turnover averages F10,000. With the loan he hopes to receive, he will buy boxes of glucose, saline solution, anti-malarial and anti-diarrhea medications, alcohol, betadine, paracetamol pills, quinine and other basics. With the profits that his sales should generate, he will improve his family's living conditions. In the short term he will keep up his present activity, but in the long term he wants to open a large pharmacy. In his social circle he is well known among young people trying to get on in lifee.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pharmaceuticals:  glucose, saline, malaria products, anti-diarrhea medication.

loans.name: Las Mariposas De La Posta Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "Las mariposas de la posta", decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la colonia en donde viven y también por que son mujeres muy unidas, esta historia es acerca de la señora Marisela López Hernández ella es parte de este grupo, es casada, tiene 2 hijos uno de 3 y  otra de 9 años la niña estudia la primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de torrillas hechas a mano desde hace un año.
 
Doña Marisela decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenia la necesidad de hacerlo, pues no tenia la solvencia económica, suficiente para la educación de sus 2 hijos ella decidió invertir el crédito en la compra de mas ingredientes para la preparación de las tortillas como son: maíz y leña ya que es lo mas indispensable.
 
Su negocio le esta beneficiando mucho ya que de sus ganancias esta sacando para pagar los estudios de sus hijos, también esta Ahorrando para invertir en un local para poder poner una tortillería y darle trabajo a las personas de su comunidad. 
 
Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que poder poner su tortillería, también quiere seguir apoyando a su hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando y terminen su carrera, para así hacerse de un mejor futuro.
 
Platica que todas sus compañeras, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todas se conocen y no tienen ningún problema entre ellas.
 
Dice que esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con FRAC, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, asi poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
 
Las personas que integran el grupo de las mariposas de la posta y las actividades en las que invirtieron su crédito son:
Divina G. R.-venta por catalogo
Ana Maria Hernández G.-antojitos (representante del grupo)
Ernestina L. Sánchez-deposito de refresco
Maria Elena López garcía-antojitos
Verónica L. Hernández-abarrotes
Lidia M. Jiménez-materias primas
Marisela López Hernández-materias primas
Juana O. Hernández-abarrotes
Humberto R. Vásquez-quesos
Merced lucina Gutiérrez B.-perfumería
texts.en:
This group is named "Las Mariposas de la Posta". They decided to give it that name because that is the name of the neighborhood they live in and also because they are very united women. This story is about Mrs.Marisela López Hernández, who is a part of this group. She is married and has two children, a 3 year old son and a 9 year old girl. Her daughter goes to elementary school and Marisela has been selling handmade tortillas for a year. Marisela decided to start this business out of neccesity. She wasn't financially stable enough to educate her 2 children. She decided to invest the loan in purchasing more ingredients for the torilla preparation, such as: corn and firewood, which are the most indispensable things. Her business is benefitting her a lot since with her earnings she is able to pay for her children's education. She is also saving up to invest in a locale to be able to open a tortilla shop and provide work for the people in her community. She wants to keep investing in the business to open her tortilla shop and she also wants to keep supporting her children so that they can keep going to school and finish their studies and have a better future. She remarks that all of her fellow members are responsible people who make their payments. They all know each other and have no problems among themselves. She says that she is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and to FRAC, since thanks to them she is getting ahead and has been able to have her own business, and support her children's educations. The people in the Mariposas de la Posta group and the activities they invested their loan in are: Divina G. R.- Catalog Sales Ana Maria Hernández G.-Snacks (group representative) Ernestina L. Sánchez-beverage stand Maria Elena López García-snacks Verónica L. Hernández-groceries Lidia M. Jiménez-raw materials Marisela López Hernández-raw materials Juana O. Hernández-groceries Humberto R. Vásquez-cheeses Merced Lucina Gutiérrez B.-perfume

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for the preparation of tortillas, such as: corn and firewood

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Rowena is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. Her business consists primarily of selling snack foods like grilled banana kebabs in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rowena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rowena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Simon Kaila Ole

texts.en:
Simon Kaila Ole N. is 33 years old. He is married to Mary N. and he is the father of four school-going children. Simon is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last ten years.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is a registered  KADET client in his area of residence. This will be his first loan of which he is planning  to spend forty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for his ten acre wheat farm and the remaining twenty thousand shillings to spray the wheat.

He is anticipating  to buy some farm machinery with the anticipated profit from the expanded farming activity.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and chemicals and spray the wheat

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío El Sandial, una zona agrícola situada en el distrito de Pítipo, provincia de Ferreñafe. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. Especialmente en el rubro de ganadería, el cría vacas para aprovechar la leche que producen, la cual comercializa con un acopiador de la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de maíz. Con estas actividades el sostiene los gastos económicos de su familia por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantenerlas.

Elmer desea adquirir alimento balanceado para aumentar la producción de su ganado, para lograr este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Con esta inversión el podrá mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. El es una persona tranquila y responsable. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien de confianza y servicial.
texts.en:
Elmer is a 27 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the “El Sandial” Hamlet, an agricultural zone located in the Pítipo province of Ferreñafe. This area is located more than an hour from Chiclayo. He’s been involved in agricultural activities since he was young, especially in raising livestock. He raises cattle so that he can take advantage of the milk they produce, which he sells to a consolidator in the zone. He also raises corn. It is through these means that he supports his family financially, and always gives his all to support them. Elmer wants to buy balanced feed in order to increase the production of his livestock. In order to accomplish this objective, he has seen fit to request his first loan of 1,000 PEN, through Edpyme Alternativa. This investment will allow him to improve his business and quality of life. He is a calm, responsible person. People in his zone know him as someone of trust and servitude.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animal feed

loans.name: Aynash

texts.en:
Aynash M. lives in the southern Kyrgyz city of Osh. She is 41, married and has three children. Two of them are students and the youngest son is a schoolboy. She graduated from Osh State University with the major in Kyrgyz philology (the study of literary texts and written records). Taking into account that salaries of teachers are very low and do not cover expenses of the families, Aynash decided to start her own business in shoe sales. She started with the sum of only 600 Kyrgyz soms (KGS) and bought several rubber boots for reselling. Aynash explored every avenue in her wish to support her children and achieved success – her two little shops became known by their wide assortments of shoes, where every client could find his favorite model.  

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Aynash lost her business, which was fully destroyed. Her shops were robbed and looted. 

In spite of this severe test she went through, Aynash is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this very reason, Aynash is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity. She plans to purchase shoes to resell at the local market. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase shoes for retail

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Hope Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en: J. Jude belongs to Hope Development Group-Mpigi. He is 34 years old. It is now close to 7 years since he began his clothing sales business in the town of Mpigi. He sells mostly ladies clothes and he rationalizes that women are people of flamboyance and sassiness who always want to look good.  He therefore thinks that selling ladies clothes would fetch him more money. Jude supplements his boutique profits with money from working at a petrol station. Jude is married with 3 kids. With this loan, he says he is going to re-energize his business by making bulk purchases of new ladies clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to resell

loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora Martha Magdalena S. H.,  inicia como vendedora ambulante entregando mercancía a los demás comerciantes fijos, con un capital de C$ 1,000.00 producto de ahorros. La señora S. viaja 2 veces por semana a Chinandega a comprar nueva mercadería.
Este crédito fue utilizado para  compra de productos como chinelas, zapatos, etc.
La señora Martínez se siente muy satisfecha y agradecía con los créditos que CEPRODEL le ha podido brindar ya que ha podido surtir su negocio con nuevos productos y así poder tener mayor clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Magdalena S. H. started as a street vendor selling merchandise to stores with a capital of C$1.000.00 from her savings. She travels twice a week to Chinandega to buy new merchandise. 

This loan will be used to buy items like slippers and shoes. Mrs. Martinez has been very grateful and satisfied with the loans given by CEPRODEL because they have allowed her to stock her business with new items which increase her clientele.

loans.use: Purchase of slippers and shoes

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
la sra. Esperanza R. tiene 66 años de edad, vive en el Barrio los Jasminez en la comunidad de Trojes el Paraiso, Esperanza se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan casero, su especialidad es la torta de queso, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, Esperanza es muy famosa por el pan que elabora ya que tiene un muy buen sabor, los años de experiencia hacen que su pan sea cada vez mejor, tiene muchos clientes fijos todos los meses.
su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion ahi tiene los hornos de barro en donde hace todo su producto.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de los ricos panes. las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esperanza R. is 66 years old, and lives in the Jasmines Section, in the Trojes el Paraíso community.  Esperanza’s business is making and selling home-made bread, and her specialty is cheesecake.  She has been doing this for many years, and is famous for the bread she makes, which has excellent flavor.  With her years of experience, her bread has constantly improved, and each month she has many regular customers.  Her business is located in her home, which is where she has the clay ovens where she produces the bread.
She will use the loan to buy additional materials to make her tasty breads.  She needs the earnings to cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, yeast, soda, egss, butter, margarine, sugar, flavoring, cheese

loans.name: Pastora Domitila

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Trabajadoras. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

La señora Pastora esta en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le agrada el Banco por los beneficios que este le brinda. Ella tiene 50 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 8 hijos,  siete ya son mayores de edad, solo la ultima que tiene 17 años vive con ella. Su marido es agricultor.

Ella y su esposo  se dedican tanto al comercio como a la agricultura, en lo que es comercio compran a agricultores de la zona maní, achiote, limón, tomate, etc.  y luego lo transportan hasta Quito y Ambato, allá entregan a comerciantes de los mercados, esto lo realizan una vez a la semana y el resto de los días se dedican a lo que es la agricultura, siembran en el verano cultivos de ciclo corto como tomate, verduras y en invierno siembran maíz, maní, etc. en el campo tienen la ayuda de dos personas que trabajan de lunes a viernes con ellos.

Este crédito es para comprar maní, achiote, limón, tomate y semillas para sembrar en invierno que esta próximo. Su sueño es  tener un camión para llevar los productos ya que en el que ahora utiliza es fletado.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mujeres Trabajaras” (Hardworking Women) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets that the villagers make.  The sweets are recognized throughout the entire country.

Mrs. Pastora has been in the communal bank since it started.  She is pleased with the benefits that the bank offers her.  She is 50 years old, and she is in a common-law marriage.  They have eight children.  Seven of them are grown.  Only the last one, 17 years old, lives with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

She and her husband work in commerce and in agriculture.  For their commerce business they buy peanuts, annatto, lemons, and tomatoes, etc. from farmers in the area.  They then take them to Quito and Ambato, and they deliver to merchants in the markets.  They do this once a week.  On the rest of the days they do agricultural work.  In the summer they plant short cycle crops like tomatoes and vegetables.  In the winter they plant corn and peanuts, etc.  They have the help of two people who work in the fields with them from Monday through Friday.  

This loan is to buy peanuts, annatto, lemons, tomatoes, and seeds to plant next winter.  Her dream is to have a truck to carry her products because the one they now use is rented.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, annatto, lemons, tomatoes, and seeds

loans.name: Zaira Luz

texts.en:
Zaira is twenty-eight years old.  She shares her home with her husband and their two children.  The family owns their home which is located along the highway in the district of Razuri in the province of Ascope.  It is a desert region primarily populated by small farmers, retailers and other people involved in service sectors.

Zaira is a clothing saleswoman.  She sells clothing in the neighborhood near her home and local markets.  She sells clothing both out of her inventory and on request.  Sometimes she sells clothing on credit, collecting payments from customers on a weekly or bi-weekly basis.  Her clients greatly appreciate this flexibility as it allows them to maintain more stable income and expense streams.

Her husband is a laborer in a local factory.  He earns a stable income and has consistent hours.

This will be Zaira’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional clothing so that she can meet the increased demand during the holiday season.  She hopes to be able to increase her market share and profitability for the long term through this immediate influx of capital.

loans.use: Purchase additional clothing so that she can meet the increased demand during the holiday season

loans.name: Terre Promise Plus Group

texts.en:
Maurice I. Mpango, 63, is the president of the Community Bank “Terre Promise Plus”, which means Promised Land in English. It is composed of 24 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Maurice started his business in 1998 selling beauty cream and miscellaneous products from his location in the north-eastern city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of MFI HOPE RDC and has already received two loans which he repaid properly. As demand is high in his community, he intends to use the next loan to increase his stock of goods and resell them with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $30. His ambition is to become a wholesaler. 

Maurice is married and the father of six children, aged between 14 and 37. Four of his children go to school.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of goods for resale.

loans.name: Klever Antonio

texts.es:
Klever Antonio G. V. tiene 25 años, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Klever Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ser Ingeniero Agroindustrial.

Le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Klever Antonio G. V. is 25. He is single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has no children. 
The members of the V. R. C. Tierra Nuestra ("Our Land") are located in the San Luis de Zapotal region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice. 
Klever Antonio works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in Ecua-Agro and sells them in the same location. 
He is requesting this loan for sowing corn, rice, and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to be an Agroindustrial engineer. 
He enjoys sports.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Salmun

texts.en:
Salmun is a 32 year old man. He works as a scrap metal collector. He has been running this business for almost 3 years, since his first son started to attend school. He used to run a motor-taxi business, but the income was unstable and sometimes wasn’t sufficient to meet his family needs. Salmun then tried to find another way to earn more income. The scrap metal business became the one option for him to generate income. He worked for his brother who had the capital to buy the scrap metal. He bought the scrap metal from the salvagers. The scrap metal will then be resold. Salmun’s income was dependent on the profit of his brother. 

Salmun is the father of 3 children, namely: Ananda, who is 9 years old; Raju, who is 8 years old and Pink, who is 2 years old. As a father, he wants to provide a good life for his wife and children. Salmun is grateful for the business has helped him in meeting his family needs even though the income was not so much. 

Salmun wants to improve his income and this is the reason why he initiated his own business using his own capital. The challenge for Salmun in running the business is the capital limitation. He is now requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000. He plans to use the loan to buy more scrap metal to be sold. He hopes that the loan can support him in improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal to be resold

loans.name: Leticia's Group

texts.en:
Leticia F. is from the village of San Jose Santiago. She is 46 years old and the group leader of a fifteen-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Leticia F.'s group.

Leticia is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nineteen years and earns approximately $138 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leticia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Leticia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of the food items she sells

loans.name: Roqueta

texts.en: Roqueta is a 49-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Lapu-lapu, Cebu. Roqueta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Roqueta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods etc for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Roqueta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, etc for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drums of palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old and has six children, five of whom are grown and live on their own. Her youngest child is 12 and still in school. For the last 12 years, Teresa has made a living by growing vegetables, tea, maize and bananas near her home in Kisii, Kenya. She sells all of her produce in a local market, except for her tea, which she sells to the Kenyan Tea Development Authority. Her main problems at the moment are a slow economy and diseases that sometimes affect her crops.

Teresa is applying for a loan for 35,000 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. She plans to use some of milk it produces at family meals, and will sell the rest in a local market to pay for the education of her youngest child. In the future, she would also like to earn additional money by opening a cereals shop in the local market.

loans.use: To buy and insure a cow

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida belongs to Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 25 years. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Her husband will utilize the loan money in buying milk in larger quantity for selling. His shop is located near his home and he makes good sales every month due to the good quality of milk he provides to his customers.  

He started this business two years ago and it is providing him regular profits. Zubaida is confident that an investment will give more profit to her husband because then he will be able to fulfill the demand of many other customers and make them his regular customers as well.  

Zubaida is a caring lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and also supports her husband financially by weaving carpets. She learnt this skill from her mother and is now transferring this skill to her eldest daughter who is 18 years old and also works with her to complete the orders on time. 
 
Zubaida has given birth to three daughters and a son. Two of her children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida.

loans.use: To buy milk in larger quantity for selling.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma M. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 54 years old. Emma is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as snack foods, canned goods, detergents, shampoo, soap & several kinds of beverages in the local community. She also raises pigs for breeding & sells the piglets in the future. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Jean is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Jean has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jean is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Jean from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime Antonio tiene su negocio que es la venta de CD y anteojos. Siempre ha sido un hombre trabajador y que ha salido adelante con mucho empeño y sacrificio. Pues inicio con esfuerzos propios y muy pocos productos comenzó la venta de Cd y ahora que también ofrece anteojos, a pesar de que tiene que recorrer ciertas distancias ha logrado mantener su actividad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de limpia Cd, películas, videos y comprar una gran variedad de anteojos.
texts.en:
Jaime Antonio has a business selling CDs and sunglasses. He has always been known as a hardworking man who is able to get ahead through great effort and sacrifice. Jaime took the initiative to start his business, but he had very few products at the beginning. He sold CDs and now he also offers sunglasses. Despite having to travel great distances, he has been able to maintain his business.

The reason for this loan is so that he can buy clean CDs, movies, videos, and a wide variety of sunglasses.

loans.use: to purchase music discs, movies, videos, and a wide variety of sunglasses.

loans.name: Topista's Group

texts.en:
Topista is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Topista has a small hotel that sells food, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Topista has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cups and food for the hotel. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Topista hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house.
Topista is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by generating more capital from her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cups and food for the hotel.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene 41 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre sencillo, vive en su casa propia junto a Marlene, su esposa desde hace 2 años. Pero convivió durante 12 años para dar el gran paso de unir sus vidas. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Luis y Maycol a los que cuidan mucho. Las tierras del caserío de Cayan, se caracterizan por producir toda variedad de papa. Ahí Emilio comenzó desde hace 8 años a sembrar papa y poner en práctica todo lo enseñado por sus padres. En sus terrenos agrícolas siembra 2 veces al año. La primera en “tierras temporales”, llamadas así por aprovechar las temporadas de lluvia, donde los frutos crecen solos sin tener que ser regados, la segunda en “tierras de regadillo”, que pueden ser sembrados durante cualquier tiempo, ya que tiene agua a disposición. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar con mucho esmero de sus productos, ya que ve concretizado su trabajo en cada cosecha donde vende al mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Además de tener 2 toros “novillos” (de 3 años de edad), con los que labra la tierra, para si mismo y para otros que le pagan un dinero extra, según cuenta S/. 60 soles al día. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de papa de la variedad “andina”, por lo que está seguro podrá obtener buenos resultados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus proyectos. Por ello se compromete en cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas. Emilio de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con la siembra de papa “yungay”.
texts.en:
Emilio, 41, lives in the rural village of Cayan.  He is a simple man and lives in his own house with his wife, Marlene.  They have been married for two years but had lived together for 12 years before tying the knot.  They have two children, Luis and Maycol, who they care for lovingly.  The Cayan farm lands are known for their different variety of potatoes.  There Emilio began growing potatoes eight years ago and puts into practice everthing he learned from his parents.  He plants twice a year.  The first during the rainy season when crops grow without having to be watered, and the second in the watering season when they grow any time but with irrigation.

What he enjoys most about his work is taking care of his produce because he feels like he has done a good job each harvest time when he goes to the wholesale market in town.  He also has two young oxen (3 years old) that he uses to plow the fields.  He plows for himself and for others who pay him extras money, around S/.60 per day.  He is now preparing to plant the "andina" variety and is sure he will get good results.  He belongs to the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús" and this is his second loan through MFP, where he counts on your help for his projects.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  The loan will be used to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting his "yungay" potato.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Cesar Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar es un cliente antiguo, vive en la zona el Tejar vive en la casa de  su madre en la misma dirección tiene su taller de soldar escapes don cesar esta muy contento de  haber sido  aprobado su crédito El Sr. cesar esta  casado con la señora Noemí que también tiene su propia actividad  ella vende café tiene un puesto en la misma avenida. El crédito necesita para comprar un oxigeno para soldar. Lo cual le será de mucha utilidad ya que  tiene mucha demanda de clientes y no pude abastecer  con lo que tiene por el momento, cesar es  muy trabajador se levanta desde muy temprano para seguir adelante  de esta manera solventarse económicamente.
texts.en: Cesar is a long-time client. He lives in the region of Tejar and he lives in his mother's house. He has a soldering shop at the same address. Cesar is very happy to have been approved to receive a loan. Cesar is married with Noemi. She also has her own business. She sells coffee from a stand located on the same street. He needs the loan to purchase a cylinder of oxygen used for soldering. It will be of great help especially because he has much demand from his clients and he cannot keep up with what he currently has. Cesar is a very hardworking man who starts his days very early in the morning to keep earning an income.

loans.use: to purchase a cylinder of oxygen used for soldering.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rose has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business. 

 Rose is a member of BRAC’s Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Marilou has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy boxes of dried fish to sell.
Marilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Felipe Rafael

texts.es: Felipe Rafael brinda el servicio de sastrería que está ubicada en su vivienda desde hace diez años. Lo aprendió desde muy joven en un taller y fue así que trabajo mucho tiempo en esta actividad fue con el paso del tiempo que logro independizarse y con esfuerzo propio logro comprar sus máquina. El crédito es para la compra de hilos, telas, tijeras, agujas. Uno de sus sueños es mejorar su vivienda y lograr proporcionar más empleo con su negocio.
texts.en: Felipe Rafael offers a sewing service that has been located in his home for 10 years.  He learned how to sew when he was very young in a sewing shop and has worked a long time doing this work.  As time passed, he managed to become independent, through his hard work, he was able to buy his machine.  He will use this credit to buy thread, fabric, scissors, and needles.  One of his dreams it to make improvements to his home and to be able to hire more employees for his business.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, scissors, and needles.

loans.name: Lovinsa

texts.en:
Lovinsa is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is single and has 5 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Lovinsa has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fish at the local market. 

To help expand her business, Lovinsa has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchases fish for resale and will help Lovinsa to generate greater profits and hiring more workers. Lovinsa hopes that in the future she will be able to start another business. 

Lovinsa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lovinsa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 32 is a skillful hairdresser and has been doing this job for 8 years. He lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, located in the slum district of  Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He will become a father soon and will be responsible for his family. 
He plans to expand his business by opening new locations around the districts of Ulaanbaatar. 
Last April, Enkhbaatar bought a small-sized plot of land near his barbershop which is necessary for his job and family. Then, he started building a branch of his barber shop as well as his own house. Unfortunately, the project suddenly stopped due to lack of money for building materials. Opening the new branch of his barber shop is very important to expanding in the market and his business future. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to open the new location for his barber shop business.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials to build a new location for his barber shop business.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 36-year-old lady. She is married to Malek who works as a food products distributor. 
Samar is a housewife who has dedicated all of her time to raise her four children. For this reason, she couldn’t manage to find a full-time job, so she thought of a business that she can do from her home. She decided on a breeding business for speciA. types of birds that can be sold for a high price.
She has been running the business for a year now with the support of Malek. Samar has now applied for a loan to buy more birds such as canary birds to increase her profits and open a speciA. store for selling birds.
Since Samar is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Malek appeared in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more birds such as canary birds to increase her profits and open a special store for selling birds.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en Acción se denomina el excelente grupo D. mujeres conformado en la ciudad D. Itá, gracias a  la Sra. Esmeralda,  contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona para enterarse D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras. Una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el  sexto ciclo ,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Esmeralda tiene una despensa, mediante la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes, los cuales siempre compran D. ella, gracias a eso a ido creciendo cada día mas y mas. Desea poder seguir con su negocio por lo que animo a solicitar el crédito.
Desea el préstamo para el abastecimiento D. su despensa con comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás para tener mayor variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres en Acción is the name of an excellent group of women in the city of Itá. Esmeralda founded the group when she contacted the advisor for another weekly meeting in the area to find out about the work that the Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras [Committee of Women Entrepreneurs] does. Once she'd learned about the program, she got together 17 women who are now happily in their sixth loan cycle with the program.
Esmeralda has a small grocery store whose profits are enough to enable her to support her family. She says that she has many customers who always buy from her, so her business is growing day by day. She would like to keep going with her business, which is why she's requesting the loan. She intends to use the loan to stock her shop with foods, beverges, dairy products, and other goods in order to have a wiD. variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy foods, beverages, and dairy products.

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en:
Sahak is 43 years old. He is married and has a son and three daughters. Sahak lives with his family in the Koti village Ijevan area. Since finishing his education and time in the army, Sahak and his parents have been engaged in farming and animal breeding in their native Koti village. 

Sahak's wife helps him in farming and takes care of their kids. Sahak keeps pigs and cows for meat and milk. Sahak is very appreciated for the agricultural and animal breeding business and, thanks to his profit, Sahak can meet his family's needs.
 
Sahak needs a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a lot of fodder for winter for his pigs and cows.

loans.use: To buy winter fodder for his pigs and cows.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is married with eight children aged 2-16, living in his own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. His goal is to educate his children up to the university level.

Anatoli has been running a cattle buying and selling business for the past eight years. He started by purchasing one cow at a time and now he has the capacity to purchase up to four cows at once. He faces a challenge of price fluctuation and hopes that his business will, in the future, have enough capital to purchase at least ten cows. He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Mana Ida

texts.fr:
Mana Ida est une femme âgé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur et eurent ensemble 01 enfant.
Mana Ida travaille comme revendeuse d’huile de palme depuis 1989. Elle vend en gros et détail à ses clients à la maison et achète ses marchandises à l’intérieur du pays.
Mana Ida a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter 20 bidons d’huile de palme.
Dans les prochaines années, Mana Ida voudrait avoir sa propre boutique et  exporter ses produits dans le monde. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut aider son mari dans les charges du ménage et assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant.
texts.en:
Mana Ida is a 38-year-old woman who is married to a driver. They have one child together. Mana Ida has been selling palm oil since 1989. She conducts her sales from her home, wholesale and retail, and she buys her merchandise within the country.

Mana Ida is seeking her second loan from WAGES to buy 20 jugs of palm oil. In the coming years, she would like to have her own shop and export her products worldwide. She plans to use the profits to help her husband with the household expenses and ensure a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale

loans.name: Alpha

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui vend des chaussures et des habits au marché central de sa localité.Il s'approvisionne en gros dans la capitale et revend ses articles au détail. Il parvient à obtenir des bénéfices qui lui assurent une bonne prise en charge de ses petits frères et sœurs qui sont tous à sa charge. Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce , il sollicite un prêt de 400000f pour acheter trois caisses de chaussures et des pantalons "jean". Son ambition est d'ouvrir une seconde cantine.
texts.en:
Alpha is a young bachelor. He sells shoes and clothing at the central market in his town. He buys his supplies wholesale in the capital, and retails his products.

He manages to turn a profit that enables him to take good care of his younger brothers and sisters, whom he has to support.

To bolster his business, he's seeking a loan of XOF 400'000 in order to buy three boxes of shoes and jeans. He ambitions to open a second shop.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of shoes and jeans

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 48 years old father of three sons and two daughters.  He is an employee with a decent salary and also works in agriculture to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions. 

Hussien has a piece of land and wants to plant olives and almonds seedlings, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN to purchase these seedlings. 

This will give him more crops in the future to sell and will increase his income to create a better family life.

loans.use: to plant olives and almonds seedlings.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina, 33, lives in Ijevan with her family: her husband, three school-aged children and her parents-in-law. After graduation from Ijevan College, where she got her accountancy qualification, she married, so she didn’t work in her specialty.

Since 2010, Irina has rented a workshop where she bakes various confectioneries. Irina fulfills private orders and she has many regular costumers as her products are always very delicious and high quality. Irina’s husband helps her as much as possible and thus they provide for their family.

Irina is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to buy a new stove and ingredients for her production. Before the New Year’s holidays, she always has a lot of orders and a new stove will help her to bake better confectionery.

loans.use: to buy a new stove and ingredients for her production.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 49 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle a 2 enfants.
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1991. Elle vend des œufs pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé, Vogan et Djagble. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Akoua a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des œufs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Akoua voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoua is a 49-year-old woman. She is a widow. She has two children.

Akoua has been working as a vendor since 1991. From her home, she sells eggs to a wide array of customers. She buys the products in Lomé, Vogan and Djagble. She works by herself. At the moment, she has no problems.

Akoua is asking for her first loan through WAGES in order to buy eggs. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Akoua would like to open a shop. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs

loans.name: Teresa Maria

texts.es:
