La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,ella vende polos,pantalones,blusas y casacas y tambien vende lenceria como truzas y medias,ella tiene un pequeño stand en el mercado donde vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio donde pueda vender.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos,casacas,pantalones y blusas al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa Maria continues to sell clothing. She sells polo shirts, pants, blouses, and coats, and she also sells lingerie such as underwear and pantyhose. She has a small stand in the market where she sells from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. Her dream is to have a larger store where she can sell. She is asking for the loan to buy wholesale polo shirts, coats, pants, and blouses. 

She is happy for the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale polo shirts, coats, pants, and blouses

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Gemma has a computer shop that provides Internet and online computer games. She has had this business for four years. 

She requested a loan for 18,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

loans.name: Felisicima

texts.en:
Felisicima is 57 years old and lives in Maikay,Tudela. Felicisima is married with 4 children. 
Felicisima has a general store that sells a variety of products. Felicisima has had this business for 5 years. Felicisima requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Felisicima has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future,Felisicima hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents

loans.name: 010120Thôn Hợp Tân- Hoằng Phụ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xinh is the leader of a 4-member group, the Thôn thành xuân - Hoằng Trường solidarity group. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish for resale. Xinh has been involved in this business for more than ten years.
Xinh is 41 years old. She is married and has two children. Xinh supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2006, Xinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid seven loans from the Fund.
The main hardship that Xinh faces in her business is a lack of capital. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, in order to make enough money to provide for her kids and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a forty three-year-old man; he is married to Elizabeth and blessed with four children.  He owns a workshop in the Zambezi market on the outskirts of Kangemi. He has been in the business for ten years, and gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This will be his fourth loan with KADET LTD; he plans to use the entire loan to purchase trappers and other working tools. 

He wants to expand the business with the profits, and reach more clients. In future, he wants to be a prosperous business man.

loans.use: To buy trappers

loans.name: Edinan Group

texts.fr: EDINAN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marie-Geneviève (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et ne vit plus avec son mari. Marie-Geneviève est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie-Geneviève a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Il y a une dizaine d'année, Marie-Geneviève mène comme activité la vente de fruits et légumes de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Marie-Geneviève vend des chaussures et des bijoux. Marie-Geneviève achète ses produits au Bénin et à Lomé. C'est la première fois que Marie-Geneviève et les autres membres du groupe EDINAN sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des bijoux, des fruits et légumes.

loans.name: Sabira

texts.ru: Сабира, 62 года, вдова, есть 4 детей. У Сабиры среднее образование. Она на пенсии, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она 30 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сабиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы. Есть яблоневый сад. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет примерно 15,000 сом (KGS), этого не хватает на достойную жизнь Сабиры, дети помогают во всем, но Сабире хочется быть самостоятельной, поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и улучшение материального благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Sabira is 62 years old, widowed, and has four children. Sabira has a secondary education. She is retired, and she started working in animal husbandry 30 years ago in order to provide supplementary income for her family. 

Thanks to Sabira's persistent hard work, today on the farm there are four cows. There is also an apple orchard. The monthly income from the business is about 15,000 som (KGS), which is not enough to provide adequately for Sabira. Her children help with everything, but Sabira wants to be independent. 

Thus, in order to further develop her farm, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two heifers. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further increase of the number of livestock she has, as well as the improvement of her family's material welfare.

loans.use: to buy two heifers in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret wants to buy two young bulls

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is divorced and has two children. Her main source of income is from a small business she runs selling sewing, quilting and embroidery supplies in one of the local markets. She has been in business for 9 years. Alla has been working with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2005. She has received and promptly repaid 9 loans with no defaults. Financial assistance has promoted growth in her sales and the expansion of her business. Competitive prices and top-quality merchandise have helped her gain many loyal customers. Currently, Alla has about $2,800 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $500. Alla would like to receive a loan of $900 to increase her working capital. She is planning to purchase buttons, fringe, elastic, feathers, lace and sequin trims, thread, zippers, needles and pins in bulk for further retail sale. Alla believes a wide assortment of ethnic textiles, dancewear fabrics, beads and different accessories will attract many more potential clients to her kiosk. The loan will not only increase her working capital and sales, but will promote the continued expansion of Alla’s business.

Алла – розлучена, в неї двоє дітей. В неї є власний бізнес з продажу товарів для шиття, в’язання та вишивання на одному з місцевому ринків. Алла займається цим бізнесом вже на протязі 9 років. Алла співпрацює з „Надією України” з 2005 року. Вона отримала та вчасно сплатила 9 позик без жодних прострочень. Фінансова допомога сприяла збільшенню обсягів продажу та розширенню її бізнесу. Прийнятні ціни та високоякісні товари допомогли їй знайти багато відданих клієнтів. Зараз в Алли приблизно 2800 доларів робочого капіталу. Щомісячний прибуток складає 500 доларів. Алла хотіла б отримати позику в 900 доларів для того, щоб збільшити робочий капітал. Вона планує закупити ґудзики, бахрому, гумові матеріали, пір’я, тасьму, блискітки, нитки, застібки, голки та шпильки оптом задля подальшої роздрібної торгівлі. Алла вважає, що великий асортимент тканин з українськими візерунками, необхідних дрібничок для танцювальних костюмів, намистинок та різноманітних аксесуарів приваблять багато потенціальних клієнтів до її кіоску. Позика не тільки збільшить її робочий капітал та обсяги продажів, але й сприятиме подальшому зростанню бізнесу Алли.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
F. is married and has six children. His recognition of the poor living condition of his family (seen in poor feeding habits, housing, clothing, constant sickness, and inability to pay school fees) is strength and a source of motivation for him to engage in income-generating activities in pig farming. The success registered so far is due the availability of local feeding materials. He is a third-time borrower. With his two previous loans, he succeeded in providing the community with manure and fresh raw foodstuffs. Benefits from his investment were primarily used for tuition. He succeeded in reducing the number of times his children were sent out of class for fee-drive. His immediate goal is to provide the basics of food, tuition, and clothing to his family.

Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy ten piglets, feed, and medication and set aside some money for vet services for pigs. He plans to provide his community with large quantities of manure.

He plans to pay his loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: production of piglets and fattening of pigs for sale

loans.name: Anassi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Anassi N. was born in 1969 in Lomé (Togo). She is married and mother of 5 children. Her palm oil and smoked fish business allows her to contribute to the family's living expenses. Her business is flourishing but it does require a certain amount of capital.

In view of the demands of her clientele, she is asking for a loan of $600 with which she will procure larger quantities of oil and fish and also add condiments to her inventory. This will permit her to increase her profit and better cater for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame N. Anassi est née en 1969 à Lomé (P/Golfe). Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son commerce d’huile de palme et de poissons fumés l’aide à contribuer aux charges du ménage. C’est une activité florissante mais qui nécessite assez de moyen.

Devant l’exigence de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un apport financier de $600 pour s’approvisionner en quantité d’huile et de poissons et ajouter d’autres condiments nécessaires à la cuisine. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling palm oil and smoked fish

loans.name: Akhtar Mohammad

texts.en: Akhtar Mohammad lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he is also studying at the university. He has a shoe shop where he works part-time. He wants to enlarge his shop, so he wants to take an individual loan to increase his stock to attract more clients. He wants to make a good future for himself and support his family. He is happy that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in highly sought after products

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. S. San (age 37) was married in 1987 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. He is currently in the business of farming and selling cows. He learned his skill from his friend in 1998. His wife, Mrs.That Oun (age 38) weaves silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her relative in 2006 and began her silk production in the same year. They both are committed to their children gaining higher education.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA for first time in the amount of $500. He will use this money to purchase cows to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for reselling

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Mrs. Magdalena has owned a taco stand for over two years. “This business is my family’s sole source of income since I’m a single mother of 3 children. I am requesting this loan in order to buy furniture for my taco stand, thus allowing me to offer better service and more comfort to my customers while they are eating. I am requesting $1,200.00 USD for the purchase of furniture for a taco stand."

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Magdalena tiene un puesto de tacos desde hace ya más de 2 años. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos. Estoy solicitando un préstamo para comprar inmobiliario para el puesto de tacos, así atender mejor a mis clientes y que estén más cómodos al consumir los alimentos. Solicito un préstamo de 1,200.00 Dlls. Para la compra de inmobiliario para el negocio de tacos.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Nine years ago, Sonia began selling chickens along with her ex-boyfriend in the Universal de Vitarte market. With the earnings she made from that business and from EDAPROSPO, she has opened a restaurant selling Chinese and chifa (Peruvian-Cantonese) food for which she hired her cousins. Now that she’s single, Sonia splits her time between her market stall in the mornings and her restaurant in the evenings to be able to provide the best for her two young children. Today, Sonia’s goal is to complete the purchase of her market stall and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hace nueve años, Sonia comenzó a vender pollos junto a su ex pareja en el mercado Universal de Vitarte. Gracias a los ingresos que ha recibido del negocio y de EDAPROSPO, ha abierto un restaurante de comida china, chifa, en el que da trabajo a sus primos. Al estar sola, Sonia reparte su tiempo entre la atención de su puesto en el mercado en las mañanas y en las tardes de su chifa; a fin de poderles brindar lo mejor a sus dos menores hijos. Hoy, la meta de Sonia es cerrar la compra de su puesto del mercado y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase a market stall.

loans.name: Prek Deaung I Group

texts.en: This is a group loan that will be shared among 20 members of the Prekdeaung I Village Bank in Kandal Province. Mrs Sokheang S., 48, is a farmer and also the Village Bank president. She is married with four children; three work in a factory, and one is a student.  She and the Village Bank would like to request the loan of $2,575 in order to buy more vegetables to sell every day. All of the people in the picture are the borrowers, except for the two women standing under the tree and the woman who has a child in her arms (they are the owners of the house).

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell at the local market

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel sells clothes since 3 years. She is a street vendor and sells the clothes door-to-door or at the market. Mostly, she sells tennis shoes and pants.

Before, she would spend more time at home and she would sell desserts from time to time, whenever she received orders from people who knew her.

She started her business after getting divorced from her husband. After separating, she needed to work because she did not receive a pension from her ex-husband and she had to raise 5 children still under-age.

Fortunately, she is doing well now, that is why she would like to see her children finish college and to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace tres años Maribel se dedica a vender ropa ofreciéndola de puerta en puerta, ya sea a domicilio o en el mercado. Por lo general, ella vende zapatillas y pantalones.

Antes de esto ella se dedicaba más a su casa, por temporadas vendía postres según recibía pedidos de personas que la conocían. Su negocio de ropas empezó a raíz del divorcio de su esposo. Cuando se separo de él tuvo la necesidad de trabajar ya que no recibía pensión de su esposo y debía mantener a sus cinco hijos aun menores.

Felizmente le va bien por ahora, lo que más quisiera ella es ver a sus hijos terminado el colegio y poder crecer en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Idania María

texts.es:
Idania R., like all Nicaraguan women, stands out for being a very hardworking person, succeeding in the livestock business by breeding pigs, with which she has supported her family for the past five years, offering them the minimum conditions necessary to subsist.

The necessity this woman is facing is the urgent need for financial resources to purchase more pigs. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to acquire the livestock with the goal of breeding them and later selling to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Idania R. como toda mujer nicaragüense se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora sobresaliendo en el negocio de ganadería (crianza de cerdos)con el cual alimenta a su familia desde hace cinco años proporcionándole las condiciones mínimas necesarias para subsistir.

La necesidad que esta dama hoy en día atraviesa es la urgencia de adquisición de recursos económicos para la compra de los cerdos, es por esta razón que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener créditos que le permitan adquirir el ganado con el único fin de criar los terneros para sacarles el máximo provecho para luego venderlos a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase livestock (pigs) for breeding.

loans.name: Navruzgul

texts.en:
R. Navruzgul is 42 years old. She and her husband are raising three children of school ages.

For the last 2 years, Navruzgul has been selling clothing for kids in the local market. Each month, Navruzgul travels to the neighboring city to buy the clothing in order to enlarge and diversify her range of goods. Navruzgul is trying to satisfy the needs of clients with various tastes and income levels. Considering that the husband of Navruzgul is currently unemployed, her business is the main source of income for the family. Navruzgul is working hard and she dreams of educating all of her children, and improving the living conditions of the family.

With this purpose in mind, Navruzgul is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 US) for purchasing new kids clothing for the summer selling season. Navruzgul thanks all for their support and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Navruzgul’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of new kids clothing for the summer selling season.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married, and has five children. Three of them currently attend school. Florence walks to the northern part of Ghana to purchase products and used clothing from Kumasi. She would like to use the loan to purchase more bags of maize and rice to increase her inventory and avoid price hikes. She believes that this loan would help her save money to pay her children’s school fees and register as a member of the government’s health insurance plan.

Florence is a member of a group called Gospel Light. Members support one another in handling and repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari, maize and bales of used clothing

loans.name: Amina's Heshima Group

texts.en:
Amina is 40 years old. She is a married woman with 6 children, ages between 16 and 27. She became a rice and beans seller in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 11pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 50 from her sales.

Amina now hopes for a loan to buy more rice and beans for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Habiba, who also has a business dealing with food vending.

loans.use: To buy more rice and beans to increase her stock

loans.name: Hanifan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is the widow of M. and lives in a city named Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its historical and pious places. Hanifan baji has been living in this city for the last 20 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a daily wage laborer. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She and her family live with her brother who is a driver by profession. Hanifan baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy livestock (goats, cows) to resell. Sharifan baji and Rashida baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella O. is 75 years old. She is a widow with 4 children. All her children are grown up and are happily married. Stella is involved in an interesting business. Stella cooks food for people who have social ceremonies like weddings, funerals and birthday ceremonies. She has lots of cooking utensils like plates, spoons, and big pots for large cooking. Stella has 5 women assisting her in cooking. She buys her foodstuffs like rice, groundnut oil, tomatoes, pepper, and vegetables from New Benin market. Stella loves her business. She is happy whenever people get married and invite her to cook. She hopes for the loan amount of $875 to buy more foodstuffs and cooking utensils. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and cooking                                                                    Utensils  To purchase more foodstuffs and cooking utensils

loans.name: Maritza Ingrid

texts.es:
Con apenas 1 año de abierta su tienda, la señora Ingrid, de 33 años, ha crecido vertiginosamente, para el bien de su familia, conformada por su esposo y su hija de 2 años. Empero del buen comienzo que ha tenido su tienda, le es escaso el capital que puede invertir en mercadería, manteniendo una ínfima cantidad de ganancias, lo que aumenta la preocupación para con su hija y sus futuros años, que la insertarán en el colegio.

Para lograr dicho objetivo y, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en sí, es que necesita de un préstamo de 500 soles.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ingrid is 33 years old and opened her store little more than one year ago. It has grown rapidly in that time, and has benefited her family, which consists of her husband and two year old daughter. In spite of the great start that her store has had, Ingrid lacks the capital to invest in merchandise, which keeps her earnings extremely low. Because of this, Ingrid worries about her daughter and the upcoming years, when she'll start school. To achieve this objective and improve the quality of life for her family, Ingrid needs a loan of 500 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply the products necessary for her store, primarily beer

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia A. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high. Emilia sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market to sell. She also has a grocery store at tetermu near Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is in the fish business. Emilia uses her income to assist her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Emilia will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and resale. She also wants to invest in her grocery store by increasing stock. With the new profits from her expanded business, Emilia plans to reinvest for the further expansion of the business.

loans.use: Emilia will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish for processing and resale and to invest in her grocery store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Luz y Vida (“Light and Life”) Village Bank. Elizabeth is a 25-year-old single mother with one daughter. Elizabeth has a carpentry workshop in her house on Arenales Avenue, which she inherited from her father. She sells wood and also makes custom furniture. She sometimes sells her furniture in the San Juan Sunday market. Elizabeth needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy tornillo wood (tornillo is a tropical tree used to make furniture). Elizabeth dreams of buying a saw for her workshop and of outfitting her house.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Luz y Vida.

Elizabeth es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Elizabeth tiene una carpintería que fue heredado de su padre, su carpintería esta ubicada en su domicilio en la Av. Arenales, donde fabrican muebles por pedido y también vende madera. En algunas oportunidades vende muebles en la feria de San Juan.

Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera tornillo.

Elizabeth sueña con comprar una cortadora para implementar su taller y equipar su casa.

loans.use: Buy tornillo wood to make furniture

loans.name: Mrs. La Noun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people in Anlong Romeit Thbong village in Kandal province have formed a village bank loan group and Mrs. La N. is the village bank president. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. Her husband, Mr. Chan S. Mean, is employed in a garment factory and he earns a small salary to support his family. In order to increase the family income and improve their living conditions, Mrs. La N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 24 years old and the mother of a 1-year-old child.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Las Autonomicas Group

texts.es: El grupo " Las Autonómicas" esta representado por la señora Marcela y  cuenta con algunas socias que han trabajado en anteriores grupos con la fundación agrocapital  y se unieron para integrar uno nuevo conformado D. gente responsable y cumplida. En general las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como comida, cosméticos, pan, ropa y actividades como el servicio militar, servicio domestico D. limpieza y otros son empleados D. empresas. La competencia en el ámbito laboral es difícil en estos días en que la mayoría ofrece sus servicios a más bajos precios, pero la experiencia y la calidad humana D. las socias las incita a seguir adelante sin importar la competencia. El financiamiento esta destinado a la compra D. insumos y materiales así como para la reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio. Los miembros del grupo conocen la forma D. trabajo con grupos solidarios por lo que saben administrar bien los fondos otorgados y responder con sus obligaciones con responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The 'Las Autonómicas' group is represented by Marcela and includes a number of members who have worked in previous groups with Fundacion Agrocapital. They have gotten together to form a new group maD. up of responsible and dedicated people. The members work selling products including food, cosmetics, bread and clothing, and in other fields including military service and domestic cleaning services, while others are employed by private companies. The competition in the labour market is difficult these days, when the majority of the population offer their services at the lowest prices. However the experience and human qualities of the group members spurs them to continue on without worrying about the competition. The loan will be used to buy basic supplies and materials, and to repair work tools, in order to offer better service. The group members are familiar with working in solidarity groups, and know how to manage funds well and responsibly fulfil their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr.Antonio Durè,es soltero tiene21 años de edad,vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
                 
                 Se inició desde muy  joven a  la actividad  de  macatero (venta  ambulante casa por casa ) como  una alternativa a la  falta de empleo y  buscando  una  forma de ayudar a sus padres  se animò a realizar este  trabajo  se iniciò por la  zona de San Bernardino y como consiguò  muchos  clientes mas adelante extendiò su  zona  hacia  la capital  este  trabajo  le resulta rentable  y  constituye  su fuente   principal de ingreso y es sosten  de su familia  

                  Con el crèdito  obtenido comprarà sobrecamas
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio D. is a single, 21 year old man who lives with his parents in Carapeguá city. From a young age he has worked as a house to house salesman as an alternative to the lack of employment and seeking a way to help his parents he enthusiastically began in the San Bernardino area and acquired many customers. He then extended his zone to the capital city. This work has been profitable and is his main source of income and the means of support for his family. With the loan he will buy bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
In the previous year’s growing season, Bahodir K. was diligent in his fertilizer and pesticide-selling venture. During that season, Bahodir acquired adequate income which was used to improve his home and saved for the children’s education expenses. Since during the season he was diligently selling fertilizer, his land is nearly derelict. The current rainy season is an appropriate time for planting. Bahodir has taken the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. He requires funds to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Bahodir is optimistic his venture will be successful and all the effort he has expended will better the family’s welfare.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 48 years old and married with 2 children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions, hair cream, and bed sheets. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and bed sheets to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions and bed sheets

loans.name: Luteru

texts.en:
Luteru T., 26, is married with 2 children. She has 2 years of experience farming sugarcane. She sells her sugarcane to the schools in the village and public 5 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala.

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Luteru’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for home improvements and business needs.

loans.use: Purchase materials for home and business improvements

loans.name: Gladness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 40 year old Gladness N. from Dares Salaam. She is married with three children, between the ages of 10 and 17. Gladness has been running a café business since 2000. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Gladness currently earns about 100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase ingredients in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business. Gladness thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her Cafe

loans.name: Hoyo Del Toro - Group 6

texts.en:
Carmen E. is a young woman in her late twenties. She has four children ages 7, 6, 4 and 2. Carmen and the rest of the members of this group live in a section called Hoyo del Toro, a small settlement on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris. Despite being located by a highway exit, there are little signs of progress in this small community. Many of the small entrepreneurs who live in Hoyo del Toro have to go to San Pedro or other communities during the week to sell there.

Carmen decided to enter the clothing-sales business as a way to provide for her children. She doesn't have much education, but she is working on her abilities to be a good administrator. She wants to grow to become a clothing distributor and expand her sales to a larger area.

Please help us support Carmen and the rest of this group with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 44 years old, married and has four children. She sells provisions and drinks and has been in business since the year 2000. She needs a loan of N140,000 to increase her inventory and promises to repay her loan when due. Maria said her business assists her husband in providing for the needs of the family.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine K. is a young lady who was educated through Basic school. Christine sells salt, onions and a variety of spices for cooking in Hohoe's central market. She uses her income to supply her personal needs for which she is solely responsible. Because her spices are in high demand, Christine will use the loan to increase her inventory and variety of spices to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Christine plans to make investments back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more spices.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 56 years old, is married, and has eight school-aged children. Daylinda owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Daylinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Daylinda is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 13th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong N. is an older single mother who is blessed with three children. All of the children are married and still living with her. She currently stays at home and is responsible for the daily routine: cleaning house, caring for a grandchild, and cooking. The current family’s expense is contributed by her two daughters: one works as a seamstress in the garment factory and the other one is provides and sells beauty salon supplies in the village. Kong N. said that her daughter’s selling salon business is going well and smoothly, but her daughter complains that she is still lacking money to accumulate items to sell. Therefore, Kong N. has decided to seek a loan of US$600 from HKL to be used to buy more beauty salon equipment to continue the good service her daughter provides. She plans to use the rest of loan to order used clothes to sell at retail.

loans.use: To buy more beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia G. lives in Balik Balik Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nort. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari sari (or variety) store and a binangkal, or Filipino snack-making business. Melodia has been in these lines of work for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that can help improve her life and ability to take advantage of business opportunities. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from PMPC, and is requesting a third to further expand her business and improve her family's living standards. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.

loans.use: To further expand her snack-making business

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel Antonio P. S. reside en municipio de Ilopango del departamento de San Salvador. Salvador es un hombre de 37 años de edad, felizmente casado con  María quien le ayuda en el negocio, con ellos viven sus dos hijas Osiris de 10 años y Malani de 5 años de edad, ambas niñas se encuentran estudiando. Manuel posee una tienda ubicada en su casa, el negocio posee una clientela estable por no tener competencia cercana. El crédito que solicita Manuel es para surtir su tienda con variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio P. S. lives in the Ilopango municipality in the San Salvador department. Manuel, 37, is happily married to Maria. She helps him in the business. Their two daughters, ten year old Osiris and five year old Malani, live with them. Both girls go to school. Manuel has a store, which is located in his house. The business has steady customers because there is no nearby competition. The loan that Manual is asking for is to stock his store with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his business

loans.name: Nivine

texts.en: Nivine is a 25-year-old single woman living with her parents and her aunt. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2005, earning money to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Today, Nivine is requesting a $1,200 loan to buy additionA. merchandise and help expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise.

loans.name: Tamarsu Group

texts.en:
Here are Mary K., Rugiatu C., Nancy K. and Rugiatu S.. They named their group "Tamarsu," a Temne word for “Help Us.” This is their first loan from Kiva through SMT. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses and make enough profits to look after themselves and children.

Mary K. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of this group. Mary was born in Sanda in Northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-five years old, married to a teacher, and they have two children. One of her children is in Junior Secondary School III and the other is in class four. Mary has had four years of experience in the business of selling cooked foufou (food made from pounded cassava roots), vegetables, and meat.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Gilufar

texts.en:
Gilufar K. is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married and has three children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity created in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes feeding the animals and supplying them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding. Gilufar makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her adorable children. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling commercially. It is for this reason that Gilufar is requesting a loan of $800 USD to buy more young cattle and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy more young cattle and fodder for her animals

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa es una mujer muy carismática, tiene 29 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos.
Desde pequeña se dedicó a la siembra de café y plátanos, es por ello que realizar estas labores no le parece nada difícil. Hace 5 años atrás, junto a su esposo, han sembrado sus primeras chacras de café, a las cuales le han dedicado todo su tiempo y trabajo con el anhelo de forjarse una economía más estable, pero lamentablemente su primera siega no les dio buenos granos de café como esperaban. Ahora Ninfa está pensando fertilizar sus chacras con nitratos y de ese modo su próxima cosecha sea mucho mejor, pues a ella le gusta su trabajo y está muy segura que mediante sus cafetales su economía vaya ir mejorando.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y hace el compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas como en el primer ciclo, pues está muy contenta de contar con el crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cafetales.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a very charismatic woman; she is 29 years old, married, and is a mother of 3 children. Since she was little, she has dedicated herself to the sowing of coffee and bananas, and for that reason these labors don’t seem too difficult. 5 years ago, together with her husband, she planted their first coffee fields to which they dedicate all of their time and they work with the eagerness of forging a more stable economic state for the family. Unfortunately, their first harvest did not yield good coffee beans like they had hoped for. Now Ninfa is thinking of fertilizing her fields with nitrate and in this manner her next harvest will be much better. She likes her work and is very sure that through her coffee plantations her economic state will improve. This is her second credit with MFP, and she has pledged to punctually pay her share as in her first cycle. She is very happy to count on this credit. The money that she now requests is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her coffee plantation.

Translated from Spanish by Seton Hill University , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Mrs. Vong P., 41 years old, is a married woman living with other family members in her home. She takes care of four children, most of whom are employed in the garment industry.

Vong currently relies on the income from her husband’s trade. He works as a local ox-trader who also buys oxen in bulk to fatten for a few weeks and then sell at a profit.

Traveling to buy oxen is very hard, because he doesn’t own a vehicle. Therefore, Vong has requested a loan for her husband to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to support his business.

Vong was not available for a photograph, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle, which will support her husband's business

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur, la señora María de Jesús E. es madre de dos pequeños hijos los que están a su responsabilidad y ha decidido proporcionarles un techo digno donde habitar para que puedan desarrollarse y estar satisfechos con su madre.

Por tales motivos ha iniciado el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto necesita de su colaboración y ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como lo son bloque, cemento y hierro con la finalidad de continuar con su obra y ver realizado su sueño de tener un lugar seguro donde habiten sus hijos felices.
texts.en:
In the town of San Rafael del Sur, María de Jesús E. is the mother of two young children for whom she is responsible. She has decided to provide them with a decent home to live in so that they can develop and be satisfied with their mother. For these motives, she began to improve her home which is in need of her help. She has requested a loan to buy construction materials including blocks, cement, and iron with the goal of continuing her work and realizing her dream of having a safe place where her happy children live.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: German

texts.es: El Sr. German se dedica a la actividad de muñonero y tambien hace el cambiado de pastillas y balatas actividad con la que mantiene a su hogar que esta integrado por dos hijos pequeños y la esposa,quien le ayuda en el taller, se pudo ver que el cliente es muy trabajador ya que esta surgiendo poco a poco, tambien es muy conocido y tiene bastante clientela por la zona ya que realiza muy bien su trabajo, por todo lo mensionado se escogio al cliente para el credito kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. German works as an auto mechanic. Among the services he provides are alignments and brake pad changes. He and his wife manage this business out of their home in order to support their two small children. His customers notice that he is a very hard worker who is constantly growing little by little. He has developed a good reputation and has built up a decent clientele because he does very good work. It should be mentioned that it was for this reason he was chosen to receive a loan through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Carmelita's Group

texts.en: Carmelita A. is from the village of Catabban, Burgos, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Carmelita is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Carmelita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Carmelita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Adebisi

texts.en: Adebisi is 37 years old, married, and has three children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old. Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy and peace. Her husband is a mechanic and he also supports the home. Adebisi is a hardworking woman and is determined to excel. She sells hair extensions and cream at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business because it is highly competitive. Adebisi is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia V. C., tiene la edad de 73 años, es viuda, pero actualmente vive con un señor de 77 años y con un hijo de 15 años de edad que es su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para comprar materiales y remodelar la porqueriza, además, de comprar algunos cerdos para la cría. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña María Eugenia tiene muchos años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
María Eugenia V. C. is a 73-year-old widow, but she currently lives with a 77-year-old man and a 15-year-old son, who is her biggest priority. The loan that she is requesting is to purchase materials and remodel the pigsty, in addition to purchasing some pigs to raise. The idea is to raise the pigs properly in order to obtain the best income possible when they are sold. This is María Eugenia’s first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very pleased with the credit facilities that they provide to her. María Eugenia has been in the business of raising pigs for many years. In the future, she hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life, more economic stability, and be able to continue growing as a person and a producer.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Pedro M. Donça nasceu no Distrito de Mutarara, Província de Tete, norte de Moçambique tem 54 anos de idade casado e pai de 2 filhos de 22 e 20 anos de idade, todos já não frequentam a escola. Fez 12ą classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Tete para Maputo devido a transferência do serviço militar em 1974, onde acabou fixando sua residência. Ė Pensionista do Ministério da Defesa há mais de 10 anos e tem como pensão mensal o valor de 7.000.00mt, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de um amigo que é cliente desta instituição na sucursal de Bela Vista. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, areia, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 12.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para a construir uma pastelaria e salão de chá, como forma de melhorar a vida da sua família.
texts.en:
Pedro M. Donça was born in the district of Boane, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and has of two children, 22 and 20 years of age. The children are no longer in school. He finished 12th grade but didn't continue his studies because he was summoned to complete obligatory military service. He lives in his own house and isn't financially responsible for anyone else. He left Tete for Maputo because he was transfered during his military service in 1974. He ended up settling down in Maputo. He retired from the Defense Ministry more than 10 years ago and receives a pension of 7000 meticals a month, which he uses for household expenses and some savings. He's never received loans from other banks. He learned about Hvuluku through a friend who is also a Hvuluku client at the Bela Vista branch. This is his fourth loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he intends to use once to purchase construction materials (sheet metal, cement, sand, joists, etc.) and continue building his work. The earlier loans were in the amounts of 12,000, 15,000, and 15,000 meticals, all for the same purpose. In the future, he'd like to request more loans to build a bakery and tea room, as a way to better his family's life.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chapas, cimento, barrotes e areia

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Née en 1968, H. Cécile vit depuis 32 ans environs à Djassin Houinvié, dans le troisième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo au Bénin. Mariée à DOTOU Allodé, un matelassier, Cécile est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Cécile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Cécile mène comme activité, la vente d'huile de palme et d'huile d'arachide à Djassin Tokpa à Porto-Novo. C'est au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, que Cécile s'approvisionne. C'est la première fois que Cécile sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Cécile H. has been living for the past 32 years in Djassin Houinvié, in the third borough of Porto-Novo in Benin. Married to Allodé DOTOU, a mattress manufacturer, Cécile is the mother of six children, all having attended school. She lives with her husband and children, and the couple shares the various family expenses. To meet her needs and those of her children, Cécile sells palm and peanut oil in the Djassin Tokpa area in Porto-Novo. She gets her supplies from the Ouando market in Porto-Novo. This is the first time Cécile requests a credit loan from ALIDé, to increase her stock supply and improve her response to high customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jerrycans of palm and peanut oil

loans.name: Danilsa

texts.es:
Danilsa L. es un a mujer que conoce las necesidades de las mujeres y hombres en belleza e imagen personal, y esta la razón por la que su negocio vende belleza saludable e  imagen personal a clientes desde el sitio donde ellos se encuentren, pues trabaja a domicilio y con  su misma imagen  proyecta lo que ofrece. Desde hace 19 años Danilsa inició su negocio ofreciendo servicios de  manicure, pedicure, Blower, tinturado y corte de cabello en  San Fernando un barrio en la ciudad de Cartagena; ella atiende clientes de todas las edades, pero especialmente a mujeres residentes en los estratos 3 y 4 de la ciudad. 
Es usual ver llegar a Danilsa muy contenta cargada con todos los implementos que requiere para empezar en cualquier residencia o sitio de trabajo el arreglo personal de sus clientes en horarios adaptados a sus posibilidades, porque su trabajo es a domicilio especialmente para quienes les gusta verse lindas y saludables con los tratamientos que ella aplica y que algunas veces no tienen tiempo de hacérselos por la multiplicidad de  roles que mantienen hoy hombres y mujeres ocupados.
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación, con el primero  compró implementos de trabajo  para brindar un servicio de excelencia a sus clientes, en la actualidad solicita un monto de $2.000.000, con el que comprará al por mayor esmaltes, tintes, cremas para manos y algunos productos de uso personal, pues conoce mucho de bioseguridad. Su principal sueño es tener casa propia y planea vincularse al programa Ciudad Bicentenario liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su misión constructora de desarrollo social en comunidades
texts.en:
Danilsa L. is a woman who knows what women and men need with respect to beauty and personal image; this is why she sells healthy beauty and personal image to her customers wherever they are located. She provides in-home services and projects the services she offers with her own personal image. Danilsa began her business 19 years ago providing manicures, pedicures, hair-drying and dying, and haircuts in San Fernando, a neighborhood in the city of Cartagena. She has customers of all ages but especially women who are in the city’s stratus 3 and 4 classifications (Estrato: a method of the Colombian government to classify people according to their socio-economic standing: estrato 3 is lower-middle class and estrato 4 is middle-class). It is customary to see Danilsa happily arrive loaded down with all the tools and supplies she needs to provide personal beauty services at her customers’ homes or other locations following a schedule that is convenient to them. She provides in-home services for those who want to look beautiful and healthy with the treatments she applies that don’t have the time to do it themselves due to the busy schedules men and women have nowadays. This is her second loan with the Fundación. She used the first one to buy work tools in order to provide excellent customer service. She is now asking for a $2.000.000 loan with which to buy nail polish, hair dyes, hand creams and some personal use items because she knows a lot about biosecurity. Her main dream is to own her own home and she plans to associate herself with the Ciudad Bicentenario (Bicentennial City) program led by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo as part of its mission to build social development in communities.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nail polish, hair dyes, hand cream and other personal use items at wholesale.

loans.name: Venancio Alberto

texts.pt:
Venâncio Alberto J. nasceu no Distrito de Mocuba, Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique, tem 25 anos de idade, casado e não tem nenhum filho. Frequenta a Universidade Pedagógica a realizar o curso de licenciatura em gestão ambiental. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta seu irmão enviando dinheiro par despesas escolares.
Saiu de Mocuba para Boane para continuar com seus estudos no Instituto Agrário de Boane durante 4 anos. Trabalha como docente na escola secundaria ha mais de 3 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, possui um negócio próprio e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 10.130.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu salário consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigo que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (frangos para revenda) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 10.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no seu negócio e tem como sonho terminar a sua licenciatura.
texts.en:
Venâncio Alberto J. was born in the district of Mocuba, Zambézia province, in central Mozambique. He is 25 years old, married, and does not have any children. He attends the Teachers' University where he is studying for a degree in Environmental Management. He lives in his own house with his family and supports his brother by sending him money for school expenses. He left Mocuba for Boane in order to continue with his studies at the Boane Agrarian Institute, where he was for 4 years. He has worked as a secondary school instructor for more than 3 years, and is on the Ministry of Education staff. He has his own business and earns about 10,130 MZN each month, which he uses to pay for household expenses. With help from his teaching salary, he is able to save some money in his bank account. He has never had loans with other banks. He found out about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his 2nd loan, which has a value of 17,000 MZN. He plans to use it to buy chickens to resell in order to increase his business's stock. The previous loan had a value of 10,000 MZN, for the same purpose. He promises to pay off the loan on time in order to have access to others. In the future, he would like to request more loans to use for his business needs. His dream is to finish his degree.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell chickens

loans.name: Carlos Gregorio

texts.es:
Carlos Gregorio de 39 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Feliciana Gomez, no tienen hijos. Don Carlos trabaja como tecnico municipal del MINED desde hace 18 años.  

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de comprar materiales para terminar algunos detalles que le hacen falta en la casa de su mamá, algunas de las cosas que hara es comprar ceramica para terminar de ponerle al pasillo poder instalar los inodoros en los cuartos de la casa.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder ver que su mamá tenga las mejores condiciones en su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos Gregorio is 39 years old, married to Sra. Feliciana Gomez, and does not have any children. Don Carlos has worked 18 years as a municipal technician for MINED (the Ministry of Education).

He is requesting his fourth loan in order to buy materials to finish a few details that are lacking from his mother’s house. Some of the things he plans to buy include ceramic tiles to finish the flooring in the hallway and toilets to install in some of the rooms.

His greatest wish is for his mother to have a home in the best condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramic flooring & toilets for his mother's house

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre San Roque, se conformo en fecha 29 D. octubre del 2008.
Se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4º ciclo en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Es un grupo que se destaca por trabajo en conjunto y solidario que realizan.
Una D. las integrantes es la señora Eva quien se dedica  a la venta D. comestibles como empanadas, chipas, sopas, empanada D. mandioca, y otros.
Ella se levanta muy temprano para elaborar sus comestibles y como a las 6 D. la mañana se traslada hasta el centro D. la ciudad para la venta D. sus comestibles, ella ya cuenta con clientes seguros quienes todos los días compran sus productos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. ingredientes como carne, huevos, leches, masas, harinas, condimentos entre otros.
texts.en:
The San Roque women's loan group was formed on Oct. 29, 2008. The members are very comfortable working together on their fourth loan cycle with the program. It is a group that stands out for its teamwork and solidarity. One of the members is Eva, who makes a living selling food such as empanadas, chips, soups and other items. She gets up very early to make her foods and by 6 a.m. she travels to the city center to sell the items. She has regular customers who purchase her products every day. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients such as meat, eggs, milk, dough, flour, condiments and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase canned foods, meat, eggs, flour, noodles, oil, vegetables, condiments, bread products

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina O. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 52 years old. Vivina is married to Benjamin and has a 25-year-old child. To make a living, Vivina owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vivina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years now.

Vivina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Vivina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Armila

texts.en:
Armila M. is currently in the business of selling furniture and sheets of iron at a shop. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of cement to sell.  

Armila is 39 years old and is married to an under secretary. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of cement to sell

loans.name: José Rodolfo

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en casa de su madre, ubicada en el sector La Hollería, una de las tantas zonas rurales que conforman el distrito de Mórrope, distrito perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque que se encuentra situado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su profesión original es la de alfarero, confecciona ollas y vasijas de barro en su casa a pedido de un intermediario que viene a recoger sus productos eventualmente. Con un dinero que tenía ahorrado instaló una bodega en su vivienda, allí el y su esposa atienden a sus clientes y les brindan productos de primera necesidad por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hasta el pueblo central (a 20 minutos de distancia) para poder adquirirlos.

Eventualmente también trabaja como obrero de construcción civil, pero este trabajo no es permanente así como su labor de alfarero. Por este motivo José se esfuerza del mejor modo posible para poder sacar su negocio adelante, actualmente el desea ampliarlo con la compra de mas productos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el Fondo Kiva y con Nuestra Institución, gracias a su anterior préstamo el consiguió implementar su bodega con mas productos y de ese modo pudo percibir mayores ganancias, actualmente el se encuentra agradecido con las personas que lo apoyaron en la primera oportunidad y desea seguir trabajando para lograr sus metas y salir adelante.
texts.en:
José is a 33 year-old family man who lives with his wife and son in his mother's house. The house is located in the La Holleria sector, one of many rural areas of the Morrope district of the Lambayeque Province, one hour from the town of Chiclayo. He is a potter by trade, crafting clay pots and pans by request of a middle man who comes to take his products every now and then. With money he had saved he opened a general store in his home. That is where he and his wife attend their customers and offer them basic good for which they would otherwise have to travel to the central village (20 minutes away) to get. He also has a construction job but just as with his pottery job, it is not a permanent position. Because of that, Jose strives as best he can to move ahead with his business. Currently he wishes to expand it by buying more inventory and has requested Edpyme Alternative a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles. Jose has worked before with Kiva and with our bank. Thanks to his previous loan he was able to supply his general store with inventory and increase his income. He is thankful to the people who supported him the first time and wishes to keep working to accomplish his goals and move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods to expand general store

location.town: Caserío La Holleria - C. P. M. El Romero - Morrope

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg B. is 50 years old and lives with her husband in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Zavhan province, western Mongolia. She has four children but all of them now live separately from their parents.

Battsetseg operates a vegetable trading business where, with the help of her husband, she sells a variety of vegetables to customers at a local market. She started her business in 2001 and sells many different kinds of vegetables.

During the past nine years Battsetseg has not only gained business experience and knowledge but also agricultural experience and knowledge. She and her family store a large amount of vegetables in a warehouse which they built themselves.

Battsetseg is a modest, creative woman who is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a great deal of vegetables at wholesale prices so that she can grow her customer base this autumn and winter.

loans.use: To purchase a great deal of vegetables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina V. is a widow  who lives in Prk. Pasil, Brgy. Mancilang, Madredijos, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a general store  business.  

Magdalina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Magdalina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future for family. Magdalina V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase of more stock to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester M. is from the village of Tapon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old and is married with eight adult children. Ester owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies like boiled bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Ester joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Ester is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marianna

texts.en:
Marianna owns a cafeteria. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, western Ukraine. Marianna’s business is located close to the local train station. There are no competitors, which is a big advantage of her small venture. Marianna has been in this business for 13 years. Presently, she has 35,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise in her café. Her monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas. 

Marianna is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase merchandise for her café. Her rich experience working in the sphere of public catering has helped her learn the tricks of the trade. Marianna realizes this sphere of business is very prospective. She is willing to work hard to succeed and make her business flourish even more in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jane Wathua

texts.en:
Jane Wathua M. has been in this farming activity for seven years in Mwimto; Kikuyu area. She sell milk directly to customers who uses the milk for daily consumption. Her monthly income is Kshs.90, 000. She is 46 years old and married to Edward, 48 years old, who is a farmer.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and she is applying for her fifth loan of Kshs.50, 000, after repaying her previous loan successfully. She plans to use this loan to buy another dairy cow so that she is able to increase her milk supplies, and get better income.

Jane hopes to grow her business and supply milk in large scale to dairy companies in Mwimto and it’s surroundings’.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow  to increase  her milk supplies

loans.name: Ancelo Abel

texts.es:
Ancelo Abel B. D. tiene 23 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene una hija de 10 anos. 

Ancelo es socio de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.
