Ancelo se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz y maracuya. Vende sus productos en Mata de Cacao y vende sus maracuyas en Matilde. Solicita el crédito para aumentar lo que tiene sembrado, y posiblemente criar pollos. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría seguir adelante y hacer algo nuevo como criar pollos. Su sueno es seguir cultivando su terreno. 

Se dedica a trabajar todos los días, así que no tiene mucho tiempo libre
texts.en:
Ancelo Abel B. D. is 23 years old, and lives with his companion in the Chillanes canton, Bolivar province.  He has a 10-year-old daughter.

Ancelo is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos rural bank (the pleasure of friendship), located 20 minutes from the San Jose del Tambo parish.  There are 15 members in all, and most of them grow cacao or have their own small businesses.

Ancelo works in agriculture, growing corn and passion fruit.  He sells his products in Mata de Cacao, and sells his passion fruit in Matilde.  He requests this loan in order to expand his crop, and possibly raise chickens.  The loan will allow him to get ahead and do something new such as raising chickens.  His dream is to continue to farm his land.

He works every day, and thus has little free time.

loans.use: aumentar lo que tiene sembrado

loans.name: Erdenepurev

texts.en:
Erdenepurev D. is 53 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a traditional Mongolian tent home called a 'ger'. Her daughter and son, aged 20 and 24, attend university. Erdenepurev operates a handicraft-making business in her town with the help of her husband. She produces a variety of felt products and souvenirs. She has been engaged this business since 2006 after working as a salesperson in a local store. 

Erdenepurev is a modest and hardworking woman who works hard to pay her children's tuition fees. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more materials for her handicraft production in order to increase her business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make her crafts

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
El señor Silvio Gustavo B. de 30 años de edad, casado con la Señora Rosana Fernández, tiene 2 hijos, tienen una despensa donde venden articulos de primera necesidad anexo ferretería y bebidas en general cuenta con un local propio. Es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta.
Solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de panificados, gaseosas, jugos, arroz, harina, cable, flourescente, foco, etc. para aumentar su stock porque en esta época empieza a aumentar la demanda, tiene su clientela formada.
El Sr Silvio agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad brindada porque gracias a eso él podrá seguir dando a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y al mejor precio, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Silvio Gustavo Benítez, 30, is married to Mrs. Rosana Fernández and they have two children.  He has a grocery store where they sell basic needs items and beverages next door to a hardware store.  The grocery store is in its own locale.  He is a very hard working, honest person.

He asked for a loan to buy baked goods, soft drinks, juices, rice, flour, cable, fluorescent light bulbs, light bulbs, etc. to increase stock because this is the season when demand starts to increase.  He has a stable customer base.

Silvio thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity provided because thanks to it he will be able to continue to provide good quality items at the best price to his customers thereby continuing to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To buy flour, detergents, baked goods, soft drinks, juices, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jose Odar

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el barrio San Antonio de Padua, una zona urbano marginal situada en las afueras de la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona bastante comercial situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica al negocio de la crianza y venta de animales menores desde hace tres años. El cría sus animales en algunos corrales situados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente ofrece servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte).

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, sobredoto en estas semanas que es cuando la demanda aumenta debido a la proximidad de las fiestas navideñas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en: José is 25 years old, married and lives with his family in the San Antonio de Padua barrio, a marginally urban area situated on the outskirts of the city of Lambayeque. It is a rather commercial area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. José has made a living raising and selling small animals for the past three years. He raises the animals in some corrals located behind his home, and when the animals reach a good level of development he sells them to businesspeople who often visit his area. Additionally, he offers delivery and passenger transportation service with a mototaxi (a motorcylcle with an attached cabin). José wishes to acquire more animals and balanced feed so he can expand his business, especially since this is time of year when demand is high because Christmas is approaching. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase animals and feed to expand business

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Gameboys is a mobile video game trailer that has 8 TVs and 8 game consoles, which means 32 people can play video games at the same time. This is a great activity for parties, corporate gatherings or church events because so many people can participate at one time. Jason D. used this loan to buy two consoles and two generators.

Jason has been a serial entrepreneur since he was 11 years old when he started mowing grass for people in his community. By the time he was 18 years old, he ran a lawn care service making $600 a day, 3 days a week, “You can imagine the kind of trouble I got in”, says Jason. Jason subsequently attempted to start two other businesses which did not take off. He says, “I will be a serial entrepreneur until I’m successful and I will keep trying. I have ideas all the time.”

Jason started working for Perot Systems, which is now under Dell, as an analyst. He currently works for Dell and has recently had another entrepreneurial urge. He kept all of his landscaping materials so that when his three sons were old enough, they could start landscaping themselves. It was important to Jason that his sons learn a trade and he therefore created another business, Cowboy Irrigation. Every Saturday, Jason was teaching his kids how to irrigate, but they said, “Dad, this irrigation stuff is hard. Why can’t we do something else?” Jason told his children, “Let’s think about what you’re good at, and then let’s figure out a way to make money from that.” Out of this discussion, Jason and his kids developed the idea for Gameboys.  

Jason’s kids, Jack, Trent, Beau and Shealan, had invaluable input in designing the trailers. “This is me being a father and finding a way to be involved with my kids and teach them something that is productive. My purpose in life is to give them the best possible chance of being successful. I’ve led by example.”

Jason’s bank referred him to ACCION Texas-Louisiana and Jason was shocked by the reasonable interest rate. Jason says, “There are a lot of people out there who have great ideas. We need people and companies that will stand behind those people…. I applaud ACCION for finding avenues to trust me.”

Jason eventually would like to build these mobile video game trailers and sell them to franchises and help them set up across the country.

loans.use: 2 Consoles and 2 Generators

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan De Dios C. O. tiene 64 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Juan De Dios se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa y terrenos.

Le gusta estar en la casa, descansar y festejar las fiestas de año nuevo y navidad.
texts.en:
Juan De Dios C. O., 64, lives in a common law relationship with his partner and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has 1 child.

The members of the LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE (HOPE IS NEVER LOST) communal bank are from the community of Placer which is 120 minutes from the Chillanes office; they are for the most part farmers.

Juan De Dios is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  He makes both his purchases and his sales in Chillanes canton’s market on Sundays.

He is asking for a loan to buy seed, manure and fertilizers.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and climactic variations.  His dream is to own a house and land.

He enjoys staying home relaxing and celebrating Christmas and New Year’s festivities.

loans.use: For seed, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Justino Ignacio

texts.es:
Justino Ignacio S. V., tiene 43 años, vive en unión libre con su esposa, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos de diferentes edades 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES se encuentran ubicados en el recinto Los Ángeles, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, 

Justino Ignacio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia

Le gusta hacer amigos y ser sociable.
texts.en:
Justino Ignacio S. V. is 43 and lives with his common-law wife in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. He has 5 children of different ages.
The members of the V.R.C. Ciudadela Los Angeles are located in the Los Angeles district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice.
Justino Ignacio works in agriculture sowing corn. He purchases his products in Ecua-Agro and sells in the same location.
He is requesting this loan for sowing corn and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to have his own home.
He enjoys making friends and being social.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 32 years old, married and has four children aged between two and eight. All her children are enrolled in school. 

Marie Jeanne is a tailor, she has done this business for seven years.She is requesting for a loan in order to buy more fabrics. With the profits she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 38-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  buying and selling spices and charcoal and a general store business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at her buying and selling spices and charcoal and her general store businesses and she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000.  

Emily is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Her photo was taken during the market day. Emily aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar es casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. El señor Julio se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante por lo que es una forma de tener una gran variedad de clientes,  él está muy feliz con su medio de vida ya que habla con mucha personas. Julio dio inicio a su negocio hace 2 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue heredado por su familia. El crédito será invertido en la compra de pantalones, camisas, cosméticos, calzado entre otros. Su meta principal es tener suficiente salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en: Julio Cesar is married and has three dependent children.  Julio's business is selling general merchandise.  He makes his sales as a traveling salesman.  This is a good way to have a large variety of customers.  He is very happy with his way of life since he gets to talk to many people.  Julio started his business 2 years ago.  We should point out that he inherited it from his family.  His loan will be invested in buying pants, shirts, cosmetics, shoes and other products.  His main goal is to enjoy good enough health that he can keep moving forward in life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Joseph, who is 48 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have seven children who are between 7 and 26 years old. Myrna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy additional items to resell to customers so that she can continue to save up for the future education of children and improvement of her business. Myrna is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Lizett Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Lizett se dedica al comercio de vajillas edredones, sabanas, juegos de ollas y otros, deja su mercadería a crédito como también al contado trabaja desde hace tres años en el rubro va de casa en casa de oficina en oficina ofreciendo sus mercadería, ella ya tiene muchos clientes , su esposo se dedica a trabajar como promotor, viven en domicilio de propiedad de su madre, tiene una niña de cinco años, solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo y compra de mercadería como edredones ya que actualmente tiene mas mercadería que entrego a crédito y le falta capital para la compra de mas mercadería, ella es un apersona joven y muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Lizett sells dishes, comforters, sheets, sets of pots and pans, and other things. She sells her merchandise on credit as well as by special order. She has been working in this line of business for three years. She goes from house to house, office to office, offering her merchandise. She already has many clients. Her husband works as a promoter, and they live in a home that her mother owns. She has a five-year-old daughter. She is requesting the loan for working capital and to buy merchandise such as comforters, because currently she has more merchandise that she delivered on credit, and she lacks the capital to purchase more merchandise. She is a young, hard-working person who is grateful to the organization for its support.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as comforters

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie is 43 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is still in school. For the last 20 years, she has made a living by making and selling fried fish, and has applied for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more ingredients to cook and sell to her customers. Her goal is to continue working hard and expanding her business so that she can provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a business selling fried fish

loans.name: Fedrick Musembi

texts.en:
Fredrick has been practising crop-farming in Kavete village, in Tala town, for seven years. He earns an income of KES 1,500 per month. He is married to Nancy and they are blessed with three children. He sells his farm produce to the residents of Tala.

Fredrick learnt about KADET LTD through another group member. He is applying for his first loan of KES 15,000, which he plans to use in buying farm inputs like fertilizers and tomato seedlings.

In the future he plans to expand his business and to become a great farmer in the area.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs e.g fertilizers, tomato seeds.

loans.name: Badassawé

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans et mère de deux enfants, elle est mariée à un transporteur. Elle est couturière  de profession et s’adonne aussi  au commerce de produits de mercerie(fil,tissu...) Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend dans son atelier dans un quartier de la ville. C’est une femme courageuse  qui se bat au quotidien pour entretenir son foyer.
texts.en: Aged 36 and the mother of two children, Badassawé is married to a trucker. She is a trained seamstress and also sells sewing notions such as thread, cloth, etc. She buys her merchandise in Lomé and resells it in her workshop in one of the city neighborhoods. She is a courageous woman who struggles on a daily basis to maintain her household.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions.

loans.name: Kuluiza's Group

texts.en:
Kuluiza is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a farmer. Together they have raised a son and four daughters. The son is married; the first daughter studies at university, she is married too; the second daughter works in Russia and the others are at school. In order to earn money the family breeds cattle and cultivates agricultural products. Kuluiza sells 9-10 liters of milk every day. This activity brings her an additional 3000 soms per month. The family applied for the loan because they need money to purchase 200 kg of potato seeds. In the future Kuluiza hopes to get a good harvest; she also wants to see all her daughters get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: T.c. 11.78 Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama "Vista Hermosa" esta ubicado en la comunidad de las rosas, es un cerro que se encuentra escondido del municipio, pero las casas se empiezan a ver arriba casi en la cima, ya que en las faldas del cerro solo hay terrenos de cultivo y no hay casas, el nombre del grupo dicen los integrantes se deriva de la vista que se tiene cuando se llega a la comunidad, porque se puede ver todo el paisaje, los terrenos sembrados y los autos que pasan por la carretera, el grupo lo forman 7 personas, 4 mujeres y tres hombres, se dedican a vender ropa y tambien a criar animales para vender, toda la gente que vive en la comunidad tiene su propio terreno y de esta forma es como ganan dinero, ya sea vendiendo maiz o el zacate que se cosecha para darles de comer a los animales, Don Modesto es el representante del grupo, el señor se dedica a criar borregos tiene 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, por eso sabe que lo dificil es vacunar a los animales, la vacuna no es barata y para vacunar a muchos borregos es costoso, esto se tiene que hacer y no esperar a que el borrego se enferme para actuar, don Modesto dice que muchas personas que se dedican a lo mismo no vacunan sus animales y mas tarde son las consecuencias, es mejor vacunar para que crescan grandes y sanos. Tambien comenta que el prestamo le va ayudar mucho porque nesecita a un ovino semental, en su corral tiene borreguitas y le hace falta un macho, dentro de las metas de don Modesto es que sus borregas se carguen y den crias, de esta forma el en un tiempo tendria mas borregos que los que tiene en este momento, don Modesto es casado tiende 45 años de edad y 20 años cumplio ya de estar casado, tiene 5 hijos, 2 de sus hijos trabajan y 3 mas dependen de el, estan estudiando y el quiere darles el estudio hasta la preparatoria ya que no sabe si vaya poder con tantos gastos de universidad, don Modestos tiene su casa propia y su señora es ama de casa, y tambien le ayuda cuando son espocas de siembra y de cosecha, los nombres faltantes del grupo son los siguientes:
1.-Cristina, la señora vende ropa de segunda mano
2.-Maria Asunción, vende ropa en un tianguis: (calcetas, medias y collares)
3.-Angela, la señora tiene una pequeña tienda de dulces y abarrotes
4.-Alejandra, la señora se dedica a engordar borregos
5.-Arnulfo, el señor tiene una dulceria
6.-Gabriel, el señor se dedica a criar borregos.

loans.use: to buy domestic animals

loans.name: Ana Cenobia

texts.es:
Ana de 48 años es una mujer muy emprendedora ; ella vive en el barro Los Altos del Bosque de la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 22 a 26 años, conlos que sueña cumplan sus propios sueños y son su inspiración en el trabajo independiente que realiza, mediante el cual  fabrica ropa  especialmente femenina y que  inició buscando la oportunidad de tener un ingresos para apoyar la gestión de su esposo en su hogar,  sin descuidar la  educación  y formación personal de sus hijos .  Esta fue la razón por la cual estudió el arte de confecciones con el cual lograría los dos objetivos y finalmente emprendió su aventura,  iniciando con un taller de confecciones  en su propia casa, con el que gradualmente ha crecido y proyecta desarrollarlo  hasta conseguir que genere puestos de trabajo. 
Su Credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace Ana a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el  comprará telas, hilos botones y una fileteadora semiindustrial, con la cual cualificará su tarea productiva, mejorara los tiempos del proceso y finalmente responderá oportunamente a pedidos de nuevos diseños en la línea femenina.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, is a very enterprising woman. She lives in the Los Altos del Bosque neighborhood of the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children aged 22 to 26. She dreams that her children may fulfill their own dreams. They are her inspiration in the independent work she does, in which she makes clothing, especially women's clothing. She began her work looking for an income opportunity to support her husband's leadership in their home, without neglecting the education and upbringing of her children. This was the reason she went to school to study dressmaking, by which means she would achieve her two objectives. Finally she started up her venture, beginning with a dressmaking shop in her own home. Gradually her business has grown and she plans to continue to develop it to the point at which it may generate some jobs for others.  

Her Kiva loan is the first financing Ana has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase cloth, thread, buttons and a semi-industrial overlock sewing machine. With these she will evaluate her productive task, improve process times, and finally, respond quickly to orders for new designs in the feminine line.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, button and a semi-industrial overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Hada Luz

texts.es:
Hada, es comerciante de ropa, vive sola, inicio el negocio por influencia de una amiga, trabaja de forma ambulante en los alrededores del mercado municipal, por el momento necesita dinero para invertirlo en ropa para el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar blusas, ropa interior, camisas, la compra le permitirá aumentar la mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes.
Su propósito es fortalecer el negocio, atender bien a los clientes y mantenerse de sus ganancias cubriendo sus gastos más importantes.
texts.en:
Hada is a clothing merchant and she lives along. She started out her business following an influence by a friend. She works itinerantly in the surrounding areas of the municipal market. She currently needs money to invest in clothing for her business.

She requests a loan to purchase blouses, undergarments, and shirts. It will help her increase the merchandise she can offer her clients. 

Her goal is to strengthen her business, to provide her clients with a good level of service, and to support herself with her profits, covering her most important expenses.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, undergarments, and shirts for her business.

loans.name: La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La Candelaria, se encuentra localizado en Jumiltepec, Mexico, esta conformado por la señora Victoria que va a comprar con su prestamo maiz y hojas para elaborar tamales, las señoras Aleja y Edna Yazmin que van a comprar frutas de temporada aguacate, granada, durazno, la señora Minerva que va a comprar lechones para engordar, la señora Luisa va a comprar harina, azucar y levadura. 
La señora Luisa tiene 55 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 2º. año de primaria, ella es casada tiene 9 hijos todos son casados e independientes, ella vende pan y solicito su prestamo para comprar harina, azucar, manteca, leña, huevo, mantequilla y levadura, ella ofrece a sus clientes pan de dulce, teleras y bolillos. 
Ella inicio su negocio hace 30 años por necesidad y por la pobreza, ya que tenia a sus hijos pequeños, su suegra le enseño a elaborar el pan, ella le ayudaba a elaborar el pan, ella comenzó haciendo poquito pan y fue creciendo poco a poco, ahora ya vende mas, con lo que ganaba su esposo trabajando en el campo compró la materia prima para iniciar el negocio, ahora su esposo y su hijo le ayudan a elaborar el pan y ella va a vender el pan en el centro de Jumiltepec donde pone su puesto.
Su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades y para la comida, ella esta orgullosa de tener muchos clientes que le compran pan porque les gusta el sabor del pan que ellos elaboran con mucho gusto. Los desafios que enfrenta el negocio son el costo elevado en los insumos, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para la comida, para los pagos del prestamo y una parte para ir ahorrando. Ella esta contenta y feliz con este prestamo que va a recibir va a comprar los insumos para elaborar el pan le va a dar fuerza a su negocio, sus sueños y esperanzas son segur trabajando elaborando y vendiendo pan y que sus hijos tengan todo lo bueno en esta vida. Jumiltepec es un pueblo bonito de clima templado, hay mucha vegetacion, se da la fruta como el aguacate, durazno, peras, vainas, capulines, los habitantes celebran el 2 de Febrero a la Virgen de la Candelaria, hay comida para todos los peregrinos, suben al cerro donde esta la capilla de la Virgen de la Candelaria, hay misa, y bajan en procesion con la Virgen a la iglecia del centro, hay juegos artificiales. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "les damos las gracias y estamos contentos con sus prestamos nos van a ser utiles para salir adelante en nuestros negocios".
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Candelaria” and is located in Jumiltepec, México.  Its members are Victoria, who will use the loan to buy corn and corn husks to make tamales, Aleja and Edna who will buy seasonal fruit like avocadoes, pomegranates and peaches, Minerva who will buy piglets to fatten up and Luisa who will buy flour, sugar and yeast.

Luisa is 55 years old.  She completed second grade.  She’s married and has 9 children, all married and independent.  She sells bread and is asking for the loan to buy flour, sugar, shortening, firewood, eggs, butter and yeast.  She offers her customers sweet bread, “teleras” (rolls used to make tortas) and “bolillos” (French rolls).

She started her business 30 years ago because of need and poverty.  She already had little children and her mother-in-law taught her how to make bread.  She used to help her make it and she stared little by little to make bread and gradually grew.  Now, she sells more.  With money earned by her husband working in the fields she bought raw materials to start the business.  Now her husband and son help her make the bread and she goes to downtown Jumiltepec to set up her sales stand to sell it.

Her business is important because she gets income to cover needs and for food.  She is proud because she has many customers that buy her bread because they like the flavor of the bread they make with such joy.

The challenges she faces are the high price of ingredients.  She uses profits from the business for food, to pay back the loan and part as savings.  

She is happy with the loan that she’ll get that she’ll use to buy ingredients to make bread.  It will strengthen her business.  Her dreams and hopes are to stay in business making and selling bread and that her children have everything good that life has to offer.

Jumiltepec is a pretty town with mild temperature.  There is a lot of vegetation.  Fruits like avocadoes, peaches, pears, vines, ‘capulines’ (similar to sour cherries) abound.  Residents celebrate February 2 as “Our Lady of Candlemas” day.  Food is prepared for all the pilgrims who climb the hill where the Virgin of Candlemas chapel es located.  Mass is celebrated and they descend in procession carrying the Virgin to the church downtown.  There are fireworks.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “We thank you and are very happy with the loans.  They are going to be very useful for us to succeed with our businesses.”

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, shortning, firewood, eggs, butter and yeast.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 43 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  He is married and has seven children.  Six of his children are currently in school.  Fred has a  furniture business that makes beds, which he has had for 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase lumber for making beds for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fred hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Fred hopes to expand his business.   Fred is a member of Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase lumber for making beds for resale.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 46, is a woman who is trying to improve her family's quality of life. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh city. Anh supports her family by running a general store from her home. Her husband earns an income repairing motorbikes for customers. 

Anh has been running a general store for four years. She buys items from wholesalers and then sells the items to people in her community. The items she sells include beverages, fruit juice and household necessities. 

Anh would like to take out a loan to increase the size of her business by purchasing beverages in bulk at lower prices, which will enable her to offer more competitive prices and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that will help her to improve her living conditions and save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy beverages to stock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools, including wrenches, soldering equipment, pliers, grease, etc

loans.name: Wuilson Antonio

texts.es:
el joven Wuilson tiene 22 años de edad y se dedica al cultivo de café y agricultura, cuenta  con una experiencia de 3 años en el cultivo de la tierra.- Vive con su compañera de hogar y sus (2) hijos.  
Wuilson esta solicitando el prestamo para la compra de una planta de energia solar, en esta zona no hay energia electrica en ninguna casa y Wuilson desea tener una planta que le genere energia para ilumiinar su hogar por las noches, ademas desea poner un televisor pequeño para que sus hijos gocen de este tipo de entretenimiento.
texts.en:
Wuilson is 22 years old and works as a farmer cultivating coffee and other products.  He has been farming for 3 years.  He lives with his partner and their 2 children.

Wuilson is requesting a loan to buy solar energy equipment.  In his area electricity is not available, and Wuilson wants to have his own solar energy plant to generate electricity to illuminate his home at night.  In addition, he wants to get a small television set so that his children can enjoy this type of entertainment.

loans.use: to buy solar energy equipment

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a 39-year-old married man with five children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in clothes for seven years. He started with 800,000 shillings and now has 4,500,000 shillings as his working capital. His hardship is lack of sufficient capital to meet the different tastes of his customers and his dream is to own a boutique in town and to educate his children. Gideon needs the loan facility to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace cooks food to sell near a school in Abura. She is married and has 5 children. She has received a high school education.

Grace cooks food such as rice and banku (fermented corn dough and cassava dough). She uses her income to help her husband provide for the basic needs of the home. She will be using the loan to purchase more ingredients to cook food to sell. She plans to reinvest the profits from her expanded business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to cook food to sell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 42 years old. She lives in a house with her husband and three children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard. 

Thuy supports her family by selling sugar-cane juice, coffee and soft drinks from a stall in her local community. She started her stall in 2006. She intends to take a loan to repair her sugar-cane squeezing machine and to buy a greater range of food to sell from her stall. 

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money and save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: To repair sugar-cane squeezing machine and buy food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Oscar Bonifacio

texts.es:
Oscar de 44 años de edad, es soltero, vive en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Oscar desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cuenta 18 ovejas y 2 vacas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos personales.  También cuenta con tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y una vez que cosecha cuenta con otro ingreso para su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 700 nuevos soles para la compra de más alimento balanceado y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con las ganancias que obtenga con ambas actividades podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.  Oscar es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante, permitiendo que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Oscar, age 44, is single. He lives in his own home, which has electricity. It is located in the rural zone of Tambogrande, which belongs to the Piura department. The residents of this region work in agriculture, livestock, and handcrafts.

Oscar started raising and selling barnyard animals a few years ago. He has 18 sheep and 2 cows. The corrals, which are large and well-suited for the animals, are located in his backyard. He feeds them balanced food and natural fodder so that they will reach an optimal level of growth, so that he can sell them for a good price in the various markets in his region. This is how he covers his personal costs. He also has land where he sows lemons; this harvest provides him with additional income.

He has requested a loan of 700 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of more balanced food, and for fertilizers to improve his land. With his earnings from both activities, he will be able to pay off his loan and provide a better quality of life for his family. Oscar is a person who has been able to succeed and grow his business through hard work and determination.

loans.use: to buy more balanced food, and to buy fertilizers in order to improve his fertile land.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 30-year-old married man who is blessed with a five-year-old child.  To earn a living, he runs a general shop. He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people. He has witnessed a lot of growth in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. Francis hopes to open other outlets of his business in five years. He needs to borrow 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is a 27-year-old young man. He is married with one daughter. He has a car accessories store where he sells items such as car oil and filters. He wants to purchase more of these accessories but does not have enough money so he needs a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Mousa gets the loan, he will be able to purchase car accessories for his store. He will increase his inventory and increase his income, enabling him to provide better living conditions for his family. Mousa is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories for his store.

loans.name: Vosse

texts.ru: Воссе  способный, находчивый  предприниматель. Его стаж – 15 лет. Все эти годы он занимается торговлей мясных изделий. Он женат и отец четверых детей. Семья его гордость , именно ради семьи  и своих детей он старается на работе , чтобы содержать их в достатке. Жена прекрасная домохозяйка.  Скоро Новый год и к новому году все накрывают праздничный стол. А изделия , которыми он торгует пользуются большим спросом. Его торговая точка находится на очень выгодном месте – здесь много покупателей. Он хочет получить займ в размере 800$ США для пополнения товарооборота, закупа мясных изделий оптом. Он весьма благодарен вам за поддержку.
texts.en: Vosse is a capable, resourceful entrepreneur. He has fifteen years experience. All these years he has been selling meat. He is married and the father of four children. His family is his pride. For the sake of his family and their children, he works to keep them prosperous. His wife is a wonderful housekeeper.  The New Year is coming soon, and everyone will buy food for the holiday dinner. The products he sells will be in great demand. His shop is in an excellent location.  He has many customers. He wants to take out a loan of $800 to supplement his trade by purchasing meat in bulk. He is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy meat wholesale

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny is a 40-year-old married farmer in his village. Since he was blessed with two school-aged children, he needs to double his industriousness in farming to earn enough funds for his family. He leaves early in the morning to monitor his business. This work is not easy but satisfying especially if it results in abundant crops. To gain abundant crops, he is requesting a loan amount of P16,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for maintenance.

Manny is motivated by his desire to offer his family a better quality of life. Hopefully, he will have abundant crops to invest in the education of his children and lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for maintenance.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. 

For the past nine years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells cloths. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and it will help Ruth to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. 

Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Telli

texts.en:
Telli is 56 years old and widowed with seven children. Telli is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Telli has been breeding cattle and cows for the last four years. When she retired, she was left without her daily bread, as her pension is only 100 AZN. She decided to start her business and with the help of her husband, they purchase their first cattle.

Telli usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Telli`s monthly income is 200 AZN. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.

She would like to purchase more cattle and a cow and increase the turnover of business. For this purpose, she applied for 1500 AZN. She will buy three cattle, one milk cow and fodder. She has already demonstrated herself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle, one milk cow and fodder

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a  fish monger at Mbeam near Abura.   She is married and has 8 dependents.   Her husband is a chain saw operator.  Ama has been selling fish for 7 years now.  She supports her husband to pay their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine, a 34-year-old married woman blessed with two children, has been a greenhouse farmer for the past two years, earning an income of Kshs 30,000 per month. She has requested a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase chemicals and a water tank, and the anticipated additional profit will help her to buy and develop a plot. Through her business, Valentine hopes to ensure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane wants to buy textile materials

loans.name: Rahinatu

texts.en: Rahi is 27 years old and single. She started a small business last year selling swan timber to individuals and small business owners in the construction industry. There has been phenomenal growth over the past 6 months especially. This has resulted in the need for additional capital to expand her operations to meet the ever-increasing demand, specifically from those roofing their buildings. She therefore deems the KIVA loan a great opportunity to take full advantage of as soon as possible.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
Rosa Maria is originally from San Luis Potosí but has lived in Nuevo León for the past 22 years. She's a mother of six children, three of whom she still supports. After her husband died 10 years ago, Rosa was forced to start a business to provide for her kids and educate them. It has not been easy for to carry all this responsibility on her shoulders, but thanks to the love of her family and hard she has been able to succeed.

Currently, Rosa is looking to add more supplies to her shop. She knows that offering a wider variety of goods will increase her income. To do this, she's requesting a loan of $275, which she is planning to repay within three to six months. Rosa needs support and is grateful for what every aid you can offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa Maria es originaria de San Luis Potosí, ya tiene 22 años de residir en Nuevo León, es madre de seis hijos de los cuales tres dependen económicamente de ella. Después de que falleciera de su esposo, hace diez años, Doña Rosa tuvo la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, para poder dales a sus hijos la educación y el sustento que necesitan. No ha sido fácil para ella hacerse cargo de tanta responsabilidad, pero gracias al amor que siente por su familia, lo ha logrado.

Hoy lo que busca Doña Rosa es surtir mejor su tienda, ella sabe que esta al ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos sus ventas se incrementaran, para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares, ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Rosa necesita de apoyo y agradece cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her shop

loans.name: Akouéba Amono

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akouéba Amono D. is 57 years old, married and mother of eight children. For the past 20 years, she has been making her living raising sheep. The sale of these sheep for special occasions, especially for Muslim feast days, brings in the income she needs to help support her family. She is aware, however, that soon her business will not provide enough income to cater for their most basic needs. Blessed with an entrepreneurial spirit, she would like to enlarge her flock by purchasing some carefully selected lambs. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $ 600.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 57 ans, Madame D. Akouéba Amono est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants. Elle survit grâce à son élevage de moutons, activité qu'elle exerce depuis 20 ans. La vente de ces moutons en période de fêtes surtout musulmanes lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent de participer aux charges de son foyer. Mais au vu de ses prévisions et de l'augmentation de ses besoins, elle se rend à l'évidence que d'ici peu, son activité ne suffira plus pour satisfaire les besoins les plus fondamentaux. Très entreprenante, elle compte élargir son troupeau avec l'achat des agneaux sélectionnés. Pour cela, elle demande un apport financier de $600.

loans.use: expand her flock of sheep

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two daughters. She lives in Drogobych, Ukraine. Mariya runs a small business selling leather bags for men and women. She has been in this business for 9 years. Currently, Mariya has about $1400 in inventory. Her monthly business income is about $3600 and her net profit is around $500 a month.

Mariya is very communicative and sociable and has been an excellent client with Nadiya Ukraine. She has an outstanding credit history with not a single late loan payment. Each of her loans has been fully repaid on time.

Mariya’s elder daughter is a student at the Kiev Art Academy. Mariya helps her daughter and pays for her college. Mariya is requesting a loan of $600 to expand her business and purchase assorted new inventory. She believes this will help her generate additional profits and provide enough to help her daughters become established in life.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.en: Nuriyya V. is a 41-year-old woman who lives in Imishli in the southern region of Azerbaijan. Nuriyya has raised livestock since 1999 and during these years she sold calves for meat production to the local bazaar traders and butchers. She is very proud to have her animals and she could feed the family. Nuriyya`s husband is person with special needs and he does not work. Two of her three sons are high school students. They help Nuriyya to look after calves. For the last two years life in the region has been getting harder and Nuriyya understands that  her business of raising livestock is not enough to bring up her kids and earn enough money for a normal life . Now she would like to purchase calves and raise them up for milk cows and start dairy production. So she has applied for 1200 USD to purchase four calves for estimated cost 300 USD.each.

loans.use: Going to purchase four calves

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary J. is 30 yrs old, married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells clothing and wraps to people living in her community. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more wraps and clothes to sell, and she promised to pay back within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sales

loans.name: Elizabeth's Garden Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 31, is married with a 6-year-old child. She started a beauty salon just last year and works as a hairdresser. Her salon is open from 8am to 6pm daily. She is currently making a monthly profit of about $65 from this business.

Last year, Elizabeth took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to open this business. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her services for her clients. She will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses dealing in food, clothing, timber, and poultry sales.

loans.use: To expand their various businesses

loans.name: Clotilde's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Clotilde, and America are members of the community bank “Magnolia”. Maria and Rotilde have belonged for seven and five years, while America joined just four months ago. In that time they have learned discipline, the importance of helping others, and how not to be dependent on the men in their lives.

Maria is 39 years old. She is married and has one eleven-year-old child. Maria owns a photography business where she takes pictures for a variety of local events. She has been a photographer for 20 years.

Clotilde is 59 years old. She is a widow and has six children between the ages of twenty-four and thirty-six. Cotilde travels 10 hours to Lima every three or four months to buy clothing, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. She has this business for 18 months. Previously, in the 1980s, she owned a small grocery store, but do to civil unrest and astronomic levels of inflation she was forced to close.

America is 30 years old. She travels to different markets in the region selling clothing, which she buys in Lima. She has had this business for one year. Before that she was a cashier, but the hours were very long and she prefers working for herself.

Maria, Cotilde, and America need loans of 1000, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in a piece of photography equipment, and a greater variety of clothing.

An important part of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Maria, Cotilde, and America plan to use their savings to buy land, and later build a house, to purchase a refrigerator, and to pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are to see their children get good educations and become professionals.

loans.use: Maria, Cotilde, and America need loans of 1000, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in a piece of photography equipment, and a greater variety of clothing

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys M. is married to a carpenter and has 3 children.  She walks around the docks, in a small fishing village just outside of Cape Coast, selling cassava dough.  Cassava dough is mixed with corn dough to prepare a popular Ghanaian dish called “banku”.  She is requesting $525 to buy cassava dough in bulk so she can get a discount from the wholesaler.  

Gladys is also a member of a lending group called “Nkor Ma Ahoto Traders”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy cassava dough in bulk so she can get a discount from the wholesaler.

loans.name: Maritza Esther

texts.en:
Maritz Esther, an untiring woman and mother of two schoolchildren, lives in San Cristobal where she runs a small business.

Maritza Esther has been selling underwear and silver jewelry for more than seven years in her community. Maritza Esther says her business is the main source of the family’s income. She also says it’s hard to keep up with two children and that she has to work hard to proviD. them with food and education.

With her loan, the entrepreneur will buy new styles of underwear and jewelry for her customers. Maritza Esther’s dream is to have a big "Boutique.”

loans.use: To get new styles of fashionable jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es:
Rosa Esperanza is a young woman who has worked hard for the past five years to start a small grocery store in her home which is in the community of Villanueva and in the city of Chinadega. Despite the economic troubles that she has suffered in her past, she has been able to better herself with the support of her husband and children, who occasionally help her to attend customers at her store.

Ceprodel has helped Rosa Esperanza with over five loans. These loans have provided her with the funds to buy more products for her store. Now she is asking for another loans so that she will be able achieve her dreams of expanding her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe and Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

La señora Rosa Esperanza P. Rios es una dama muy esforzada que desde hace cinco años se ha venido desempeñando en el negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva en Chinandega. A pesar de su difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado, ha logrado salir adelante con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos que en ocasiones le ayudan en la venta.

Ceprodel le ha beneficiado más de cinco veces otorgándole créditos que le han permitido la adquisición de la mercadería para su comercialización. Hoy en día ella busca la manera de recibir una vez mas este apoyo confiando en que el crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño de ampliación en su pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Saom Art Group

texts.en: Mrs. Saom A. is the leader of a group of six members in Andong Chek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She makes and sells baskets in the local village. Mrs. Saom A. wants to expand her business so she is asking for a loan to bU. more baskets to re-sell.  The baskets she makes are not completed on time. Mrs. Saom A. is 56 and the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chheang Sok, is a laborer in the local village. Previously, Mrs. Saom A. had obtained a loan from AMK to stA. her basket business. Last year, her youngest child got dengue fever and Mrs. Saom A. had to spend an unforeseen amount of money to cure the disease.

loans.use: To buy more baskets to re-sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with one child. He is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo. Alexander owns a business selling electronic appliances in the central city market. Alexander is an optimist and thanks God for making his business sustainable and successful. His cheerful personality and unique ability to guess customer preferences has earned him several loyal clients who return to his store time after time. Alexander has been a “Nadiya Ukraine” client for about 5 years. He has always been very prompt with loan repayment and has not had a single late payment.

Alexander has about $8,000 in inventory. However he would like to get a new loan to expand the assortment of goods for the summer season. He wants to purchase clothing of different sizes to meet his customer demands. Rich experience in retail, good location of his business in the busy central market and variety of merchandise has guaranteed stable income for Alexander from his store. The loan will not only help Alexander earn better profits and promote the growth of his business, but also give him an opportunity to save some money for personal purposes.

loans.use: To increase the stock of his electronics sales store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia I. is forty-two years old.  She is married with six children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She sells foodstuffs and kerosene to people in her community.  This is a business she has been in since 1997.  She is a LAPO (Kiva’s Field Partner) client.  She needs the loan of $450 to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, 49 and married with three children between the ages of 28 and 15, has been a juice and bites (snacks) seller since 1993. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., she can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maryam now hopes for a loan to buy more items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia esta casada con el señor Eugenio Maldonado, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de empanadas, sándwiches, croquetas y otras comidas rápidas.

Sus ventas las realiza de puerta en puerta por el centro de la ciudad de Luque y por su barrio, la misma tiene buen antecedentes de pago con la Fundación Paraguaya.

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de materia prima tales como pan, carne, huevo, jamón, queso y otros.
texts.en:
Lucia is married to Eugenio Maldonado, and she works making and selling empanadas (tortillas dough filled and fried), sandwiches, croquettes and other fast foods.

She sells her wares door to door in the center of the city of Luque and in her neighborhood, and she has a good credit history with Fundacion Paraguaya.

The loan that she would like is to buy ingredients like bread, meat, eggs, ham, cheese and other things.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, eggs, ham, cheese/Compra de carne, huevo, jamón, queso.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en: Mrs. Kunthea T., 38, is rice farmer, and her husband, Mr. Nol Ty, 44, is a farmer. Kunthea has six children, all of whom are single. One daughter is employed as garment worker in Phnom Penh, earning $120 per month; one makes fried cake to sell and earns around $50 per month; others are small and in school. For another source of income, Kunthea needs a loan of $1200 to purchase a planing machine to use for a carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase a planing machine to use for carpentry business

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es: El Sr. Walter tiene 44 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah, don Walter se desempeña como fotógrafo profesional, es casado y su esposa vende ropa y cosméticos al detalle, le tiene tres hijos de 12,14 y 16 años de edad, los tres estudian y ayudan  a los oficios del hogar, don Walter se propone terminar de construir su casa, con este crédito es cinco lo cual ha sido de gran beneficio para las mejoras de su casa y brindarle mayor seguridad a su  familia, por falta de financiamiento no ha podido crecer en su negocio como debiera, el inicio tomando foto desde hace veinte años en la guerra de los ochenta que enfrentaba el país,  ya que trabajaba como fotógrafo de la contra revolucionaria, lo cual fue una  experiencia en su vida personal, ya que era arriesgado pero era su trabajo,   su meta en el negocio es obtener mayor  cantidad de clientes, y ofrecer sus servicios para poder obtener ingresos que puedan cubrir sus necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 44 years old and lives in a neighbourhood of Managua called Hialeah. Walter is a professional photographer; he is married and his wife sells clothing and cosmetics. They have three children aged 12, 14, and 16 years who are all students and help at home. Walter wishes to finish construction of his home with this, his fifth loan. He has used previous loans for home improvements and to provide greater security for his family. Because of a lack of capital, he has been unable to invest in his business as he would have liked. He started twenty years ago taking photos during the civil war in the eighties as he was working as a photographer for the counter-revolutionaries which was quite an experience as it was risky, but it was his work. His goal in business is to gain more clients and offer his services, so that he can make enough money to meet the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to plaster and repair his home.

loans.name: Edalia

texts.es: Edalia tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus  6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de comida al paso en una esquina cercana a su casa, su platillo se llama anticuchos (son como brochetas de corazón de res y papa), vende todas las tardes, incluyendo los domingos, y sus vecinos que ya conocen de su buena sazón acuden a ella diariamente para consumir este rico platillo. Su principal herramienta de trabajo es su parrilla, es fácil de transportar y así sale todas las tardes con los ingredientes preparados para tal fin. A Edalia, esta actividad le permite obtener ganancias en poco tiempo y no desatender a sus pequeños. Es su segundo préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Esta vez Edalia solicita esta cantidad para invertir en la compra de los ingredientes para los anticuchos, además iniciará otro negocio, transporte de pasajeros, para lo cual adquirirá un motocarro.
texts.en:
Edalia, 36, lives with her husband and their 6 children. She sells fast food on a corner near her house, the dish she sells is called "anticuchos", which are like a kebab of beef heart and potatoes. She sells every afternoon, including Sundays, and her neighbors who already know her excellent flavorings come to her every day to eat this rich snack. Her main working tool is her grill, which is easy to transport, so she goes out every afternoon with the prepared ingredients for this purpose. This work enables Edalia to earn money in a short time without neglecting her little ones. This is her second loan through MFP, and she has repaid punctually. This time Edalia is requesting this loan to purchase the ingredients for the anticuchos, and in addition she will start another business, carrying passengers, for which she will acquire a motorcycle cart.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for her anticuchos, as well as invest in another business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 40-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon with his wife and their seven children. Ali has been working as a taxi driver for 11 years. He requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his taxi.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua T. is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are married and the other two are traders in the community market. She lives with her husband in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Akosua is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 

For more than ten years, Akosua has been selling bananas and plantains by the side of the road in Koforidua. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bananas and plantains from farmers.  Akosua buys unripe bananas in bulk and covers them with plantain leaves in the bush. She leaves them there until they are ripe, and then picks them up to sell to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase a larger supply of bananas and plantains to enable her scale up her sales. Akosua belongs to a village bank called ‘Chance’.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and plantains.

loans.name: I Putu Agus Sumerta

texts.id: Setelah mendapat pinjaman sebelumnya  I putu agus sumerta semakin optimis dengan hasil yang di dapat dari usaha menjahit yang sedang di tekuni saat ini. Hal hasilpun cukup lumayan untuk membiayai hidup dua orang anaknya yang masih kecil . dalam sebulan tak kurang dari 700.000 ribu rupiah yang bisa di kumpulkan oleh I Putu Agus Sumerta . Namun Hasil ini dirasakan belum cukup untuk memenuhi biaya kebutuhan hidup yang kini kian meningkat belum lagi Dia harus menanggung biaya sekolah Intan anak sulungnya yang masih duduk di bangku SD.  I Putu Agus Sumerta masih memerlukan pinjaman modal dari Dinari untuk tahap berikutnya yang akan di pergunakan untuk membeli bahan baku seperti : kain, kancing dan sebagainya sehingga lebih memudahkan / memperlancar usaha menjahitnya. Dengan tambahan modal ini juga harapan I Putu agus sumerta untuk bisa meningkatkan penghasilan nya akan bisa terwujud.
texts.en:
I Putu Agus Sumerta is highly encouraged by the positive return of the first loan for his sewing business. The business profit was sufficient to afford expenses for his 2 infant children. I Putu Agus Sumerta managed to safe about $60 per month. However, he is not satisfied with his current result amidst rising living cost and business expenses. He needs to start paying for school tuition his first daughter, Intan, who is startin grade school. I Putu Agus Sumerta feels that he needs another help from DINARI to purchase more raw materials like clothes, buttons, etc. to grow his sewing business. He hopes that with the additional funding, I Putu Agus Sumerta can improve his earnings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cloths, buttons, etc

loans.name: Koeut's Group

texts.en:
Koeut S. is 31 years old and a group leader for loan borrowers, consisting of 4 members. She is a mother of three children: all are students. She is married to Duong, 37, who works as a garden worker in the private sector. S. sells fish and vegetables in the market. She gets up early in the morning and goes to the riverside where fish and vegetables are sold in bulk and then hurries to the market to sell them for a good price. She is requesting a loan to buy hundreds of kilos of fish and fermented fish sauce (Khmer cheese) because this the fishing season. She has been selling in the market since 2000.

The other members are: Ork S., 47, who sells vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to buy fish and fermented fish sauce. Koeut S., 27, who sells fermented fish sauce and is needs a loan to buy more fermented fish sauce for her shop. And Horm K. S., 21, who is a local construction worker requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for his work. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy hundreds of kilos of fish and fermented fish sauce (Khmer cheese)

loans.name: Valeriu

texts.en: Valeriu owns 1.5 ha of vines in Sardone and Moldova. He sells the grapes to a local processing enterprise. Last year, on his arable land of 4 ha he cultivated wheat on 2.5 ha, corn on 1.5 ha, and sunflowers on 1 ha. Valeriu has been farming for more than 10 years. As do many other farmers, he also raises pigs and sheep for both market and family consumption. For the future, Valeriu plans to increase the number of sheep he raises.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren Laborto is 40 years old and is blessed with one child. He was elected as the barangay councilor in his village. He is a pig grower and wants to expand his pig-raising business to support his family well. To supplement his income, he also grows rice. He has been tilling his rice farm (more than 1 hectare in size) that he inherited from his parents. Raising pigs and growing rice are his only source of income. 

He now requests a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI to buy pig feed and fertilizers. Efren has been a CEVI client since a long time. He receives not only loans but also trainings and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and fertilizers

loans.name: Bolokolognite Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bolokolognitè est constitué de cinq  femmes (dont trois mariés et les deux autres  célibataires)  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Mancourani I, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3 ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  tissus, pagnes wax, fruits,  bois de chauffe, produits de beauté etc.  
Collaborant avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et d’augmenter leur profit, elles sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.
 Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3 chargements de charrettes en bois  de chauffe, 25 pièces de pagnes  wax, 6 régimes de bananes, 10 baignoires   de mangue, 10 complets de tissus pour  enfants et 15 colis de produits de beauté. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako, de Médine à Sikasso ville et  dans les localités avoisinantes. Les marchandises sont vendues, la plupart au comptant., dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités et le remboursement du prêt.
Les femmes du groupe Bolokolognitè ambitionnent de devenir des commerçantes grossistes.
texts.en:
The group Bolokolognitè is composed of five women (three who are married and two who are not). Most of them live in monogamous families in Mancourani I, a district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They do a diversity of work, including selling fabrics, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), fruit, firewood, beauty products, etc. Collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy customer needs and to increase their profits, the group members are on their third solidarity loan, after having correctly repaid the preceding two. With this new loan, they intend to buy 3 cart-loads of firewood, 25 bolts of Wax pagnes, 6 bunches of bananas, 10 basins of mangoes, 10 outfits for children, and 15 packages of beauty products. Supplies are gotten at the grand marketplace of Bamako, from Médine in Sikasso City, and in neighboring towns. The merchandise is sold mostly in cash transactions at different marketplaces of Sikasso, within families, to customers composed of men and women. The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be used for family needs, and the other portion will be invested in business and for repaying the loan. Their ambition is to become wholesale merchants.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn manages an eatery business in the public market of Cauayan City. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP15,000 for her business to grow. She will be able to encourage more customers by having different menus of food to offer. Through this, Emelyn will surely increase her business profit, which will enable her to meet her family's basic necessities and the education of her children. She is hoping that soon she will be given the business financial support she needs. 
She is now 45 years old and is married to Noel who is working in a bakeshop. They are blessed with five children: Mark Joseph - 19 years old, Norilyn - 18 years old, Maica Angelyn - 16 years old, Lovelyn Joy- 14 years old, and their youngest is Noriel - 5 years old. The family is residing at Barangay San Fermin, Cauayan City. Emelyn is patiently doing her best to maintain her eatery business in order to send all of her children to school to gain a college degree someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Фуркат  Аюбов электрик. Он ремонтирует легковые автомобили. Кроме этого дома у него есть несколько голов крупнорогатого скота, он имеет 10 летний опыт работы в животноводстве. Фуркат подал заявку на получение кредита, и планирует использовать его для откорма скота. 
Фуркат женат,  у него 2 детей. Место их жительства Ганчинский район.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Furkat A. is an electrician. He repairs small vehicles. Besides that he has several heads of large cattle at home. He has ten years of experience working in animal husbandry. Furkat has applied for a loan and plans to use it for feeding of his livestock. Furkat is married and he has two children. They live in the Gonjy region.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of livestock

loans.name: Tebui

texts.en: R. is married with four children and is finding it very difficult to meet the needs of her children all by herself. Her greatest wish is to give her children a very good education and she therefore has to work very hard to make this wish a reality. R. has been a seamstress for a very long time but, because of limited capital, has not been producing on a scale large enough to yield enough to meet her family’s needs. Motivated by other GHAPE members in her community, she decided to join the program in 2007 and she received her first loan of 20,000 FCFA in that year which she invested in buying cloth and sewing materials. Given this new loan, R. plans to add the money to what she already has established, and plans to buy cloth, thread, and also pigs to raise and seeds to plant. As she has been in her seamstress business for a very long time, she is confident that her problem has just been that of inadequate capital. The profit R. gets from the loan will be used to pay for her children’s education and to improve the standard of living within her home. Her community stands to benefit from her activities as she will boost the supply of designed clothes in the market. R. prefers a loan from GHAPE because there is no collateral security involved. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, thread, and also pigs to raise and seeds to plant

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn S. helps till her family's rice farm. She started farming when she got married to her husband, Jimmy S.. She is 38 years old, and she will do everything to improve their livelihood to provide for the needs of their 2 children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help the whole family sustain their business and improve their harvest.
