Now, she actively participates in the CEVI cluster meeting. Through CEVI she has received loans, trainings, and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Because of her soap-making business, Salvacion A., 51, literally lives a fragrant life. She and her retired husband Serafin, 58, live with 2 of their 6 children (4 are already married). She has been mixing her own detergent soap, fabric softener and liquid dishwashing soap in her own backyard in Maricaban, Pasay City for the last 4 years. She does this all by herself. Salvacion earns a monthly income of P18,000.00 through the sale of these cleaning commodities.

Salvacion has just finished paying off her previous loan with CCT and is now applying for a new loan to purchase raw materials for soap making. She longs to have a place in a commercial center where she can sell her products. She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 and has since been receiving “blessings from heaven.” Salvacion is very thankful for God’s continued provisions even in the midst of crisis (her father has just been paralyzed).

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: raw materials for soap making

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: oumy G. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 2003.elle gère une boutique et capitalise trois annees d'expérience.elle sollicite un crédit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour renforcer son fond et qccroitre so stock marchandises a vendre.cette da,e assiste régulièrement son mari a améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumy G. has been a client since 2003. She runs a store and capitalizes on three years of experience. She is requesting a loan of one hundred thousand (100,000) francs to reinforce her capital and to increase her stock of merchandise to sell. This woman regularly helps her husband to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business

loans.name: Jose Edgardo

texts.es: Jose Edgardo H. A. de 55 años de edad,  reside en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Jose vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Jose es un hombre visionario en su negocio, se dedica a la producción y comercialización de almohadas, las cuales son distribuidas en una cadena de supermercados del país, el deseo de Jose es seguir creciendo en su negocio y que su producto entre a muchos hogares, es por eso que Jose solicita este crédito, para la compra de materia prima,que le permita aumentar la producción de sus almohadas y poder empezar a expandir su distribución a otros destinos.
texts.en:
Jose Edgardo H. A. is 55 years old and lives in the town of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and his two children. Jose is a visionary man in his line of work, producing and selling pillows that are then resold in a chain of supermarkets throughout the country. Jose wishes to keep growing his business and to get his product into even more homes. For these reasons he is asking for this loan, to buy raw materials that will allow him to increase his production of pillows and begin to expand his distribution to more destinations.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material in order to expand a business.

loans.name: Mrs. Noeurn Khim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of ten people and they all live in Chrey Young village in Kandal province. Mrs. Noeurn K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to grow rice on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field. Mrs. Noeurn K. is 51 years old and the mother of a child who is a musician.  

Nine members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to hire laborer with two oxen to plow on the field.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama S., 50 ans, mariée, est mère de 7 enfants et membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle y a contracté 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficultés. Elle fait un commerce de "nérétoué" (un produit alimentaire local) Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle participe activement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama S., aged 50, is married and is the mother of seven children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE for seven years and obtained from it fourteen loans, which she always repaid without a problem. She does commerce in nérétoué (a local food product). With the profits she makes, she actively helps to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her small-scale business

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.en: Ilhom is a hardworking person and he makes an effort to give his two beloved children the best. He decided to stay in his homeland so that he could develop it and now he carries out his everyday chores with a lot of love and affection as he feeds his animals. With experience gained over ten years in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. His wife helps him with the business. Ilhom would now like to purchase more cattle in order to create more income for his large family. For this reason he requests a loan of 4,000 Somoni. Ilhom thanks you very much for your love of the prodigal. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia VALENTINA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”, es natural D. la provincia D. Calca, del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora D. la provincia D. Cusco.
  
La socia tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada, tiene una hija y un nieto. La hija estudia la carrera profesional D. Medicina Humana en el país D. Bolivia.    

Ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención del pequeño negocio D. venta comida y bebidas en el Mercado Modelo D. la ciudad D. Calca. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio D. venta D. comidas y bebidas.     
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Valentina belongs to the Virgen Asunta Communal Bank. She is from the Calca province in the Cusco department, which is located one hour from the province of Cusco. She is 57, married, and has a daughter and a grandson. Her daughter is studying for a professional career in Human Medicine in the country of Bolivia. She alternates her activities at home with taking care of her small business of selling food and drinks in the Modelo Market in the city of Calca. She needs a loan to increase the capital in her business of selling food and drinks. She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this medium. She promises to make her payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the capital in her business of selling food and drinks

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en:
Abiodun is very hard-working and she makes sure she has food on the table every day through her hard work. She is 33 years old, married with 3 children. She sells drinks and groceries like milk, sugar, tomato paste, soap, etc. and has a plan to expand the business by adding the sale of other foodstuffs. She says there is high demand for foodstuffs at this season.

With this thought in mind, she is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Poung

texts.en: S., a long-time businesswoman, is a mother caring for two young school-aged kids. S. produces and sells snack foods to people who are her neighbors or passers-by in the village, and she earns approximately $5 per day. To meet the needs of her family a little more, her husband drives a motorbike taxi. S. is very busy at her business because she wants to have a lot of money to ensure that her family attains a comfortable living and especially that both her children get a high level of education. S. is taking out her loan to meet both purposes. She will buy a new motorcycle for her family’s traveling needs and purchase more raw ingredients and attractive equipment for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene Q. is from the village of Landing. She is 39 years old. Marlene is still single. To make a living, Marlene owns & operates a dressmaking and tailoring shop. Marlene has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Marlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and labor for her rice land. This will be the 14th loan taken out by Marlene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For purchase of farm inputs for her rice production activities.

loans.name: Shawki

texts.en:
Shawki is a 55-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Shawki has been working in agriculture; he owns livestock. He produces milk and cheese. 

Shawki is exceptional in his work because he is known for his good production. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face competition, since in his region there is a lot of agriculture and livestock, so he had to make himself known to the public. 

Shawki decided on this business because of his experience. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his livestock so that he would be able to increase his milk and cheese production and therefore, his income. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. 

In the future, he plans to keep on expanding his work by producing more.

loans.use: To increase his livestock.

loans.name: Ishenbubu Isagalieva's Group

texts.ru:
Исагалиева Ишенбубу 47 лет, она замужем, проживает вместе с семьей в селе Кочкорка Нарынской области. У нее двое сыновей, оба школьного возраста.Вместе с супругом она занимается перепродажей скота на местном рынке. Торговля осуществляется в выходные дни, когда работает рынок. Обычно за выходные они перепродают в среднем по 2 бычка. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса примерно равен 200 долларам. Данный кредит будет использован для увеличения товарооборота, а именно для закупа 2 бычков. 

Умут 26 лет, несмотря на свой молодой возраст, она является матерью двух сыновей: старшему 7 лет, а младшему 3 года. Ее супруг работает на стройке рабочим. Сама она присматривает за детьми. Кредит будет использован для лечения старшего сына. 

Жаныл 27 лет. Она также замужем, имеет двух дочек. Супруг занимается производством металлических печей. Кредит будет оплачиваться от бизнеса супруга, сама она домохозяйка. Кредит будет использован для лечения супруга. 

Назгул 32 года. У нее 5 детей. Супруг работает строителем. Кроме этого, семья клиента имеет свое хозяйство, где они выращивают скот. Кредит будет использован для закуп МРС.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Ishenbubu I. is 47 years old, married and lives with her family in the Kochkor village in the Narynsk region. She has two sons, both of school age. Ishenbubu and her husband are involved in livestock sales at the local market. The sales happen on weekends, when the market is open. Usually, they resell 2 bulls on average during a weekend. Their monthly business income equals approximately 200 dollars. The current loan will be used for increasing product turnover and, specifically, for the purchase of 2 bulls. Umut is 26 years old, and despite her young age, she is already a mother of two sons: the oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 3 years old. Her husband works as a construction worker. Umut looks after the children. The loan will be used for medical treatment for their oldest son. Janyl is 27 years old. She is also married and has two daughters. Her husband is involved in manufacturing of metal ovens. The loan will be repaid from her husband’s business income, since Janyl is a homemaker. The loan will be used for her husband’s medical treatment. Nazgul is 32 years old. She has 5 children. Her husband is a construction worker. Besides his work, the family has their own household, where they raise livestock. The loan will be used for the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith, de 32 años, vive en una casa alquilada en compañía de su esposo Rubén (40), que es transportista, y de sus 2 hijos: Fabricio (3) y Viviana (1).

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de calzado para hombre, a ella le gusta vender, sobretodo a sus amigos varones, pues ellos no son muy exigentes al momento de elegir con qué se vestirán y esto facilita sus ventas. Lo que no le gusta es tener que trasladar la mercadería desde la ciudad hasta la zona donde vive, pero las ganancias son buenas por lo que está muy satisfecha, ya que puede contribuir con los gastos del hogar. Como es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, para el futuro se ha proyectado a instalar un puesto de zapatos solo para varones en algún mercado de su localidad, pues tiene varios clientes fijos que siempre acuden a ella en busca de novedades.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito para seguir trabajando en busca de progreso. A su vez, está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está compuesto de mujeres muy trabajadoras al igual que ella. Edith tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de zapatos, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y le falta sólo el capital.
texts.en:
Edith, 32, lives in a rented house with her husband Ruben, 40, who works in transportation, and their 2 children: Fabricio, 3 and Viviana, 1. For 10 years she has sold all types of shoes for men. She enjoys selling, most of all to her male friends, because they are not very picky about choosing what to wear and this facilitates her sales. The part of the job she does not enjoy is having to move her merchandise from the city to the neighborhood where she lives, but the earnings are good and for this reason she is quite satisfied as she is able to contribute to the household expenses. As she is a very enterprising mother, for the future she has plans to establish a stand in a local market where she can sell men's shoes, because she has a number of regular customers who always come to her looking for the newest styles. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to access this credit so that she can continue working in search of progress. At the same time, she is content with the work of her communal bank because it is made up of very hardworking women like herself. Edith plans to invest the money that she requests in the purchase of a greater quantity of shoes, since she has a large number of orders and lacks only the capital needed to fill them.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy men's shoes)

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is 37 years old and married with three children. His wife also works to support their home. He hopes to give his children a quality education. Abass lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. 

Abass rears and sells cows. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He is an honest and a hardworking man. He hopes to expand his business in the future. 

He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase calves to rear and sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more calves to rear and sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA : MARCELINA, ES NUEVA CLIENTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SU ESPOSO Y ELLA TRABAJAN  EN AGRICULTURA  EN LA ZONA SUD VILLA PAGADOR. ES UNA  FAMILIA DE BAJOS   RECURSOS ECONOMICOS QUE SE DEDICAN A LA SIEMBRA DE ALGUNOS PRODUCTOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD COMO CHOCLO, CEBOLLAS, ETC. LA CLIENTE SOLICITA EL EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRA DE SEMILLAS  PARA LA SIEMBRA DE PAPA Y DESPUES DE COSECHARLOS LO COMERCIALIZA EN LOS MERCADOS DE LA ZONA Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, LA SEÑORA VENDE PAPA POR MAYOR. ES MUY TRABAJADORA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a new client of our institution. She is married and has 3 school-age children. She and her husband work in agriculture in the southern part of Villa Pagador. Their family has few financial resources and they work at growing much needed products, such as corn, onions, etc. The client requests the loan in order to buy seeds to grow potatoes for harvesting. She sells them in the local markets and thus can increase her work capital. She sells potatoes wholesale. She is very hardworking and very grateful to EMPRENDER and Kiva for the trust demonstrated by granting her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for growing potatoes

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene 60 años, es una persona que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, Juana es una persona muy activa y que le gusta conversar con sus clientes pues ella se ha destacado por ofrecer a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de variedad de productos, ya que tiene un buen pedido de productos. Ella desea seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca is 60 years old, and someone that has been working with the Foundation for many years. She dedicates herself to selling clothing, a business she has been carrying out for more than 10 years. Juana is a very active person, who enjoys chatting with her customers. She has stood out for offering her customers what they request. She seeks a loan that will be destined for working capital to buy a variety of products, as she has many orders. She would like to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Macanhan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Evelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a clothing business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying shirts, dresses, and other ready-to-wear clothes from the city and peddling it to the local community members in their village. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as her additional working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING CEMENT, BLOCKS, AND SCREWS TO SELL

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es: Yessica  tiene 27 años,  vive con su esposo y su hijo en una cA. alquilada. Hace mas de 4 años se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales al por mayor, en su mayoría filtrantes y sustancias digestivas. Siendo estas repartidas a diversas zonas de los pueblos rurales cercanos a su localidad, en donde su esposo la ayuda en el transporte de su mercadería. Para  que sus ventas sean exitosas, expone las bondades y características de sus productos, eso le da más ventaja lo cual le genera más ganancias, por tal motivo se proyecta y desea implementar de más productos y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y asegura cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, además considera que este aporte le será de mucho beneficio e importancia para mejorar su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de medicinas naturales.
texts.en:
Yessica is 27 and lives with her husband and child in a rented house. For over 4 years she has sold natural medicines at wholesale prices, mainly detox remedies and digestive aids. She sells in various rural villages near her home, and her husband helps her to transport the merchandise. In order for her sales to be successful, she explains the benefits and characteristics of her products. This gives her an advantage and makes her good profits. Thus, she plans to stock up on more products and increase her working capital. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she will repay it on time. She knows that this loan will be very beneficial and instrumental in the betterment of her business. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of natural medicines.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Natural medicines

loans.name: Meou

texts.en: Meou C., 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Batambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for good quality rice. She produces traditional cakes for an income of $6.00 USD per day. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of $2.50 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase equipment to produce more cakes. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s study. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy equipment to produce more cakes

loans.name: Nueva Semilla Group

texts.es:
Maria de 40 años es presidenta de la Asociación Comunal Nueva Semilla que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Santiago II. Maria tiene dos negocios pequeños, uno de ellos es el bordado de chompas y otro es venta de comida en un kiosko que está ubicado en su domicilio, necesita el préstamo para reactivar éste negocio, ya que cuenta con el apoyo y colaboración de sus 4 hijos, tiene planificado comprar insumos con el préstamo. Maria indica que le gusta Pro Mujer, por las capacitaciones que se imparte, el ahorro que logra al final de ciclo y las visitas al consultorio  que puede realizar ya que le atienden con amabilidad.
Las demás integrantes de esta Asociación cuentan con diferentes negocios de producción, servicio y comercio y todas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria, age 40, is the president of the Nueva Semilla (New Seed) Communal Bank. She belongs to the Santiago II Community Center. Maria has two small businesses. One of them is embroidering sweaters, and the other is selling food. She sells the food in a kiosk, which is located in her home. She needs the loan to reactivate this business. She has the help and cooperation of her four children. She plans to buy supplies with the loan. Maria indicates that she likes Pro Mujer for the trainings they give, the savings at the end of the cycle, and the visits she can make to the consultant’s office. She agreeably attends. The rest of the members of this Asociación have different businesses including production, service, and commerce. They all need the loan to strengthen and improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis Miguel C. S., tiene la edad de 19 años, está soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el almácigo para la siembra y el  abono y el fertilizante necesarios para su apropiado desarrollo. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Cuenta con un área de cultivo, la zona es propicia para este cultivo. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Luis Miguel  trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel C. S. is 19 years old, single with no children, and lives with his parents. The loan he wants is to help his farm, specifically, with the growing of coffee. The idea is to buy the supplies required for planting, and the fertilizer necessary for the coffee to develop properly. He wants to maintain his crops well so he can produce high quality coffee, and therefore obtain better prices for his product. He has an area to cultivate, and the region favors this type of crop. This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy for the opportunities they provide for him. Luis Miguel has been working in the agricultural arena for several years. He hopes to provide a higher standard of living for his family in the future, and more financial stability. He wants to continue to grow both as a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for planting coffee.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Mrs. Ke Y. is a 47-year-old rice grower and local farmer from the Kompong Tom Province. She runs her business on her own farmland, where she raises rice crops and pigs. She will sell them to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work.

 Ke Y. has two children who are secondary students. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. Ke Y. is looking for a loan to use on her farm.

loans.use: To use on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị (20201020054), 43, lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. A married mother of two adult-aged children, L. owns and operates a butcher shop whose main income is derived from butchering and selling pork in the local community. Engaged in this business for over 21 years, she earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month.

In 2009, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA that was used to invest in expanding the business, she is now requesting a new loan, her second, of 8.288.000 VND to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. L. Nguyễn Thị (20201020054) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 21 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2009, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa E. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 37 years old, married and has 6 infants. Elsa owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells used bottles and steel. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsa successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Red Lion Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Red Lion” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Binta F.. Binta was born in the village of Gbembembu near Makeni. She is thirty-five years old. She is married to a businessman and they have four children, two of whom are attending secondary schools.

Binta sells provisions – milk, sugar, butter, etc. She also sells salt and toiletries. Binta will use her share of the loan to buy more goods to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy milk, sugar, butter, salt, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta es una comerciante y se dedica a la venta de Pupusas, bebidas y tortillas, tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután y vive con su familia quienes son su apoyo en el negocio, lo inicio hace 5 años atendiéndolo desde las 11am hasta 8pm, ella cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas para atender el negocio, siendo este el que genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Ella quiere invertir y comprar mercadería (alimentos, maíz y bebidas) para ofrecer a los clientes viendo la forma de crecer con el negocio, por tal situación solicita un préstamo para llevar a cabo esta inversión. 
Su propósito con este préstamo es cancelarlo bien, ser cliente clase A y a la vez que su negocio sea prospero para tener una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Marta is a storekeeper and she sells pupusas, drinks and tortillas. She is 37 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, in the department of Usulután. She lives with her family who help her with her business. She started 5 years ago and works from 11 am to 8pm. She relies on help from her daughters to manage the store. This way, they can generate money for the household expenses.

She wants to invest in and buy merchandise (food, corn and drinks) to offer to her customers in order to grow her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to carry out this investment.

With this loan, her goals are to pay it off, to be a first class client and to have a prosperous business so she can have a better economic situation.

loans.use: To buy foods, corn and drinks

loans.name: Phon Ravuth's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of four people from Krabau village in Kandal province. Mr. Phon R. is a 23-year-old married man and has been selected as the leader of this group loan.
R. earns his living by operating two business ventures: vegetable and fish vending in the local market. His wife, Mrs. Chhoeun Sam Ath, is 23 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory as well as helping her husband in his business activities. Between them they are able to earn some profit to support their family. R. will use his loan from Kiva partner, AMK, to buy more vegetables and fish for enlarging his businesses. The couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fish

loans.name: Benson Waweru

texts.en:
Benson is 45 years old, married to Alice. They have two children whom they support. Alice contributes to the family income. Benson has been growing rice for about five years with an income of approximately Kshs. 10,000 per month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. This is his first loan from KADET--Benson intends to use it to buy supplies and hire labor for his rice farm. He has never borrowed from any other MFI. He will use the extra income for farming tomatoes and french beans as a secondary activity. He hopes to educate his children to the highest level and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and hire labor for rice farm.

loans.name: María Juda

texts.en:
Maria is sixty-seven years old.  She lives in the village of 8-4 Bajo Cuceta.  It is a small community in the district of TambogranD. in northern Peru.  She shares the home which she owns with her husband and one grandchild.  The area in which they live is rural and primarily populated by small fruit farmers and individuals who raise animals.

Maria raises sheep in the rear portion of her home.  She has corrals to protect her animals and keep them from wandering away.  She feeds them local plants and feed which she purchases.  She raises the sheep for their meat and sells them in local markets.  She usual sells the animals live to various wholesalers.

The requested loan will be used to improve her corrals.  Her corrals are currently in disrepair and she would like to make a major investment in order to bring them up to standard and to improve the assets of her home.  She hopes that this will reduce the time required to care for her animals and also improve the growth process.  She hopes these changes in her business will reduce health care expenses and increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To improve her corrals.

loans.name: Anita Antonieta

texts.es:
Anita es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector San Martín del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona urbano – marginal que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, verduras y frutas. Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio, su negocio cuenta con clientela fidelizada y vende tanto al crédito como al contado. Ella realiza sus compras en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo y a los vendedores que visitan su domicilio a venderle productos por pedido. Su esposo trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros y juntos tratan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Anita desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Anita is 43 years old and lives with her family in San Martin in the district of Lambayeque, an outlying urban area located about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits.  She has a store inside her home which has a loyal clientele.  She accepts cash and also sells on credit.  She buys her merchandise at the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo and vendors also visit her home so she can order things.  Her husband transports passengers, and together they are trying to improve the economic standing of their family.  

Anita would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can meet the demands of her customers.  In order to do this, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise in order to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Jesús Edita

texts.es:
Jesús es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón. Se encuentra ubicada en la región de Piura a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella trabaja en base a pedidos y vende sus productos al crédito entre sus vecinos y los pobladores de los caseríos aledaños. Jesús visita semanalmente a sus clientes para realizar sus cobranzas y para seguir ofreciendo productos, esta actividad le ayuda a sentirse activa y además le permite ayudar a su esposo, que es policía, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Jesús desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más prendas de vestir, de modo que sus ventas aumenten y pueda percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jesus, 36, lives with her husband and three children in Tambogrande, a semi-tropical region of Peru, mostly given over to growing fruit like mangoes, maracuyas and lemons.  Tambogrande is in the Piura regions, about four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Jesus operates a clothing business, selling items of clothing for men, women and children.  She works to order, selling merchandise on credit to her neighbors and others in the small town where she lives.  Jesus sees her customers every week so that she can both collect anything that they owe her and accept new orders for her clothing.  The business keeps her active and allows her to help her husband, a policeman, with the family's expenses.  

Jesus is applying for a loan so that she can buy more items of clothing and expand her business. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2,000 new soles loan so that she can buy the merchandise that she needs.

loans.use: Buy products to expand clothing business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 35 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Elías, de 36 años, y sus 5 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

Gladys pasa sus días trabajando en sus cultivos, ella es muy dedicada y pone todo su esfuerzo en que sus productos tengan la mayor calidad posible. Esta actitud ha hecho que sus plátanos, café y cacao sean muy solicitados en el mercado de Pichanaki, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, y lo hace con mucho esmero; lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos de cultivos son muy pesados. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción.

Este es el primer préstamo de Gladys con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos y no tener problemas con su banco comunal, donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices.
Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para fertilizar sus cultivos
texts.en:
Gladys, age 35, is a very kind and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 36 year old husband, Elías, and their five children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

Gladys spends her days working on her crops.  She is very dedicated, and she puts forth all of her effort so that her products will be of the best possible quality.  This attitude has created a great demand in the Pichanaki market for her bananas, coffee, and cacao.  This market is where she takes her products to sell.

What she likes the most about her work is planting, which she does with great care.  She has been doing this business activity for two years.  She considers transporting her products to be the most difficult part.  The sacks of crops are very heavy.

Later, she hopes to buy new land to increase her production.

This is Gladys’ first loan with MFP.  She plans on being very punctual with her payments and on having no problems with her communal bank.  In her communal bank she is the one to bring in the joy that makes other members very happy.

She will use the requested 500 soles to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: To buy natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Djamadjigui Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Djamadjigui sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames avec en moyenne 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Ségou au quartier Ségou Coura Bamanan (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Ségou Coura et grand marché de Ségou. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de  boîtes de concentrée de tomate,  des céréales (riz et haricot), des ustensiles plastiques (tasses, pots et bols),  des habillements (pagnes wax, bazins  et habits  pour enfants) et  des savons à fabrication locale et industrielle. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce pour pouvoir s’approvisionner au comptant, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Magnama Danté a une grande réputation dans la vente des ustensiles plastiques à Ségou coura. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 15 douzaines d’ustensiles plastiques au grand marché  de la ville de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, en ambulant et au marché de Ségou coura à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Magnama Danté espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 38.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé et les frais scolaires des enfants. A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, elle a pour objectif d’acheter un moulin avec son épargne dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Djamadjigui group are married, live mainly in monogamous households, and are 30 years old on average with 2 children. They all live in the city of Ségou, in the Ségou Coura Bamanan area (4th administrative region of Mali), and know each other through neighbourhood relations and their businesses at the market in Ségou Coura and the grand market in Ségou.
The group members run small businesses selling cans of tomato concentrate, cereals (rice and beans), plastic cookware (cups, pots, and bowls), clothing (damask, children's clothes, and pagnes wax -  a type of brightly-printed cloth), and soap made locally and industrially.
With the goal of increasing their working capital in order to pay for their supplies in cash, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) and are on their third solidarity (group) loan cycle.
Ms. Magnama Danté is well-known for the sale of plastic cookware in Ségou Coura.
She intends to use her loan to buy 15 dozen plastic utensiles at the grand market in the city of Ségou. She re-sells her goods in cash and on credit at home, door-to-door, and at the market in Ségou Coura to a clientele composed mainly of women.
With this loan, Ms. Magnama Danté hopes to realize an average monthly profit of 38,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business and take care of her children's health and education costs. Following the example of the other group members, her goal is to buy a mill with her savings through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To buy plastic cookware (cups, bowls, and pots)

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita L. is from the village of Bolisong, Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Lita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks & toothpaste in the local community. Lita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of products to sell like canned  & snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business of making and selling kenkey, a traditional dish made from ground cornmeal

loans.name: Shurnee

texts.en:
Shurnee, 31, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in an apartment and they have a decent standard of living. Her husband works as a customs officer and her two children go to a kindergarden. 

Shurnee began her bakery business in 2009, after graduating from vocational training. In the beginning, she got a loan of 600,000 MNT from our bank to start her business, and she paid it back. She used to make only bread, and now she makes a variety of bread, muffins and donuts. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, " I would like to expand my business and operate a bigger bakery ". She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more kitchen tools and materials for her bakery business.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen tools and materials

loans.name: Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”VENCEDORAS”, está iniciando su segundo ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Adela.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de nueve  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora Elizabeth. Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos venta de comida, venta de CD’s, venta de cosméticos, venta de fruta, venta de coca, vena de ropa y licorería.

La presidenta, la señora Elizabeth es una mujer de 44 años de edad, soltera, madre de una hija. Esta trabajando con Pro Mujer 14 años, con los que ha continuado su comercio de CD’s, trabajando diariamente con su hija.  La mercadería la consigue de Desaguadero, población que se encuentra en la frontera de Bolivia y Perú; estos CD’s los vende en la Av. 6 de marzo, en Santiago II y en Horizontes.

Con el monto de crédito solicitado piensa comprar “CD’s y un DVD” y con ello mejorar la comercialización de sus productos.
Cuando le consultamos qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Elizabeth  responde  la capacitación”.
texts.en:
The ”VENCEDORAS” (Winners) community bank are starting out on their second loan cycle with our Villa Adela regional office.  This group has nine members and Elizabeth is the president of its board of executives.  The businesses that the ladies are engaged in are all different.  They include selling meals, selling CDs, selling cosmetics, selling fruit, selling coca leaf, selling clothes and running a liquor store.

The president, Elizabeth, is 44 years old and a single mother with one daughter.  She has been working with Pro Mujer for 14 years and her business is selling CDs.  She works in her business every day, together with her daughter.  She acquires her merchandise in Desaguadero, a town which is located on the border between Bolivia and Peru.  She sells her CDs on Avenida 6 de Marzo in Santiago II and in Horizontes.

Elizabeth plans to use the loan she has requested to buy "CDs and DVDs".  This will help her to improve her product sale.  When we asked her what she most likes about Pro Mujer, Elizabeth replied "the training".

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan K., 33 years old, is married to Rith Bunthoeun, 41, and both of them are local fishermen. Every day in the early morning, she and her husband go to catch fresh fish using a variety of fishing implements. After fishing, they hurry up and bring their fish by motorbike to the market for resale. In addition, she feeds a few piglets behind her house for additional income.

Chan K. has two single children who still study in public school.  In order to earn more income, Chan K. would like to apply for a loan to buy two cows in order to breed them.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to breed them.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan M. is 38-year old fruit vendor from Brgy. Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines. He is happily married to Maria Marilyn, his business partner. Allan is a college undergraduate and decided to run a micro-enterprise. Allan has been buying and selling tropical fruits like bananas and pineapples for quite some time now. He buys these fruits in bulk from wholesalers and sells them individually for profits. On average, he earns approximately 11,000 PHP of net income per month.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($325). He plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase more fresh fruits to replenish his current inventory. Allan expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business in this fashion.

It is his fervent prayer to live a life of abundance and good health together with his entire family. As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he reads. All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners, all of whom gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To increase his inventory by purchasing additional fresh fruits

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario Rigo is married and 55 years old with three adult-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. Rosario has this business for three years.

Rosario Rigo is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase additional products like soft drinks, spices and bread to sell in the community. Each month, Rosario earns about PHP 10,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Rosario hopes that her business will expand to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell like soft drinks, spices and bread

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and married. Margie has three school-aged children.

Margie has been in the business of selling cosmetics for six years. Each month, Margie earns PHP 3,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase make-up and perfumes.

In the future, Margie would like to improve her business to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase make-up and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Evaristo

texts.es:
Evaristo de 50 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con  servicio sólo de luz,  en el distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agricola, ganadera y turismo (zona arqueológica).

Evaristo se dedica  a la crianza y venta de animales (cerdos y aves de corral) desde hace 10 años, su corral es apropiado y espaciosos donde se encuentran sus animales está en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una vez que tengan el peso y el tamaño ideal las ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona, con el dinero que va adquirir por la venta sus animales podrá atender sus necesidades diarias de su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de más animales y su respectivo alimento, al tenerlos bien alimentados los puede ofrecer a un mejor precio a sus clientes.  Evaristo es conocido en la zona por el buen servicio que brinda a sus clientes, es una persona trabajadora y dedicada que con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Evaristo is 50 years old and lives with this wife and three children in their own home, which only has electricity.  It is located in the Mórrope district in the department of Lambayeque.  This area is characterized by agricultural activity, raising livestock, and tourism (archeological area). 

Evaristo has worked raising and selling animals (pigs and poultry) for ten years.  He raises the animals in an appropriate and spacious area in the back part of his home.  He raises them with balanced feed like natural grasses.  Once they are the ideal size and weight, he sells them at different markets in the area.  With the money he will earn from the sales of the animals, he can meet the daily needs of his household.

He has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase more animals and feed for them so that they will be well feed and he can offer them at a better price to his customers.  Evaristo is known in his area for the good service he provides to his customers.  He is a hard-working and dedicated person with a lot of drive who works to improve life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Elvira Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Elvira tiene como actividad la venta de comida, actividad que desarrolla los fines de semana, a demás de tener como profesión ser enfermera. Ella vive junto a su hermana que al igual que ella es soltera, el destino del crédito es para poder mejorar la atención del micro snack que ella atiende con la compra de una broastera industrial y una spiedera, para así elaborar pollos al spiedo y a la broaster, ya que en el lugar es el único lugar donde venden comida y tiene mucha clientela, y poder mejorar sus ingresos y  así poder mejorar su calidad de vida, es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Elvira’s activity is weekend food sales, an activity she does in addition to practicing her profession as a Nurse.  She lives with her sister who, like her, is single.  

The loan will be used to improve the service she provides in her small snack bar with the purchase of an industrial Broaster and a rotisserie roaster to make Broasted chicken and rotisserie roasted chicken since it’s the only place selling food and she has a lot of customers.  

She will be able to improve her income and her quality of life.  She’s a very hard working person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy an industrial Broaster.

loans.name: Felipina

texts.en:
Felipina is married and has two children. She is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Felipina is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. She has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more feed for her pigs. 

Felipina has been a member of PMPC for 14 years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing pipian squash, chiles and tomatoes.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace‘s group is comprised of four hard-working young women. Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala Central region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Grace has a small restaurant which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  

In the future, Grace hopes to build a house.    Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save and be hard-working.

loans.use: to purchase food for the restaurant.

loans.name: Manggar Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
Lina is a mother of four children. She is 38 years old. She lives in Cilincing with her family. 

Starting in 2009, she has been producing Lontong (a rice-based dish) and cookies and selling them in front of the elementary school Al Khariyah to help her husband acquire school fees for their children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Indonesia. She is asking for 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah. With this money she wants to buy a table and chair, and to buy more ingredients for her Lontong and cookies. In the future, she wants to add more to her menu.

loans.use: to pay for a table, a chair, and more ingredients

loans.name: Jacquelin

texts.es: Jacquelin de 41 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 4 a 19 años, quienes son el motor que la inspiran para trabajar con tal de generar para su hogar el mayor bienestar posible. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercancía al detal mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos y también vende carnes frías y queso, que compra en el mercado de la ciudad, y comercializa entre los vecinos del sector desde hace más de 7 años. Su negocio lo inició para atender los gastos de su hogar y gradualmente ha crecido, apoyado por 3 financiamientos que ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en un periodo de 4 años de estar vinculada a esta organización, con la que ha logrado aumentar el tamaño de su negocio así como el de sus ingresos.  Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio y lograr que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios para que tengan oportunidades de ser exitosos. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancías variadas en almacenes del centro de la ciudad, para atraer otro tipo de clientela y darle a conocer su negocio de productos especializados mediante la muestra de su catálogo.
texts.en:
41-year-old Jacquelin lives in the south of the city with her ​​three children aged 4 to 19 years, who are the source of her inspiration to work hard for their home and generate the best possible wellbeing for her family. Jacquelin is a retailer and sells merchandise from specialized product guides or catalogues, and also sells meat and cheeses that she buys at the city market. She has marketed her goods to the residents of her sector for more than 7 years. 

Jacquelin started her business in order to meet her household expenses. The business has gradually grown, and has been supported by three loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Over the four year period that Jacquelin has been linked to this organization, she has managed to increase the size of her business as well as her income. Her future goal is to have her own premises and for her children complete their education so that they have a chance to be successful in life. Her purpose in applying for this credikiva is to buy goods from various stores downtown, in order to attract other types of clientele and increase knowledge of her business selling specialized products by displaying her catalogue.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise from stores in the city centre

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Luis tiene 40 años de edad y se dedica al cultivo y producción de café, sus padres le enseñaron desde pequeño con dicha labor, ahora tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad, siendo esta la herencia de sus padres. También se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como maíz y frijoles, dichas actividades le  han sustentado durante mucho tiempo, Vive en unión libre y con su compañera de hogar han proceado 4 hijos.
El Sr. Jose solicita un credito el cual sera utilizado para comprar una planta de energía solar ya que desea tener los beneficios que esta representa.
con dicha planta piensa iluminar su casa y poner un televisor para entretenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose Luis is 40 years old and is a coffee grower, a skill he learned from his parents when he was small. Now he has a lot of experience as a coffee producer, which he views as a legacy from his parents. He also cultivates basic grains, such as corn and beans. Both coffee and basic grains have been sources of income for him for a long time. He lives with his common law wife with whom he has 4 children.

Jose Luis is requesting a loan to buy a solar energy system because he wants to have the benefits this will bring. He intends to illuminate his house and install a television for his family’s entertainment.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has six children between 10 to 24 years old, all of whom are presently in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been involved in a rock crushing business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rock for her business. She plans to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rock for her business.

loans.name: Indeche

texts.en: Indeche is married and blessed with 3 children, all of whom attend school. For the last 8 years, he has been managing a retail shop to make a living. He is also employed. In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a wholesale business. His dream is to become more financially stable. He has been able to manage his business with previous help from Faulu Kenya. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy sugar, salt, and cooking fat for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 40-year-old woman.  She is married and has three sons and one daughter.  Her husband is a worker with a low income and her daughter is employed with a decent salary. Lubna sells embroideries and wants to improve her business to increase her income.  She wants to purchase more textiles and threads to improve her embroidery business, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN for this purpose.  When Lubna gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more textiles and threads and have a better collection to compete with other embroidery vendors and increase her sales and so increase her income. 

Lubna is photographed in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: buy embroidery textiles and threads

loans.name: Yovana Blanca

texts.es: La señora Yovana vive en la zona del plan 3000, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, que debido a cuestiones de trabajo  que el se encuentra de viaje, no tienen hijos por el momento que después ya piensan en agrandar la familia, la cliente se dedica a la venta de comida y venta de abarrotes el cual funciona en el mismo domicilio, ya que tiene su tienda de barrio el crédito esta destinado a la compra de un frízer para que la cliente pueda vender refrescos y cerveza y así poder generar mayores ingresos, gracias a la venta de comida la señora Yovana pudo implementar su actual tienda de abarrotes para generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Yovana lives in the Plan 3000 zone in her own house with her husband who is traveling due to work.  They do not have any children at present although they do plan to enlarge the family in the future. 

She sells prepared food and groceries at home where she has a small neighborhood grocery store.  The loan will be used to buy a beverage refrigerator so that she can sell beer and soft-drinks to generate higher income.  Thanks to the food sales, Yovana was able to set up her grocery store to generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy a beverage cooler.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian has a shop that sells plant seedlings of different kinds like fruit trees and ordinary trees. She is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Vivian has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional seedlings to sell.

Vivian has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Vivian hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings to sell.

loans.name: Rasta's Group

texts.en:
Rasta's group is comprised of six hard working women. Rasta is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past year, Rasta has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells dried foods. 

To help expand her business, Rasta has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food like maize and beans for resale, and will help Rasta to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Rasta hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.

Rasta is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rasta's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase more food like maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 40-year-old a married woman with two children. Neither of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for six years.

Hellen requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Hirwa Group

texts.fr:
Samson fait partie du groupe Hirwa. Il a 28 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 1 à 3 ans, dont. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Samson est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Samson voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Samson is a member of the Hirwa group. He is 28 years old and is married with two children who are one and three years old. His level of education has been six years of primary school.

Samson is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, which he will use to buy fertilizers.

His strategy for growing his business is to select his rice seedlings. In coming years, Samson would like to enlarge the area he uses for ​​rice cultivation. With the profits, he plans to ensure his children's education.

loans.use: buy fertilizers

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Amal is requesting a loan of 500 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to do home maintenance with an aspiration to improve her family's living conditions. 

Due to cultural issues the man in the photo is Amal's husband.

loans.use: to do home maintainace

loans.name: Ana Dionisia

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene un negocio a través del cual prepara la masa con maíz natural y yuca, base para la fabricación de arepas, buñuelos, bollos etc, los cuales distribuye entre vendedores directos de estos productos en cantidades pesadas desde una libra.  Ana está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 5 años, a través de los cuales ha recibido 5 financiamientos y con ello ha logrado tener su fuente de ingresos y generar bienestar para proteger a su familia. Su meta es tener su propio local en un sitio diferente del de su hogar, para lograr el tan anhelado sosiego y no extender sus jornadas de trabajo y confundirlas con sus jornadas familiares. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para la preparación de masa, pues se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y las ventas se incrementas, por lo cual debe estar preparada con un buen surtido. Con ello continuara su proceso de fidelizar sus clientes y aumentar el numero de compradores que diariamente consumen sus productos o que los distribuyen.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 46, lives in the city of Cartagena and has a business preparing dough from corn and cassava, which is the base for making arepas [a type of traditional corn patty], buñuelos [fritters], bollos [buns or rolls], etc. She distributes the dough to people who sell these foods, and she offers weighed amounts of dough starting at one pound.

Ana has been with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for five years. She has received five loans, and with them she has managed to have this source of income for her family's well-being and protection. Her goal is to have her own store at a site other than in her home, so she can have the calm she's wanted so much, and so she does not extend her work hours and confuse them with her family time.

At the moment Ana is asking for her first Kiva loan so she can buy raw materials and supplies for preparing the dough. Since the end-of-year holidays are coming and sales will increase, she has to be prepared with a good amount of stock. With it, Ana will continue earning customer loyalty and increasing the number of buyers who use or distribute her products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies for preparing dough.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is married and has 7 children. Isaac is a farmer and sells charcoal at Abuenu, which he has done for 5 years. His wife is also a farmer. Isaac uses his income to pay for his children's school fees. Isaac will use the loan to purchase an acacia plantation for the production of charcoal to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Isaac plans to save to give his children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase an acacia plantation for the production of charcoal

loans.name: Nhóm 4 Thôn 1- Quảng Thái Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Mai is 27 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 4 Thôn 1- Quảng Thái solidarity group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Mai's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mai has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mai Tô faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In future, Mai Tô hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start organic vegetable farming business.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with two children. She and her husband have a small business selling household items in the local market. Currently, Mariya has about $4,000 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $1,000. Mariya is a hard-worker. Her diligence and creativity has helped her succeed in business and maintain loyal clientele.
