Mariya has promptly repaid each of the eleven loans she has received from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Mariya is requesting a loan of $1,000 to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to increase the assortment of plastic trash cans, kitchen accessories, dishware, cookware and other utensils that she offers in her kiosk. Increased selling capacity will not only meet the needs of her clients, but the additional profits generated will meet Mariya’s goals of increasing her income and providing the necessary funds to secure her family’s well-being.

Марія – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. Вони разом з чоловіком почали власний бізнес з продажу побутових товарів на місцевому ринку. Зараз в Марії приблизно 4000 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає 1000 доларів. Марія – дуже працьовита. Її ретельність у роботі та творчий підхід допомогли їй успішно вести свій бізнесі та зберегти відданих клієнтів. Марія вчасно сплатила усі одинадцять позик, які вона отримала від „Надії України”. Марія просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів. Вона планує закупити більше пластмасових відер для сміття, кухонного приладдя, посуду та інші необхідні побутові дрібнички для подальшого продажу в своєму кіоску. Збільшення обсягів продажу дасть Марії можливість задовольнити потреби її клієнтів, а отриманий прибуток допоможе Марії досягти поставленої мети та збільшити власні прибутки, забезпечивши добробут своїх рідних.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
You can see in the picture a mother of three children, who bakes our national sweets such as bakhlava, shakarbura, shorkogal etc. Valida is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person. She has had her business at home for 6 years and it allows her to support her family.

Valida is 45 and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbadjar town, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. Having borrowed a loan of $500 she bought manufactured products: flour, sugar and hazelnuts. Now Valida needs a loan of $1000 to buy a big oven to satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: Valida would like to buy a big oven so she can continue to bake and sell traditional sweets such as bakhlava, shakarbura and shorkogal from her home.

loans.name: Zama

texts.en:
Born in 1964, S. was once married. She regrets the fact that she abandoned school and got married. Unfortunately for her the man she sacrificed her education in favor of abandoned her and their five children. During this period of great emotional and economic hardship she learned about GHAPE empowerment credit (EC) program. Determined to improve her lot and be available to her kids, she took her first loan in 2006. She used the amount to pay for pay and acquire hair dressing skills.

Given a loan of $300, she plans to buy a hair dresser.  With this investment, she will provide her community with hair beauty treatment and apprenticeship facilities for young girls. She intends to pay back her loan over a period of 18 months. Loan repayment will commence a month after loan disbursement.

loans.use: Hair Dresser

loans.name: Sughrahi

texts.en: I am a mother of three. I sell ginger and garlic while my husband drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi). The income from these two sources is in very short supply and is barely enough to keep our businesses going and sustain us. However, his rickshaw needs a repair as its condition is deteriorating and for this, we need a loan. We need $175 for the maintenance works of the rickshaw.

loans.use: Maintainence of rickshaw

loans.name: Eki

texts.en: Eki A. is 28 years old and is still single. She lives in Benin City and is a professional hair dresser. She spent a year and six months learning the business, after which she started her own salon in 2001. A loan amount of $250 will go a long way to improve her business; it will enable her to buy more weavons, hair creams, relaxers, and drinks to sell. Eki has been a LAPO member for four years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy drinks, weavons, hair creams, and relaxers

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en: Tunzala was born in 1974. She lives in Khachmaz town. This woman is married and has two children. She buys clothes and sells them to the shops in the villages. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy clothes for getting more income. She has been in this business for a year.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San S., 26, works selling various kinds of grocery products to the people in her community and generally makes up to $10 a day of income. Her husband is self-employed as a barber earning $5 a day. Mrs. San S. has two children who are too young to attend school. She would like to use this loan to expand her inventory to fulfill her client’s demand as well as to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to meet her clients' needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wholesale merchandise.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina has a family of five children, her husband works abroad and sends money every month. Her children are of different ages and she looks after them by giving them security and taking care of their needs as well as feeding the family.

Her business is located on Tarata y Esteban Arce Street, where she has a fixed stall under her husband´s name. With many years´ experience, she sell women´s clothing from Korea, which is in high demand.

There is a lot of competition but the difference is in the quality of service that the seller offers her clients. As far as the products are concerned, whether they are imported or local, she has been successful with her stall selling women´s clothing.

The merchandise that she will buy is women´s clothing from Korea. The prices vary and are a bit higher than locally produced but the clothing is of good material and fits the demand of the market.

Valentina is approved for credit with our institution since this is her fourth time and she has always paid her debts with responsibility and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Valentina tiene una familia compuesta por cinco hijos, el esposo trabaja en el extranjero y envía dinero mensualmente, los hijos tienen diferentes edades y la madre esta al cuidado de ellos brindandoles seguridad y cubriendo todas sus necesidades y también el sustento familiar.

El negocio esta ubicado en la calle Tarata y Esteban Arce tiene un puesto fijo que esta a nombre del esposo. Con muchos años de experiencia, vende prendas de mujer exlusivamente industria coreana los cuales tienen mucha demanda.

Existe mucha competencia pero la diferencia en la ropa de mujer esta en la calidad de trato que la vendedora ofrece a sus clientes y en cuanto a los productos si son importados o nacionales tiene bastante éxito con su caseta de ropa de mujer.

La mercaderia que va adquirir es ropa exclusivamente para dama de industria coreana los precios son variables y un poco mas elevados que la nacional es de muy buena tela y de acuerdo a la exigencia de la mujer actual.

Valentina esta fidelizada con nuestra institucion ya que es su cuarta secuencia y siempre ha cancelado con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
“I prepare some delicious empanadas in my home and I sell them to malls, who then sell them to their customers. Thank God I am doing well but now I would like to invest a little more and if it’s possible, buy a little car to be able to transport myself to sell my empanadas.” I am requesting $1,200 in order to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

“Yo preparo unas ricas empanadas en mi casa y las vendo en centros comerciales para que a su vez ellos las vendan a sus clientes, gracias a dios me va bien pero ahora me gustaría invertir un poco más y si es posible comprar un carrito para poder trasladarme a vender mis empanadas.” Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in my business.

loans.name: Víctor Alejandro

texts.es:
I have built some rooms on the second floor of this house.  I still need a concrete slab and exterior walls to completely finish the work and make the rooms ready for my kids.  I'm applying for a $1,000 loan for the slab and walls to complete the second floor addition.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Tengo construidos unos cuartos en el segundo piso de la casa. Los cuales les esta haciendo falta la losa y los acabado del exterior para estar total mente terminados y así poderlos habitarla ya que son los cuartos de mis hijos e hijas. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. para la losa y acabados del los cuartos en segundo piso de la casa.

loans.use: Concrete slab and exterior finishes for second floor addition.

loans.name: Adetutu

texts.en: Adetutu E. sells medicines in her community market, which is very close to her home in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 52 years old and is married with 3 children She has been in this business since 1980. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more medicine to sell. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy E. is 36 years old, is married with 4 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She goes to the forest to buy timber and then takes the timber to the sawmill for processing into wood, which she sells to retailers.

Tracy is requesting a the loan of $1, 200 USD to buy more timber to sell. She learned this business in 18 months and started her own business in 2001. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more timber to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort E. is 37 years old and is married with two children.  She lives in Okpella, in the Edo state of Nigeria.  Comfort has owned a restaurant which sells a wide variety of foodstuffs to customers for over 13 years.  Her restaurant has gained in popularity over these years, and now she needs a loan of $700 to purchase more foodstuffs to meet the demands of the customers in her community.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking.

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla E. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il est coordonnier à Danyi, un village situé à environ 170 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des outils de travail et aussi aménager son atelier. Monsieur Komla compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Komla E. is 32 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a shoemaker in Danyi, a village located about 170 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. He would like to use this loan to buy work tools and also to fix up his workshop. Mr. Komla has the intention of improving his living conditions through this opportunity.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and also to fix up his workshop

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty O., 36 years old and married with five children, lives in Benin City, Nigeria with her family. In 1992, after a three-year training period, she opened a patent store where she sells medicine and treats minor injuries and illnesses in her community.

Betty has been building her credit with LAPO for two years and hopes for a $425 loan from Kiva lenders to buy more medicine to help her better treat the sick and injured in her community as well as meet the expenses of her family. She thanks you for any assistance you can provide her.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her shop.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida baji is a widow who lives in the Walton area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 16 years. She is the mother of one son whose name is M.Shaffique. Shaffique is a plumber. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. He also owns a shop where he sells sanitary supplies. Rashida baji sews clothes for her neighbors to earn an income. She is applying for a loan to buy sanitary supplies for her son’s shop.

She is joined in her loan group by four other women: Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires and switchboards) for her electric shop. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (flour, cooking oil and spices) to sell Punjabi food (samosas). Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (cooking oil, dry fruits, and sugar) for her sweetmeat business. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy video games for her video games shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the loan.

loans.use: To buy sanitary supplies

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en:
Khagani was born in 1981. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Djabrayil region of the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in Absheron region. 

He has been in the business of house repair for three years. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for repairing homes.

loans.use: to buy necessary things for house repair

loans.name: Rayda

texts.en:
Rayda is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank.  Rayda is 22 years old and lives with her boyfriend; she doesn’t have any children yet. Rayda has a small store in her home where she works seven days a week selling vegetables, fruits, dry goods and office supplies. Last year, she used to sell ceviche (raw fish cured with lime juice), but stopped because she was not earning very much money.  

Rayda needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rice, sugar and oil.  Rayda dreams of expanding her business, opening a large commercial store, and making the last payment on the land she is buying.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Sovin

texts.en:
Mr. Sovin P., 50, and his wife, Mrs. Nary Din, 44, live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They were married in 1979 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family house. One son is a mechanician and one daughter is in grade 12.

Sovin and his wife have been selling dessert for many years. They sell their products at Olympic market in Phnom Penh. They make a profit of about $7.50 a day. Sovin is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, D. la comunidad D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 50 años D. edad, tiene seis hijos, y es casada y posee estudios D. primaria completa.
Trabaja hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas su primer préstamo fue D. S/.500.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra D. mercadería.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, monto que los invertirá en comprar frutas variadas (tuna, manzana, naranja, papaya, piña, etc.) D. tal forma ella podrá vender más y tener más ganancias, también menciona que lo hace para mejorar la calidad educativa D. sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea is a member of “The United Stars of Titicaca” Community Bank, in the community of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 50 years old, has 6 children, is married, and has completed primary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years and began her business of buying and selling fruit. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she will invest by purchasing merchandise. With this loan of 800 soles, which she will invest by buying a variety of fruit (prickly pear, apple, orange, papaya, pineapple, etc.) so that she will be able to sell more and have more earnings. She does this to improve the education of her children. She promises to repay the loan punctually in 5 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruit (prickly pear, apple, orange, papaya, pineapple, etc.) so that she will be able to sell more and have more earnings. She does this to improve the education of her children.

loans.name: Qadseya

texts.en:
Qadseya lives in Kabul Afghanistan. She is married and has 7 children.  She is requesting  a loan for her husband's  general store. He wants to make his business larger and he needs more money for his business to increase his stock.
He has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 11 months.
Qadseya is very happy about the loan process in Afghanistan because it provides a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials and complete the stock for her husband's shop

loans.name: Teb

texts.en:
S. is 27 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She is a mother of a young child. She is married to Vuthy, 30, who works in the harbor. 

S. sells different kinds of snack food along Mekong River harbor. She gets up in the early morning to prepare the food, such as bananas, cake, and children's sweets, which she always buys from the farmers. She is taking a loan of $150 to build a small shop for her busienss. The loan will help the family earn a good income. She dreams of having her child earn a degree.

loans.use: To build a small shop for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is forty years old. She is a married mother of five children. One of the five children has just completed senior high school. The others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Mary is a food vendor. She sells a local dish called ‘banku’ in her community. She prepares the food in her home and sells on the street in the evenings. Banku is prepared from corn dough and served hot with soup. Mary says she buys the raw materials, such as maize, fish, and other vegetables, from the local market. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy raw materials in bulk. She hopes to improve her standard of living and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Marigee

texts.en:
Marigee O., 30, is from Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is single and presently lives with her parents. She is a new member of Paglaum MPC under micro-finance program,who joined in November. She wants to help her parents with their daily necessities. Within the period of her membership she demonstrated excellent performance in terms of loan repayments.

She loaned the amount of Php10,000.00 to purchase stock for her sari-sari (variety) store, where you can buy assorted goods. She hopes to enrich their way of life and expand the business.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina E. is married with four children and has received no formal education.  She works as a seamstress and trader, selling such goods as rice, oil and canned tomatoes at Moree near Cape Coast.  She has been in business since 2008.  Georgina uses her income to pay for school fees, utilities, and food. She will use the loan to purchase rice in large quantities for resale and also to purchase sewing materials to broaden the services she renders to her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale in bulk and sewing materials to broaden customer services.

loans.name: Naseema Group

texts.en: Naseema is the group leader of Naseema group. There are four members in this group. They want to take a loan of 58800 Afghani and each of them wants to expand her business. Naseema wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store. Fwarzan wants to take a loan for the business of embroidery. Rawena wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Fareda wants to take a loan for her husband who is a taxi driver. So they are very thankful for AFS and Kiva lenders who can support all worlds.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann S., 43, lives in Battambang Province, where she makes a living selling different kinds of fruit. She usually uses her old bicycle to transport her produce to sell door-to-door in her community, and earns an average of $3 profit a day to manage her family's daily expenses. She has given birth to five children, three of whom are employed as seamstresses, while the others are of school-age.

Ann S.’s husband is a musician, playing for wedding parties. Ann S. would like to take out a loan of $300 as capital to grow her business and to buy an extra musical instrument for her husband.

loans.use: To grow her business and to buy a musical instrument for her husband's business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 31 años, es una mujer de carácter pasivo y buen trato, actualmente vive con su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus suegros. La crianza y venta de animales menores (cuyes y conejos) es la actividad que realiza desde que formó su familia. Cada jueves y domingo lleva de 8 a 12 cuyes al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma por ser días de feria, en la mayoría de las veces vende cada cuy a 10 ó 12 soles y en caso de los  conejos, a 25 soles; pero cuando no termina de vender debido a la competencia los remata a los revendedores hasta 8 soles cada cuy y 15 cada conejo para regresar a casa comprando alimentos concentrados de engorde para sus animales. Mientras tanto, su esposo se dedica a la siembra de papas y arvejas, en algunas oportunidades ella lo apoya, sobre todo en los días de cosecha, es la encargada de la recolección de las papas. Nilda está muy contenta con las actividades que realiza, por ello anhela incrementar la cantidad de sus animales y comprar terrenos de cultivos para sembrar avena para alimentarlos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y durante los periodos concluidos demostró pagar puntualmente y ser muy respetuosa de los acuerdos de su banco comunal, donde además estima mucho a sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la construcción de otras jaulas para sus animales y de alimentos concentrados para que engorden con rapidez.
texts.en:
Nilda is 31 years old. She is a quiet, well-mannered woman. She lives with her partner, the father of her 2 children, in the home of her in-laws.

Since starting her family, Nilda has been in the business of breeding and selling small animals (guinea pigs and rabbits). Every Thursday and Sunday she brings 8 to 12 guinea pigs to market in the town of Tarma. Most of the time, each guinea pig sells for 10 or 12 soles while a rabbit sells for 25 soles. Her sales come to an end when competing merchants start liquidating and lower their prices to 8 soles per guinea pig and 15 soles per rabbit. Before returning home, she stops to buy food concentrates to fatten her remaining animals.

Meanwhile, Nilda’s husband is engaged in the planting of potatoes and peas. She sometimes helps with the planting, but her main responsibility comes at harvest time when she is responsible for gathering the potatoes. Nilda is very happy with her business, so she is eager to buy more animals and acquire more farmland to grow oats for animal feed.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. During her previous loan periods, she was punctual with her payments. She is respected by her communal bank group and gets along well with the other members. The money she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials for animal cages and food concentrates to help her animals gain weight quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed and building materials to make cages

loans.name: Rann

texts.en: Mrs. Rann K. was born in 1965 and lives in Svay Thom village in TaK. province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice. Her husband, Mr. Soeur Saum, is a taxi driver. Mrs. Rann K. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and a plow. She hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. This couple has two children, one of whom works in a garment factory while the other attends a local school. Her husband is seen her in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and a plow.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie Y. owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 49 years old, married and has three adult children. She is from the town of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ. Debbie has been in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Debbie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Debbie is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make snacks

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria Del Carmen F. H. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Gloria tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante y sus dos hijos Melvin de 18 años y Jeniffer de 10 años de edad ambos niños son estudiantes. Gloria se dedica hace diez años a su negocio una tienda con productos de consumo  y también maneja un pequeño inventario de ropa, ambos negocios se encuentran ubicados en su casa, el crédito que solicita Gloria es para surtir su tienda y a su surtir el inventario de ropa que posee ya que la demanda en la misma ha ido aumentando y es por eso que Gloria quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para explotar sus ventas con el consumo de ropa.
texts.en:
Gloria Del Carmen F. H. lives in the district of Ahuachapán. Gloria is 40 years old, married, and has two children, Melvin (age 18) and Jeniffer (age 10). Both children attend school. Her husband works as a security guard. For 10 years, Gloria has been selling consumer products from her store. She also maintains a small inventory of clothing. She operates both businesses out of her home.

Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store and increase her inventory of clothing. The demand for clothing has been increasing so she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store & increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is 25 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 10 years old.

Happy has owned a shop business for 5 years,  she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Happy`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Happy hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy shop commodities

loans.name: Virginia Lourenco

texts.pt:
Virginia nasceu no distrito nortenho da província de Maputo, Manhica. Tem 39 anos de idade, casado e mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 4 e 14 anos. Todos aqueles que têm idade, freqüentam escolas Publicas de Boane. Virginia fez somente 7 classe, tendo parado devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vivem na casa própria com seu marido, filhos mais dois netos sob sua responsabilidade.

Cresceu na vila de boane porque seus pais saíram do distrito natal quando ela tinha 2 anos de vida. É comerciante e dona do negocio há mais de 23 anos e trabalha sozinha.
O seu marido é militar afecto no quartel de Boane com salário mensal de 4.000,00MT.
Virginia rende através das vendas que efectua mensalmente, cerca de 3.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e juntamente com o marido vem construindo uma casa de alvenaria.

Nunca tinha contraído empréstimos em bancos, e através das informações obtidas aos vizinhos, aproximou a Hluvuku-Adsema e solicita o presente empréstimo (pela terceira vez) no valor de 13.000,00t para compra de material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e outros). Os outros créditos foram para a mesma actividade e pagos sem problemas nos valores de 7.000,00MT e 16.000,00MT.

Propõe se a reembolsar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos para cumprir o objectivo futuro de ver a casa concluída e bem apetrechada.
texts.en:
Virginia was born in Manhica, the northern district of the province of Maputo. She is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children between the ages of 4 and 14. All of the school-aged children attend public schools in Boane. Virginia only attended school until the seventh grade. She stopped attending due to her parents financial situation. She owns her home and lives there with her husband and children, as well as two grandchildren whom she supports. . She grew up in Boane because her parents left her native district when she was 2 years old. She is a business woman and has owned a shop for the past 23 years. She works alone. Her husband is in the military and works in the Boane barracks earning 4.000,00MT per month. Virginia earns money from her monthly sales, around 3.000,00MT which she uses to support her family. She and her husband are building a cement block home. She has never had a bank loan before. She heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from neighbors and is requesting her third loan, for 13.000,00 for the purchase of construction materials (cement, stones, sand, etc.) Her previous loans were for the same purpose in the amounts of 7.000,00MT and 16.000,00MT, which were paid without any issues. She plans to pay back the loan without incident to be able to access further loans and achieve her goal of seeing her house finished and equipped.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Yesenia Paulina

texts.en:
Our client is Yesenia. She is 19 years-old and unmarried. Yesenia is part of a communal bank consisting of eleven neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco. The group is called Maria Auxilladora, named after the Virgin of Peru. She is a native of San Sebastian, Cusco.

Yesenia has been selling the Oriflame line of beauty products for the last three years. With the loan, she will buy more beauty products to sell.

Yesenia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina P. P. D. O. resiD. en el occidente del país en el departamento D. Morazán. Reina tienen 36 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos D. 18, 17, 13 y 10 años D. edad. Rosa tiene poco tiempo D. haber comenzado con su negocio, donD. invirtió todo lo ahorrado que tenia ella y su esposo, la tienda D. Reina tiene mucha demanda, razón por la cual Reina se ve en la necesidad D. surtir su negocio y así poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que hay muchos productos D. los cuales carece su negocio.
texts.en:
Reina P. P. D. O. lives in the western part of the country in the department of Morazán. Reina is 36 years-old and lives with her husband and their four children, ages 10, 13, 17, and 18. Rosa has only just started her business, in which she has invested all the money she and her husband had saved. Reina's store has a lot of demand, and for this reason she sees the need to stock and expand the business. Doing this will improve her sales, as there are many products that her store currently lacks.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock/expand retail store

loans.name: Amy Lèye

texts.fr: Amy Lèye D. est mariée, 38 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active dans l’élevage ovin et la vente céréalière. Avec ce prêt, elle compte améliorer ses activités afin de satisfaire ses besoins financiers.
texts.en:
Amy Lèye D. is 38 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She works raising sheep and selling cereals. With this loan she plans to improve her business in order to satisfy her financial needs.

Translated from French by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising sheep and small business

loans.name: Moji

texts.en:
Moji is 51 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Moji sells different kinds of wine, juice and table water. With the increased demand for drinks, she plans to expand her business by increasing her stock. She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more wine and juice to sell.

Moji says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wine and juice to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe M. is from the city of Catadman Ozamis City. She is 48 years old. Fe is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Fe prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined GDMPC to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Fe is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which she will use to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita R. is from the village of Mitacas. She is 37 years old. Teresita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a hog raising business for future sale in the local community. Teresita has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed, medicine and additional hogs. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional pigs for hog raising

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of sheet metal and work equipment

loans.name: Tas-Wop N'sorbeh Group

texts.en:
These are members of the Tas-wop N’Sorbeh Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni City in Northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and better profits. As their profit-to-sales-margin increases, they will be in a better position to support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Isatu K.. Isatu was born in a place called Sanda in Northern Sierra Leone. She is 42 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her children attend school – 2 are in primary school and 2 are in secondary school. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 3 years. She sells "gara lappers" (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs), fish, rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) etc. With this loan, Isatu will improve her business by buying the above mentioned items in wholesale quantities to add to her business. 

(Attached to the left of the group photo is a photo of group member who was not present for a group snapshot)

loans.use: Buy white cottons, fish, rice, and palm-oil in wholesale quantities to expand her business

loans.name: Ivette Sorayda

texts.es: Doña Ivette es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 30 años de edad, casada, su esposo trabaja en la compañía movistar, desde hace cuatro años vende pues tiene una pequeña pulpería que , inicio vendiendo helados, luego fresco, gaseosas y ahora golosinas, granos básicos, pero no ha logrado un inventario grande debido a que no tiene el capital suficiente para aumentar su venta es por eso que opto al financiamiento para poder comprar granos, básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, lácteos, y comenzar a captar clientes. Lo que mas desea es poder crecer y llegar a tener su propia casa donde pueda tener una mejor privacidad,  ya que habitan en casa de sus padres lo que espera lograr a largo plazo , junto con Afodenic que gracias a este préstamo iniciara una mejor etapa.
texts.en:
Doña Ivette is a hardworking woman. She is 30 years old and married. Her husband works for Movistar (a cellular phone provider in Latin America). Four years ago, she started a small store where she sells ice cream. She later added cold drinks, sodas, candy, and basic grains. However, she has not able to achieve a large enough inventory because she lacks sufficient capital to increase her sales. For this reason, she is choosing to seek financing to buy basic grains, candy, sodas, and dairy products so that she can attract customers. What she desires most is to grow her business and have a house of her own so that she can have more privacy. Ivette currently lives with her parents and hopes to succeed in the long term. With the loan from AFODENIC, she hopes to begin improvement in the next stage of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
El señor Wilson F. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona  de Sopocachi, de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Wilson  tiene una pequeña librería en su misma zona, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de su vivienda, que por la antigüedad de la misma se encuentra deteriorada.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr Wilson F. lives in his parents' house in the neighborhood of Sopocachi in La Paz. He owns a small bookstore in the same neighborhood and spends his income from it to provide for his family. He will use the requested loan to renovate his house, which is damaged due to age. This is the third time Mr Wilson applies for a loan and our socioeconomic evaluation qualifies him to be granted this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the renovation of his house

loans.name: Kany

texts.fr: Madame Kany G. habite Camberene. Elle est âgée de 49 ans et a adhéré  a la caisse depuis aout 2009. Elle évolue  dans le commerce et vend des légumes  au marche de Camberene. Elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs pour renforcer son commerce. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices  lui permettra de mieux participer a la gestion des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs.Kany G. lives in Camberene. She is 49 years old and a member of the credit union since August 2009. Her business is selling vegetables at the Camberene market. She is seeking a loan of 250,000 West African Franks in order to boost her business. An increased revenue will allow her to take better care of the family budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing business capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sokhom Dong Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhom D. is a villager who lives in Trakit village in Takeo province. She is 49 years old and is a village bank president who has been selected by 20 members. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokhom D. and her husband, Mr. Mon Tes, are farmers who own a plowing machine and a 6-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn income for the family. In order to help with her farming, Mrs. Sokhom D. decided to ask for a loan to buy a wheel to support her plowing machine.  This couple has five children, two of whom are farmers who support the parent's farming, while the three others are students in a public school. All the members are shown in the picture but one of them is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a wheel to support her plowing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua began a web-based used/new clothing company in 2008. In 2009 he took out his first Kiva micro-loan through ACCION USA. In only seven months since his first loan he has already increased his sales by 50%, opened up a storefront, and is now married.

Joshua works full-time in his business and has been able to increase his income. He will continue doing online sales but would like to focus on his storefront and designing a new website.

Joshua will be using his second micro-loan to purchase a new computer that will help him process orders more efficiently, and to purchase new inventory. 


 About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy new inventory and a new computer

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon S. is a 28 year old married woman who lives in Krang Thnong village, in Takeo province. She and her husband, Chantha, own and farm two hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Sokhon is asking for a loan to buy rice seeds.  Aside from family farming, her husband is also a farm laborer and this helps to support his family. This couple has two young pre-school age children.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Keb

texts.en:
Keb T., 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. is a butcher and earns an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed to produce bricks, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. 

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to change jobs and work as a motor-taxi driver.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for her husband to become a taxi driver

loans.name: Rusezera

texts.en: Rusezera is 61 years old and married to a businesswoman.  They have 7 children between the ages of 2 and 35 years. They adopted the two youngest. The eldest child is 35 years old and he has his own small business. Rusezera sells fabric and is a tailor.  His clients may decide to only buy fabric from his shop or they buy fabric and and have Rusezera make different kinds of clothes, such as shirts, dresses, etc. Rusezera needs a loan in order to buy more fabric. With the profits from his business he hopes to put electricity in his house.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Sipaepae

texts.en:
Sipaepae V. is 73 and married with 9 children (ages 34 - 48). She sells taro, which she plants and harvests. Sipaepae has many years of experience in this business.  Sipaepae requests a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Sipaepae joined SPBD. This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Sipaepae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, who are in school.  Christine has a poultry farm, which she has had for 3 years as a business.  

To help expand her business, Christine is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy supplies for the poultry farm.  Christine hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to produce more and earn income for her family.  In the future, Christine hopes to open up additional types of businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the poultry farm

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been practising mixed farming for fifteen years in the town of Nyamira in Western Kenya. He has employed one farmhand. He sells his milk, tea, maize and beans locally. He also earns income from his lumber business.

Andrew is 54 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are now between the ages of 19 and 38. Five of the children are currently attending school.

Andrew has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from this loan will help him to buy fertilizers, that will increase his production, and to pay the school fees for his children.

His biggest challenges have been animal diseases, lack of enough animal feed and fertilizers. He hopes to purchase more land and at least 7 dairy cows in the future. He says that Juhudi has the potential of improving the lives of people from the grassroots.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong T. N. is 45 years old and lives with her family in Luc Canh hamlet. Her two children are still going to high school.

After losing her job in 2006, Huong borrowed money to invest in raising livestock. She is currently raising 300 chickens for eggs which she sells to generate a daily income.

Participating in the loan program since 2006, Huong has always repaid on time. She needs to borrow 5,886,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Sarun S., 21, is married and resides with her husband and young child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. She sells clothes at a local market for an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of USD 4 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more clothes to stock her store and to attract more customers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more clothes  to sell

loans.name: Yosein Sander

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de San Sebastian en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  es el Sr. Sander; El socio tiene 17 años de edad;  él es soltero  y viene desde hace 2 años trabajando como taxista,  el socio tiene un automóvil que presta servicios de taxi, el termino de pagar sus letras y ya es su auto propio y ahora requiere el dinero para repintar su carro, debido a que como es un carro de segunda mano necesita algunos pequeños acabados, ahora que ya pago sus letras y el carro le pertenece y no debe una sola letra el quiere ponerlo casi como nuevo,  el socio cumplira la mayoría de edad en el mes de enero del año que viene el  socio tiene el aval de su hermano mayor dentro del banco comunal. El socio solicita el préstamo para repintar su unidad de taxi.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner is a member of the “MUJERES UNIDAS” ("United Women") loan group, based in the district of San Sebastian in the Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Sander is 17 years old and single. He has been working as a taxi driver for two years. He owns a car that he uses to provide taxi services. He has finished paying for it so it is fully his. He now needs money to repaint it, because as a second hand vechicle it requires a few final touches. Now that it's his, he wants to make it look as good as new. The partner will turn 18 in January next year. He has his brother's backing within the loan group. Sander is requesting the loan to repaint his taxi cab. 

The partner is grateful for the loan, values it highly, and is committed to repaying it in the terms agreed.

loans.use: The partner requests the loan to repaint his taxi cab.

loans.name: Wilber Antonio

texts.es: El joven Wilber tiene 25 años, es casado y tiene1 hijo a su cargo. El señor  se dedica a la comercialización de artesanías, el tiene que visitar diferentes lugares para ofrecer sus productos y obtener una variedad de clientes que le compren sus artesanías, el sale todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues este ingreso inicio como una fuente de trabajo necesaria para su familia. El ya tiene 6 años de  dedicarse a esta actividad, a pesar de las dificultades que enfrento para mantenerlo activo. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de artesanía y para la exportación de los productos. Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para trasladar el producto ya que actualmente tiene que transportar las artesanías a través de los buses.
texts.en: Young Wilber is 25 years old, married, and has a child to support.  He sells handicrafts. He has to visit different places to offer his products and to get a number of customers to buy his handicrafts.   He sells every day from 7 in the morning until 9 at night, as this is a source of income he needs to support his family.  He has already worked for 6 years in this trade, and in spite of the difficulties he has faced he has managed to keep the business going.  The reason for this loan is to purchase and export handicraft products.  His dream is to buy a vehicle to transport his products, since he must now transport his handicrafts by taking buses.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Mr. Kosal K. and his wife, Mrs. Sakun Tit, live along the No. 1 national road, approximately 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of the children are in school and assist their parents when they are not at school.

Kosal and his wife are vegetable farmers. They grow gourds, green beans, and lotus on their farm in the village. They sell their produce to a middleman in the village. The couple hopes to continue increasing their productivity so Kosal is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. Besides of farming, Kosal also does construction work. 

Photo: Mr. Kosal K. and his wife.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 36 años, convive con Flor, de 35 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, todos menores de edad; a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa Centro Huachirik. El trabajo al que se dedica Samuel, es la agricultura, ya tiene 14 años dedicándose a ello y como buen agricultor, todas las mañanas hasta la puesta del sol; se dirige a sus plantaciones de café, palta, plátano. Los que según sus propias palabras, requieren de mucho cuidado, ya que la maleza que crece entre los cultivo dificulta su crecimiento, también tienen que cuidar de las plagas de insectos que constantemente asota el lugar. Pero a pesar de eso se siente “feliz”, de estar en el campo y cuando llega la cosecha; se dirige al mercado central de su ciudad donde vende sus productos a buen precio. Ahora el está juntando dinero; para poder poner una tienda de comestibles en su casa y de esa manera obtener mayores ingresos. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se siente agradecido por el apoyo que le dio su banco comunal, donde puede integrarse, para que pueda salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá obtener 8 sacos de abono orgánico, para esparcir en sus plantaciones de café que cosechará dentro de algunos meses.
texts.en:
Samuel, 36, cohabits with Flor, 35.  They have five minor children that are cared for and educated in their own home located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik.

Samuel has been a farmer for 14 years.  As a good farmer, he goes out every morning until dusk to tend to his coffee, banana and avocado crops all of which, according to him, require a lot of care because the weeds that grow among them impede their growth and he also has to protect them from the constant insect infestations that are common in the area.

Despite all this he feels “happy” to be in the countryside and when harvest time comes he heads to his city’s central market to sell all his products at good prices.

He is now saving money to set up a grocery store in his home to earn higher income.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the help his communal bank gave him where he can interact to get ahead.

He will use the requested loan to buy 8 sacks of organic manure to spread among his coffee plants that will be harvested in a few months.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: Hok S., 29, is married to Sophal, 30, and they are villagers in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Hok S. is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. She and her husband trek sometimes through the village seeking bamboo and take them home and then put them into water for almost a week. After that, they dry them in the sunshine for three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces and then she and her husband start making them into baskets. This couple was married a few years ago, but they have only one lovely child. Currently, Hok S. wants to invest in her business in a bigger size than present, but she is lacking some capital to run it well. So Hok S. would like to request a loan to purchase more baskets for selling.

loans.use: To purchase more baskets for selling.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta Paradeo is a married woman who lives in Barangay Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  buying and selling fruit and selling Avon products.  Her husband Pepito, who is 47 years old, earns a living as a carpenter and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have three children between 5 to 12 years old. 

Vicenta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vicenta  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital for fruit-selling and for livestock.  This will allow her to continue to save for the future education of her children.  Vicenta Paradeo is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through this program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund fruit-selling and livestock

loans.name: Queta

texts.es: Queta, de 53 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. El restaurante de Queta esta ubicado en una de las calles principales de la ciudad de Tarma, el cual es muy concurrido por las personas, debido a lo sabroso de la comida y a la variedad de platos que ofrece al publico, lo cual a hecho que su restaurante, sea uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta es atender a sus clientes y le gusta hacerlo bien, puesto que sabe que una buena atención hará que vuelvan pronto, lleva 4 año y medio cocinando para sus clientes y lo más difícil para ella es atender al mismo tiempo a todas las personas que asisten a su restaurante, espera poder mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio en el futuro y así poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta segura de poder hacerlo, al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, en su banco comunal siente que esta realizando una buena labor y que le tienen mucho respeto por la puntualidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, renovará sus utensilios de cocina y arreglará mejor el ambiente de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Queta, 52, is an unassuming, hard working woman living in her own house; what she most wants is to get ahead in life.  

Queta’s restaurant is located on one of Tarma’s main streets.  It is very popular with people due to the tasty preparation of her dishes and the variety of dishes she offers to the public.  This has make the restaurant one of the best known in the city.

What she enjoys the most is taking care of her customers and she likes to do a good job of it because she knows that good attention leads to repeat visits.  She has been cooking for her customers for four and a half years and the most difficult part of it for her is having to tend to all the customers who come to the restaurant at the same time.  She hopes to improve the restaurant’s infrastructure in the future so that she can provide better customer service.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she is aware that she must repay on time and is sure she will be able to do so just as she’s done with her previous loans.  She feels that she is doing a good job in her communal bank and that she is respected because of her punctuality.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to renew her kitchen utensils and fix up the restaurant’s ambience.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and refurbish her restaurant.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Cheikh N. societaire  est un commerçant qui habite à Nguéniene. En effet monsieur N. s’active dans la vente de piéces détachées avec comme lieu de vente les marchés hebdomadaires de Ngéniene, Sandiara, Thiadiaye, Mbafaye, Ndiaganiao... etc.
texts.en: Cheikh N. is a member who is a merchant living in Ngueniene. Mr. N. currently has a business selling spare parts in the weekly markets of Ngeniene, Sandiara, Thiadiaye, Mbafaye, Ndiaganiao, etc.

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 34 years old. Marlyn is married. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marlyn works hard for family. She hopes for her farm to be productive always.

Marlyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva S. is from the village of Tinagaan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Oliva is separated from spouse and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Oliva owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Oliva has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Oliva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Oliva is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Oliva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snacks food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mufariji Group

texts.fr: Salamu W.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Mufariji, âgée de 31 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants. Son conjoint est un petit commerçant. La  cliente  Salamu W. fait également le petit commerce de divers. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans les affaires. Ils ont un magasin dans le centre commercial de Birere - Ville de Goma. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Vers 2009, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (savon Omo, lait de beauté, souliers, casseroles, valises, habits, lait Nido,  sardines, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise et construire des maisons à mettre à location. La cliente Salamu W.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Mufariji est constitué de 15 membres.
texts.en:
Salamu W., age 31, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's an entrepreneur, and the leader of the Mufariji group. Her husband is a retailer. Salamu W. also retails various products, and she and her husband help each other in business. They have a store at the Birere shopping center in the city of Goma.

She's been running this business for three years. Around 2009, she received her first loan from Kiva's partner, Hekima MFI, in order to bolster her capital. This new loan will be used to buy new supplies ("Omo" soap, beauty milk, shoes, saucepans, suitcases, clothing, "Nido" milk, sardines, etc.). Furthermore, she ambitions to ensure the future of her business and build houses to rent.

Salamu W. thanks Hekima for its actions targeting poor women who do not get access to loans from regular banks. The Mufariji group comprises 15 members.

loans.use: to buy soap, beauty milk, shoes, saucepans, suitcases, etc

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 34 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Socímo de 38 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo, Haydee trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra flores, ya que estos productos se están vendiendo muy bien en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus flores, hasta el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Haydée is 34 years old, a friendly, hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband Sócimo, who is 38 years old, and her 4 beloved children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.  Together with her husband, Haydée works daily in her fields.  By dint of hard work, she has made her land highly productive, so that she sows all kinds of seeds, knowing that the product will be high quality.  She grows mostly flowers, since these sell nicely in the market.  What she likes most about her work is protecting her plants from insects.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and finds that the hardest part is transporting her flowers to the Tarma wholesale market, where she sells her products.  For the future of her business, she hopes to accumulate funds sufficient to set up a stall in the wholesale market, since at present she carries her goods around.  This is her third loan with MFP, and she believes that the loan will help her greatly to develop her business.  She is a responsible member of her communal bank, and she is proud of this.  She will use the two thousand new soles to improve her crops, buying sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Bunnary

texts.en: Mrs. Bunnary was born in 1967.  She is married to Mr. Sarun, with whom she has five children.  One repairs speakers, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are studying in a local public school.  She sells coffee, ice, and Khmer cake, through which she earns some income to support her family.  Her husband is a construction worker. At this time, she wants to start a new business, but she does not have enough money to begin. So Mrs. Bunnary is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 47 years old and is a married woman. She has a 9-year-old child.

Elsie is a farmer and has been growing rice for 11 years. She earns about 6,000 PHP per month from this farming. She also owns cows that help in plowing the field. Elsie works hard to earn for her family. She also wants her child to someday finish college and find a decent job.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past two years, he has operated a Kinyozi (barber shop) where his potential customers are neighbours and community members. Harrison faces a major challenge of power black-outs in his business. He dreams of prospering and establishing a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a hair-cutting machine and an electric extension. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a hair-cutting machine and an electric extension.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is a 58-year-old married woman. Pilar has three children. Pilar's spouse works as a carpenter.

Pilar has been in the business of hog raising for 15 years. Each month Pilar earns PHP 7,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase additional pigs to raise and to buy building materials to renovate the pigpen.

Pilar has been a client of ASKI for 15 years. In the future, Pilar would like earn consistent profits and provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise and to buy building materials to renovate the pigpen.

loans.name: Jose Alfonso

texts.es:
José, tiene 42 años de edad, es originario del Sauce municipio de León, pero vive en Estelí hace mas de 10 años, el es comerciante, se dedica a la compra y venta de granos básicos, es padre de 4 hijos. Antes se dedicaba a la agricultura en el Sauce, pero después se vino a vivir  a  Estelí, ahí trabajo en una zapatería, al transcurrir el tiempo los años se dedico a la compra y venta de granos básicos , además en su tiempo libre trabaja como taxista que son otra fuente de ingresos que el tiene. El viaja a los pueblos de Yali, La Concordia, La Rica  para vender sus productos.     
El solicito el préstamo para comprar granos básicos tales como frijol y maíz. El espera que esta inversión mejores sus ventas, puede hacer mas clientes, abrir nuevas rutas de ventas para expandir su negocio en otros pueblos aledaños y tener mas producto que ofrecer. En sus planes futuros esta comprar ganado, quiere ir ahorrando para el futuro profesional de sus hijos.
texts.en: José is 42 years old and is a native of El Sauce, located in the Municipality of León.  However, he has lived in Estelí for over ten years.  He is the father of four children and is a merchant who works buying and selling basic grains.  Previously, he worked in farming in El Sauce but he later went to Estelí, where he worked at a cobbler’s shop.  Over time, he began to work buying and selling basic grains and in his spare time, he works as a taxi driver, which serves as another source of income.  He travels to the towns of Yali, La Concordia and La Rica to sell his products.  He is requesting the loan to buy basic grains such as beans and corn.  He hopes that with this loan, his sales will improve, he will gain more customers, open more sales routes to expand his business into other neighboring towns, and that he will have more products to sell.  His future plans include buying cattle and to save money for his children’s’ future as professionals.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as beans and corn.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a resident of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. He is aged 22 and married with one child aged one. He has been in active farming for four years, his farm producing  tea and milk which go to the local market.

Evans has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase a motorcycle and venture into the transport business. He says the business is lucrative and he remains hopeful the venture will pay for the loan and provide the family with basic needs.

He points at rampant disease outbreaks as the main challenge in the farming industry and his main threat that has lead him to try the transport industry.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Juvie

texts.en: Juvie, 33 years old and a resident of Lopez Jaenais, is married and has four children. For the past two years Juvie has been selling a variety of products in her general store to earn a living, realizing a PHP 3000 profit each month. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan of 20000 to purchase more goods for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her general store.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda  es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
Desde hace cinco años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo solicitado fue por la suma de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio de venta de comidas.  Paralelamente se dedica  a la venta de pan.
Hermelinda solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de  S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar ocho sacos de harina, leña y transporte para el traslado de los insumos.  Nos cuenta que realiza sus ventas en la localidad de Desaguadero, Ilave y Juli.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja  en el Municipio.
Su sueño es tener su casa propia y así dar comodidades a su familia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es ahorrar y obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Community Bank “Medalla Milagrosa”, located in the Pomata district, Chucuito province and the department of Puno. She is 43 years old, married and has 5 school-age children.  She studied through secondary school. 

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 5 years, her first loan was 300 soles, which she invested in her business selling food. She also sells bread.   

Hermelinda is requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles, money that she will use to buy 8 sacks of flour, firewood and transportation for the transfer of goods.  She tells us that she makes her sales in the town of Desaguadero, Llave and Juli.  In the business her children help her and her husband, who works in the Municipality.

Her dream is to have her own house and thus give comfort to her family.  What she likes about the Community Bank is earning and saving money.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of flour, firewood and transportation for the transfer of goods.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 24 years old and married to Patricia. They are blessed with one child aged one year. Paul has been running a restaurant for the past year with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.
 
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add a stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and purchase a television set for his restaurant. 

With the anticipated profit from his business he will construct his own house and relocate his family. His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and construct a big restaurant in his home town.

loans.use: To add a stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, and purchase a television set.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Mrs. Ek is a widow. She is a 38 years old and has four children. Three of them are attending school and live under her roof but another son is working as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh city where he can earn a suitable salary per month. Presently, her occupation is farming in Bary District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. 

Apart from her farming activity, Ek also earns additional income by raising pigs. Ek wants to buy several pigs, but she lacks money.  So Ek decided to request some funds from Kiva in order to purchase piglets. Her future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least a Bachelor's degree for her children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de reunirse con los encargados de la Fundación para interiorizarse sobre el programa de mujeres emprendedoras, el cual les resultó muy interesante por los beneficios que les otorgaría. De allí surge el comité que  lleva por nombre Mujeres Unidas,  ellas se han caracterizado por la unidad en el grupo, su dinamismo y respeto mutuo quienes por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el  séptimo ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 15 señoras emprendedoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de bebidas, gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles todo lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. Comenta que tiene mucha demanda, en especial los fines de semana, pues es cuando tiene más clientes.
