Dentro de sus proyectos está tener una bodega de bebidas con mayor espacio y variedad de productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de vinos, whiskys, energizantes y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecer su local y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, some women gathered together with the goal of meeting with the managers of the Foundation (Fundación Paraguaya) in order to familiarize themselves with the program for entrepreneurial women, which proved to be very interesting to them for the benefits that it would offer them. From there arose the communal bank that took "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) for its name. They have distinguished themselves by the unity of their group, their dynamism, and their mutual respect, which through this undertaking strengthened the ties among them. Now they are in their seventh loan cycle, with excellent standing. The group is formed by 15 entrepreneurial women, who give the best of themselves to increase their income and therefore offer the best to their respective families.

Señora Maria sells beverages. Thanks to this work, she has been able to raise her family and offer them everything they need for a respectable and decent life. She comments that she has a lot of demand, especially on weekends, which is when she has the most customers. Among her plans is to have a beverage shop with more space and a greater variety of products. She is applying for the loan for the purchase of wines, whiskey, energy drinks, and other items, with which she will stock her shop and in this way be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy beer, whiskey, wine and other items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Irene tiene 40 años de edad, cuenta con una Pequeña tienda en donde vende calzado, ropa nueva, cosméticos, productos agropecuarios e insumos para la caficultura,  su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, con las ganancias que le genera dicha actividad percibe ingresos para cubrir las necesidades y obligaciones que tiene en su hogar, esta casada y es madre de 3 hijos los cuales estudian en centros educativos de su comunidad. 
La Sra. Maria Irene utilizara el credito para comprar mercaderia y asi surtirlo, ya que por los momentos no cuenta con el efectivo suficiente para realizar las compras de mercadería y agro insumos.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y darles una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Irene is 40 years old and has a small store where she sells shoes, new clothing, cosmetics, agricultural products, and supplies for growing coffee. Her business is located in her home. With the earnings she generates, Maria is able to cover her needs and household obligations. She is married and the mother of three children who attend schools in her community.

Sra. Maria Irene will utilize this loan to buy merchandise to restock her store. At the moment, she does not have enough cash to make purchases of merchandise and farming supplies. Her goals are to grow her business and to provide a good quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair conditioners, light bulbs, shoes, insecticides, and honey.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you Fatmata, a small scale entrepreneur from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. A native of Makali village, near Magburaka, Fatmata is 47 year old. She is married to a health worker and the couple has 7 children – 2 in primary school and 5 in secondary school. Fatmata sells plastic bowls, dishes, cloths, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Fatmata has requested this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, dishes, cloths, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 41 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living, he sells curios. He has been in the business for 10 years. He also does poultry farming for more income generation. Robert works hard in his business so as to provide for the family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business. His desire is to expand his business and get enough income to build his own home. Robert has requested 50,000 KES to buy wood carvings.

loans.use: To buy wood carvings

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Jenny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines. She has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Jenny has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns income from fattening pigs. Jenny aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Yolanda tiene 31 años de edad y es casada tiene fruto de eta linda relación tienen cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Ollantaytambo y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Yolanda es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras más. Yolanda tiene una tienda de abarrotes y esta implementada con necesidades básicas. 

 Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Yolanda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria como productos de primera ósea sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y muchas cosas más. 
  
Yolanda agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the 'Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo' community bank.  The bank's meetings take place once a month in the town of Ollantaytambo, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Yolanda is 31 years old, married, and has four children from this beautiful relationship.  She was born in the town of Ollantaytambo and lives in the town in which she was born.  This is also where she carries out her business activities.  Yolanda's main business activity is selling basic household products such as rice, sugar, etc.  She has a grocery store which is stocked with basic products.

Yolanda has been in this business for one year and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Yolanda needs a loan to buy basic household products (bags of rice, bags of sugar and many other products).  She is grateful for the loan and appreciates it.  She pledges to make her monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy basic household products for her store

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph used his previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. He planted during the planting season. The harvest was very profitable.

This will be his seventh loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy spraying chemicals and fertilizer for use in this planting season.

In the future, Joseph hopes to improve his farming methods and increase his income, thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her parents and sibling. She has been working as a private teacher since 2006. She welcomes students at her house. She also started working in a local school almost one year ago. 

Zeina is requesting a loan for $1,100 from Ameen s.a.l., which she will use to prepare a special teaching room in her house and add equipment  such as tables and walls in order to be able to receive more students. She will also purchase diverse educational tools.

loans.use: to prepare a special teaching room in her house and purchase equipment and diverse educational tools.

loans.name: Ega

texts.en:
Ega is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Ega has operated as a small-scale farmer for the past six years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of owning a large-scale farm in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase seedlings and farm products and hire laborers to help her cultivate her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and farm products and hire laborers to help her cultivate her farm.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Víctor trabaja como carpintero. El crédito que solicita es para compra de material (madera, venesta, cola, etc.) ya que se le presento un trabajo muy importante y necesita reemplazar la madera. Víctor es divorciado y tiene dos hijos .Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona  de San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la quinta vez que solicita que su crédito sea financiado a través de Kiva. Es cliente antiguo desde el año 2009.
texts.en: Víctor works as a carpenter.  The loan he’s requesting is to buy materials (lumber, fiber board, glue, etc.) because he’s gotten a very important job and needs to replace the wood.  Víctor is divorced and has two children.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.  This is the fifth time he’s asked that his loan be financed through Kiva.  He’s been a longstanding client since 2009.

loans.use: to buy lumber, fiber board and glue.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, 55, has been in farming for 12 solid years within her hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya.  She is married with 5 children of whom four are in school.

Gladys has requested a loan of 50,000 KES.  She intends to use 20,000 KES to construct a dairy cow's pen and the remaining 30,000 KES to boost her milk retail business by buying milk container cooling equipment to ensure that no waste is incurred and that no milk goes bad before delivery to the market.

Gladys laments of poor roads network and high costs of inputs.

loans.use: To construct cow pen and to buy milk cooling containers.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer alegre, emprendedora con ganas de superación. Es separada, pero vive con su hijo de 10 años de edad y su familia, por los cuales se esfuerza en salir adelante,  habitando cómodamente en la casa de sus padres. El trabajo que realiza Eliza, es la compra y venta de ropa y zapatos para damas, caballeros  y niños de diversas modelos, los cuales los distribuye a crédito, entre sus vecinas y amistades, contando con muchos clientes. Esta actividad la realiza en la puerta de su casa, entrega a domicilio y en ocasiones de manera ambulante. Ya lleva como 8 años en este negocio, tiempo  en lo cual se hizo conocida por la calidad de prendas que vende, y lo realiza sola. Lo que le gusta de esta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico, pues no tienen competencia por su zona y eso le da más ganancias. Se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones y le ha sacado de muchos apuros económicos, tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando y poder ampliar su negocio. Este sería el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad brindada de poder contar con un préstamo, para lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues  considera a sus miembros ser personas responsable y solidaria. Con el dinero solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará mayor cantidad de ropa femenina, y masculina, en diversos modelos  que están a la  moda.
texts.en: Eliza, 36 years old, is a happy woman, an entrepreneur wanting to excel. She is separated but living with her 10 year old son and her family, which is why she strives to move forward, living comfortably in the home of her parents. Eliza buys and sells clothes and shoes for ladies, gentlemen and children from various models, which she distributes on credit amongst her neighbors and friends, counting many customers. This activity is carried out from her home, home delivery and sometimes walking. She's been in the business for 8 years, time in which she has become known for the quality of garments sold and that it is performed alone. What she likes about this activity is that it generates income and she does not have competition in the area, giving her more profit. She is happy because it has brought her much satisfaction and has taken her from many economic hardships; she has the desire to continue working and to expand her business. This would be the 10th loan with the MFP institution; she is very pleased with the opportunity afforded to her, for which she agrees to be punctual with her payments. Also, she feels comfortable with her communal bank because its members are considered to be responsible and caring people. With the money requested of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy a larger quantity of feminine and masculine, in various models that are in style.

loans.use: to purchase more women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Originally from Venezuela, Roberto came to the United States about a year ago. He works at a company that provides heavy machinery and spare parts to Venezuela, Panama, and Paraguay. With his knowledge in commercial transport and his contacts in Venezuela, he decided to start his own logistics company in 2011. His background in the industry has helped him buy equipment such as car parts, motors, and forklifts to send to his home country for an affordable price. He hopes that his business will continue to grow so that he can provide for his family.
Roberto is happy that Kiva partner Accion USA worked with him in the beginning to help establish his credit, and now he is using this loan to build on the credit. This loan provided him with the capital to purchase more inventory, which, in turn, will help expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and build his credit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nurhandayani

texts.en:
Nurhandayani, a member of MBK, is requesting for a loan of $125. She runs a business that sells woven mat to families in her village on monthly installment payment plans. With this loan she will be able to purchase more woven mats. A mat costs IDR50,000 which she will sell under this plan at IDR100,000. Repayments will be made monthly.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Selling mats

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 27 years old. She has two children and is awaiting her third. She works in retail, selling pottery. She travels daily to San Cristobal de las Casas (having to transfer busses twice) to arrive where she sells her products to the city people. With this loan, she plans to buy additional merchandise for her store in order to increase her sales and to contribute to her family income. Alicia is part of the Grupo P. 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

ALICIA TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD ,2 HIJOS Y ESTA ESPERANDO EL TERCERO, SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA - VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE ALFARERIA, VIAJA DIARIAMENTE A SAN CRISTOBAL DELAS CASAS USANDO DOS TRANSPORTES PARA LOGRAR LLEGAR AL LUGAR EN DONDE ELLA VENDE SUS PRODUCTOS A LA GENTE DE LA CIUDAD . CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERA COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA SU LOCAL Y AUMENTAR LAS VENTAS Y PODER CONTRIBUIR CON EL GASTO FAMILIAR.ALICIA PERTENECE AL GRUPO P. 1.

loans.use: ALFARERIA

loans.name: Cesar Rafael

texts.es:
Cesar Rafael is a young entrepreneur and married with two young children. Five years ago he inherited from his father a factory producing pants and jean-made products. Little by little he is growing the business and improving the quality of his products. He now employs three people to help keep up with his client's demands.

In order to increase his production his machines need maintenance and repair. Right now, he has a very large order and would like to finish it in time. For this reason he asks for a loan of 1,200 dollars, which he will pay off in 6 months. Take part in the growth of the business and in the well-being of this family. They greatly appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Cesar Rafael es un joven emprendedor, está casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Hace cinco años heredó de su padre una maquiladora en la que elaboran pantalones y cortes de mezclilla, poco a poco ha estado creciendo y mejorando la calidad de sus productos, ahora ya cuenta con la ayuda de tres empleados para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.

Para pode incrementar su producción necesita darle mantenimiento y reparar las máquinas que utiliza, actualmente tiene un pedido muy grande y quiere poder terminarlo a tiempo, por esta razón ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio y en el bienestar de esta familia, gracias por tu apoyo.

loans.use: Machine maintenance and repair

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suardani

texts.id:
Mrs. Ketut Suardani's business is the rearing of two sows. She is 32 years old and has been breeding pigs since the year 2000. Mrs. Ketut Suardani makes time to go to their stall every day, 2 hours in the morning, 2 hours in the early afternoon, and 2 hours in the late afternoon. She starts by feeding the pigs, cleaning their stalls, and finally nursing the piglets. With two sows, Mrs. Ketut Suardani can produce 40 piglets in one year. One piglet sells for 150,000 Rupiah. Gross proceeds can approach as high as six million rupiah per year. Even though her room is very simple, it is her own. Mrs. Ketut Suardanai lives together with her husband and two children. The loan from Dinari will be used to add to her livestock rearing business, adding one sow.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Memelihara 2 induk babi merupakan usaha Ibu Ketut Suardani. Ibu yang berusia 32 tahun ini mulai beternak babi lokal sejak tahun 2000. Ibu Ketut Suardani meluangkan waktunya setiap hari 2 jam di pagi hari, 2 jam disiang hari dan 2 jam lagi pada sore hari dikandang babinya. Mulai dari memberi makan babi, membersihkan kandang hingga merawat anak babi. Dengan 2 ekor induk babi Ibu Ketut Suardani bisa memproduksi 40 ekor anak ( bibit ) dalam satu tahunnya. Satu ekor bibit babi dijual Rp.150.000,-. Keuntungan kotor bisa didapatkannya sebesar Rp. 6.000.000, pertahunnya. Meskipun rumahnya sederhana itu adalah rumahnya sendiri. Ibu Ketut Suardani tinggal bersama suaminya dan 2 orang anaknya. Pinjaman dari Dinari digunakan untuk menambah ternak peliharaannya berupa 1 ekor induk babi.

loans.use: Increase piglet litter - Menambah bibit penginduk

loans.name: Clorinda

texts.es:
Clorinda is 42 years old and the mother of two children. Through her life she has conducted herself as a hardworker and a very good traveling salesperson. It's not only important to her that she gains customers, but that she establishes a connection of friendship with each person. Thanks to her friendly service, she was able to enter the market of Huancayo and Jauja where she brings her blankets to sell, offering payment plans to her customers. After a lot of time and many hours of work, she continues to build her business and wants to expand to a new project, buying and selling spare parts with her husband. To begin the construction of this project they need to buy some tools for the first phase. Thanks to his work as a driver, her husband understands the basics of mechanics. With two small children at home, this couple has decided to go after activities which will enable them to improve the quality of life for the family. For that reason, Clorinda is requesting a loan to increase the number of blankets she can offer for sale, growing her income and getting closer to the day when they can construct a small space from which they can sell the spare parts. We count on your kind contributions to help this couple as they continue to work hard to better their lives.

Clorinda tiene 42 años y es una admirable madre de familia que en el transcurso de su vida se ha conducido como una excelente dama trabajadora y una muy buena vendedora ambulante; que más que adquirir clientes se preocupa por entablar lazos de amistad con cada una de las personas que acuden a ella por algún servicio.Gracias a ello pudo ingresar al mercado de Huancayo y Jauja a donde lleva sus frazadas y las comercializa dando facilidades de pagos quincenales a sus clientes.Después de mucho tiempo y de horas interminables de trabajo aún ahora sigue esforzándose con el propósito de trabajar en un nuevo proyecto de compra y venta de repuestos mecánicos en compañía de su querido esposo; para iniciar la construcción de este sueño desean comprarse un torno como herramienta de trabajo como primer paso de implementación ya que gracias a su oficio de chofer tiene conocimientos básicos de mecánica. Contando con dos pequeños en casa esta pareja de esposos ha decidido incursionar en cuanta actividad se les presenta para procurarles bienestar a cada uno de los miembros de su familia.Y es así que Clorinda para seguir con la elaboración de su proyecto y la manutención de su hogar solicita un préstamo con el propósito de incrementar el número de frazadas que ofrece a fin de elevar el nivel de vida de sus queridos hijos y hacer más cercano el día de la construcción del pequeño espacio de ventas de artículos mecánicos.Contamos con vuestra gentil contribución para aminorar la carga de un matrimonio que sigue luchando para establecerse y ubicar una mejor ocupación.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE BLANKETS WHICH SHE SELLS IN THE MARKET, INCREASING HER INCOME AND ALLOWING HER AND HER HUSBAND TO INVEST IN ANOTHER SMALL BUSINESS.

loans.name: Sady Yanina

texts.en:
Sady leads a very busy life as a “feriante.” Constantly traveling back and forth between the city and rural countryside, she buys and sells a wide assortment of products. The majority of these products are clothes, such as jackets and blouses, which are purchased in the city and sold in the country.  There are no stores of any kind in the country, leaving the rural populations to depend on feriantes like Sady for all their purchases. This is why, every single day, Sady makes the 2 hour trip to the country with a large load of clothing. She carries mostly smaller items such as blouses and skirts because it allows her to carry much larger quantities, which allows her to sell to a much larger client base.

For the past 2 years, Sady has been involved in the “feriante” business. Her mother is involved in the same trade, buying and selling a special type of colorful skirt, traditional to Ayacucho, Peru. Sady passionately explains that the motivation to continue working so hard everyday in such an incredibly tiring profession comes from her two children. She diligently saves her money in the bank in anticipation of funding the education of her 1 and 4 year old all the way through university. Education is the most important gift Sady could possibly give to her sons, she explains, and the only way to surpass poverty in the long run. Professionally, Sady is working towards opening a clothing store in the city of Ayacucho. This has been a dream of hers for some time now and would allow her to travel less and spend more time with her children as they grow up. 

Sady has been involved in her village bank for the past 2 years, ever since she was invited by her mother, who has been taking out loans from there for more than 10 years. Apart from the huge economic help the bank has provided, she loves the knowledge she has gained from the weekly classes and all the friendships she has made. Sady is currently requesting a loan of $300. With this money she will buy even larger quantities of clothing to sell, allowing her to generating a larger client base and ultimately a larger profit.

loans.use: To buy even larger quantities of clothing to sell

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: My name is Naseem A. H.. I am married and have seven children: four boys and three girls. Currently, three of my kids attend school. I have lived all my life in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. My husband is a butcher and sells meat. Along with this he also sells livestock. Currently, we require a loan to buy a cow. I have few other women in my loan group. Rukkiah B. needs a loan for her dairy business. Jameela B. plans to use this loan for her crockery business. Salma B. requires a loan to buy a cow. Tahira B. also plans to buy a cow. All the members in my loan group are very responsible and cooperate with me in every unit meeting.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Aladdin

texts.en: Aladdin (his wife is pictured) was born in 1959. He is married and has 2 children. The R. family lives in Khachmaz region. 6 years ago they started this business. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy a cow to get more milk and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es:
Over time the walls in my house have deteriorated . I would like to repair them before they start to fall in pieces, and most of all for the security of my family. I request $1000 in order to make these reparations to my house.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by NIkita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer,

“Con el tiempo las paredes de mi casa se has ido deteriorando me gustaría repararlas antes de que se empiecen a caer en pedazos, más que nada por la seguridad de mi familia” Solicito $ 1000.00 dlls para reparar las paredes de mi vivienda

loans.use: To repair the walls of my home.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha runs a mini-market in the Yacot community of Santo Domingo. Each day she receives visits from hundreds of customers who want to purchase different kinds of products, ranging from fresh chicken meat, rice, beans, and vegetable oil to bread, peanut butter and the like. Her store also offers alcoholic and energizing drinks.

Bertha plans on using her loan to purchase more products so that she can significantly increase the sales volume and her revenue. That way, the entrepreneur will be able to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase of a lot of goods for her little grocery store

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Sr. Mario Goiri is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the city of Caaguazú. A few years ago, Mario worked in a carpenter's shop where he learned the skills to become a carpenter himself. He worked hard to save a small amount of capital, enough to start his own carpentry business.

He has owned this business since 1991. He makes fine furniture such as beds with turned legs and headboards, carved beds, carved wardrobes, laminate wardrobes, cabinets, chests of drawers, and dining room sets.

Because of the quality and range of his products, he has built up a regular clientele. The loan requested will be used to buy hardware such as nails, locks, wrenches, and adhesive so he can continue responding to the many requests of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Mario Goiri de 31 años de edad es soltero, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Caaguazú. Hace unos años atrás, Mario fue empleado de una carpintería, en donde adquirió suficiente experiencia para ejercer esta profesión. Con trabajo él fué ahorrando hasta obtener capital mínimo pero suficiente para emprender su propia carpintería.

Desde el año 1.991, Mario, posee su carpintería y se dedica a fabricar finos muebles como: camas torneadas, camas talladas, roperos tallados y formicados, placares, cómodas y juegos de comedores.

Gracias a la calidad y variedad de sus productos tiene una clientela bien formada. El crédito que solicita fue para comprar artículos de ferretería como clavos, cerraduras, llaves y pegamento para poder seguir abasteciendo la amplia demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy nails, locks, wrenches, and adhesive.

loans.name: Nofisatu

texts.en: Nofisatu A. is a local trader; she goes door-to-door selling powder and earrings. she has been in this business for the past 5 years. She is 38 years old and is married with two children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She needs a loan of $275 to buy more powder and earrings to sell. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more powder and earrings to sell

loans.name: Bilibark

texts.fr:
Mr. Bilibark B. was born on August 7th, 1981 in Lomé. He is single and a young man who is working hard to make a future for himself. In 2005, he started a business selling charcoal in his area. Thanks to his considerable energy, he was able to become a wholesaler for numerous charcoal sellers in the Adidogomé market.

His goal is to expand his clientele, and to do so he would like to increase his stock. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to buy 50 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Pamela Poole, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur B. Bilibark est né le 07 août 1981 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et est un jeune qui se bat beaucoup pour son avenir. En 2005, il a commencé le commerce de vente de charbon de bois dans son quartier. Ayant assez d’énergie il est devenu grossiste pour bon nombres de revendeuses de charbons du marché d’Adidogomé.

Ayant pour objectif d’étendre sa clientèle, elle désire augmenter son stock et sollicite à cet effet ce premier crédit pour acheter 50 sacs de charbons de bois.

loans.use: Purchase of 50 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Josephine's Maelewano Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years,She is a single woman. Take care of 2 people aged 65 and 55 years old. She own a small salon. Every day, she works from 8am to 7.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $500 from her sales.

Josephine now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Merry, who also has business dealing with food vending.

loans.use: To buy more salon item to increase her stock

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian O. K. lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with four children. Vivian sells office stationery supplies and has been doing so for a long time. She is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client, and she is requesting a loan of $425 USD to buy more office stationery supplies to sell. This loan will help her satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more office stationery supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony has been in the welding business since 1986.  He works on and makes iron doors, windows, etc.  He trained to do this work for 3 years before opening his own business.  Now he has many apprentices working for him and learning.  However, he is having trouble maximizing their productivity with only one welding machine.  He needs an additional welding machine and materials to better instruct his apprentices and meet customer demands.  Anthony is 40 years old and expecting a new baby.  He is asking for a loan of $425 to add to his own savings to purchase another machine.  He says this will help his business greatly as well as help him provide for his growing family.  He thanks you for any assistance you can give for his loan.

loans.use: To purchase one wielding machine

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva R. es orginara de Tampico Tamaulipas, ella cuenta con 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. <

> Actualmente, Elva solicita un préstamo por USD$225 a un plazo de 3 meses, los cuales desea emplear en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tacos y hamburguesas. <

> Elva Inició hace aproximadamente 7 años, primero ofreciendo hamburguesas sobre pedido, mismas que elaboraba en su casa. Posteriormente, compró un carrito para la venta de tacos y ahí empezó a darse a conocer de una formá un tanto más formal. <

> El esposo de Elva es comerciante, y fue él quién la animó para que iniciara con la venta de alimentos, así mismo otro de los factor que influyó en la decisión fue la idea de contar con recursos adicionales para poder hacerle frente a las necesidades de sus hijos, sobre todo las referentes a la educación. ¡Los invito a que apoyen a Elva pues ha demostrado ser una persona emprendedora! <

>
texts.en:
Elva Rodriguez is originally from Tampico, Tamaulipas. She is 44 years old and she is married, with two children.

Elva is requesting a loan in the amount of $225 US for a term of 3 months. She will use the funds to purchase more ingredients to make tacos and hamburgers.

She started out approximately 7 years ago taking orders for hamburgers, having made them at home. Later she purchased a cart to sell tacos and that's how she began to get noticed in a more formal way.

Elva's husband is a businessman, and it was he that encouraged her to start selling foods. Another influencing factor on her decision is the idea of having additional income to be able to cover her children's needs, above all, their education.

I invite you to support Elva that has shown herself to be a hard working person!


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make tacos and hamburgers.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida (her husband is pictured) was born in 1952. She lives in Baku city. She is a mother of 2 children. 5 years ago her husband started the taxi business. Now they need a loan of 500 AZN to buy spare parts.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es: Octavia tiene 48 años, vive con su hijo de 12 años. Ha trabajado desde hace 3 años a diversos negocios, según la ocasión, y desde hace un año se dedica a prestar dinero a sus vecinos, por este servicio cobra un porcentaje de devolución, que es su ganancia, es por ello que Octavia tiene un cuaderno de registros de sus prestamos (que se muestra en la foto) para tener un control detallados de ellos, para Octavia, esta es una buena opción para salir adelante, ya que no quiere descuidar la atención de su hijo de 12 años y esta actividad le permite estar con su hijo. Es la segunda vez que sólita un préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Con esta cantidad podrá  incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Octavia is 48 years old, and lives with her 12-year old son. Over the past 3 years, she has worked in various businesses depending on the occasion, and for the past year, she has focused on lending money to her neighbors. She charges a percentage fee for this service, which is her earnings. Octavia keeps a notebook in which to record her loans (shown in the photo) and maintain detailed control of them. For Octavia, this is a good chance to move ahead, as she does not want to neglect her son, and this work allows them to be together. This is the second time that Octavia is soliciting a loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and has demonstrated punctuality in her previous payments. With this loan, Octavia will be able to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.en:
Saifullo is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children. From a young age, he has helped his parents on their farm. Now, he is the father of his own family, which represents a deeper commitment to sustain the family through this activity independently. He mainly cultivates onions, potatoes and carrots. 

Saifullo wants to see his children prosper and become professionals. He is seeking this loan to invest in  mineral fertilizer and other supplies necessary for the preparation of his farmland.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 56 años y vive con su  hijo. Trabaja cada día para progresar en todas las cosas que está dispuesta a realizar, es por ello que decidió emprender su propio restaurante con los ahorros que tenía, se asoció con su madre para trabajar juntas y repartirse las ganancias. La labor de Susana empieza los fines de semana cuando compra los ingredientes y víveres para los platos que va a preparar y todos los demás días  en la mañana prepara los alimentos para venderlos a medio día, también ofrecer desayunos y usualmente cena. Susana está muy animada para seguir adelante, ya van 3 años de haber iniciado su negocio y está dando buenos resultados. Para el futuro Susana  está planificando mejorar su restaurante y arrendar un local más amplio y elegante. Es la segunda vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos y  le agrada reunirse con su banco comunal porque le ha enseñado un valor muy importante, que es el ahorro. El dinero que requiere es para implementar su negocio con la comprar nuevos juegos de mesas y sillas, valorizados en 250 soles cada uno, ella comprara 2 juegos.
texts.en:
Susana is 56 years old and lives with her son. She works every day in order to progress in any way she can. Because of this she decided to start up her own restaurant with the savings she had. She partnered with her mother to work together and share the profits. Susana's work starts on the weekends when she buys the ingredients and supplies for the dishes that she is going to prepare on the following days. In the mornings she prepares the meals to be sold at mid-day; she also offers breakfast and usually dinner. Susana is very motivated to get ahead; it has already been 3 years since starting her business and it is giving good results. For the future Susana is planning to improve her restaurant and rent a larger and more elegant location. This is the second time that she has requested a loan through MFP. She is a very punctual client with her payments and appreciates partnering with her communal bank because it has taught her a very important value, which is savings. The funds she needs are to be used to set up her business with the purchase of new sets of tables and chairs, costing 250 soles each. She will buy 2 sets.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her business

loans.name: Nozim

texts.en:
“Responsible fatherhood” is a term that has been converted into concrete fact in Nozim’s life. He has always responded satisfactorily to his role as provider for his two children, for whom he cares with much love, in the company of his wife, who is always supportive of him.

Nozim works in agriculture and has some cattle. He cultivates potatoes, onions, carrots and other vegetables, subject to the season. At the moment, he is working intensively at his agricultural activities and taking care of his fields. His wife is helping take care of the cows and also sells their milk.

They do all this hard work because they want to give an education to each of their two children. They would also like to open a small business some day; until then they will continue working in their fields. To do this successfully, Nozim is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. Let’s support Nozim in his continuous efforts to provide for the well-being of his family!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Leader of the group of three members, C., 37, is the mother of three children: all of them are students. She is married to Soeung, 44, who is a local farmer. C. sells different kinds of vegetables such as cucumbers, salad, potatoes, etc., and has done so for more than one year. She obtains a good profit from her selling because her store is located in the busy market and because of her responsibility. She is taking a loan to hire a medium-sized plot of farmland for her husband to plant rice.

The other members of the group are: L., 37, who sells vegetables in the market, and is taking a loan to buy a field truck for her husband; and C., 49, who raises piglets, chickens, and ducks and is taking a loan to hire a truck for her husband’s farm work.

loans.use: To hire a plot of farmland for her husband to plant rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is sixty years old. She is a married mother of two children. She says both of her children have grown up and are living independently. She lives with some grandchildren and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader in earthen wares. She procures the wares from ceramic artists in a nearby town. Mary treks to other towns to sell her wares on their market days.

She says she also sells at market square in her community. Mary also trades in other products such as pestles and mortars. She supplies her products mostly to local restaurant operators who mostly pound. Mary has been in this business for ten years now and wants a loan to procure the wares in bulk.

loans.use: To buy earthenware for resale

loans.name: Wastra Group

texts.en:
For the last two years, Maryam M. has made a living selling snacks and porridge in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Wastara loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. She works at her business for 12 hours a day. 

Maryam is requesting a new loan, her third, from BRAC Tanzania to buy more flour and cooking oil, which she will use to make items to sell to her customers. She hopes that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Maryam M. is 25 years old, married and has three children, ages 7, 4 and 2.  She will share this loan with her fellow group member, Maryam O. S., who makes a living selling firewood in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Agé de 29 ans, komi est célibataire sans enfants. il est à son deuxième crédit et les remboursements sont bien exécutés. Il souhaite avec ce nouveau crédit acheter une nouvelle moto et passé la première à son frère. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Komi A. is a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé. He's 29 years old, unmarried and without children. He's seeking his second loan, the previous one was repaid without problems. With this new loan, he wishes to buy a new motorcycle and give the old one to his brother. He counts on this opportunity to improve his standard of living.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Abida Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Najma baji wants a loan to buy decorative pieces to sell. 
Shaheen baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 
Abida baji is the wife of M. R. who has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband is a motor mechanic and repairs vehicles. He has been doing this work for the last five years. Abida baji operates a sewing clothes business. She sews clothes by taking orders from her neighbors. She charges $2 for stitching. Abida baji saves her income in a committee and plans to renovate her house with a committee amount. She is applying for a loan to buy repairing tools for her husband because he wants to start his own motor workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools for motor workshop

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Шухрат - молодой человек, женат имеет двоих детей, жена домохозяйка.Проживает в посёлке Исписар г.Гафурова.Он работает мастером по покраске и евроремонту квартир.В день его отутствия за скотом ухаживает его жена.На снимке Шухрат в день выдачи
texts.en:
Shuhrat is a young married man with two children. His wife is a homemaker. He lives in the Ispisar settlement in the city of Gafurova. He works as a master painter and does European-style remodeling for apartments. In his absence during the daytime, his wife looks after the cattle. In the picture, Shuhrat is shown at the bank on payday. --- MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: care and sale of cattle

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa es artesana, elabora masitas (pequeños pasteles muy sabrosos) que comercializa en la Ciudad de El Alto; vive con su padre de la tercera edad y sus dos hijos que están en la escuela estatal. La casa donde vive es de su padre y está ubicada en la zona Ciudad Satelite de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima, como ser harina, manteca y otros, para poder satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa is a food artisan, producing “masitas” (small pastries that are quite delicious) which she sells in the city of El Alto. She lives with her elderly father and her two sons who attend state schools. Her father’s house, in which she and her family live, is located in a suburb of the city of El Alto.

Her loan will be used to purchase raw materials such as flour, lard and other ingredients to meet the high demand encountered by her business.

This is Maria Luisa’s first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicated she meets the qualifications for approval of the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, lard and other ingredients

loans.name: Начминисо

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
.

Шарипова Начминисо женщина, которая работает в средней школе учительницей математики. Она кроме своей мало оплачиваемой работы, занимается откормом скота. А продаёт её муж.На следующий кредит Начминисо хочет купить две коровы и корм для них. Сейчас у неё три коровы и маленький телёнок.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia P. is from the village of Dullan. She is 37 years old. Sylvia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Sylvia owns and operates a junk shop business in the services sector, providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Sylvia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Sylvia is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional materials for the business. This will be the twentieth loan taken out by Sylvia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah G. sells groceries and food supplies at the market in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2005. She is single and has no educational background.

Sarah uses her income to pay her utility bills. Sarah will use this loan to purchase more food supplies for resale at the market. Sarah plans to plough the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for resale at the market

loans.name: Monica Ndunge

texts.en:
Monica is a widow and she has three children. She has been in the charcoal business for six years, in a very busy estate which is highly populated. This ensures that her business has big sales and returns. Her charcoal business is her only source of income.

Monica was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and she has had no loans from other MFIs. She plans to use the loan that she has applied for to increase her charcoal stock, and with the extra profit, Monica will develop her piece of land. Her future hope is to become a landlady, which she believes is very possible as she is very hardworking.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions for micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Increasing her stock of charcoal so as to maximize profits

loans.name: God Bless You Group

texts.en:
Martha J. is the leader of a group of 4  borrowers called 'God bless You'. She is 67 years old, a widow with 4 children aged 24-35 years old. Their educational levels are 12th grade- university graduate. She also cares for 5 siblings.Martha is illiterate due to poverty. She lives and works in the slip way, close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia.


Martha's business is buying fish wholesale from fishermen around the coast of Monrovia, Liberia and selling them to residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for more than 20 years, and this business allowed her to educate her children.

Martha started this business with a little fund given her by her late husband, and with hardwork and serious attention, she has reached this far. Martha always sell good fish to her customers in order to retain them. She needs this loan to purchase more goods to expand her business.

Martha dreams of growing  her fish business to a higher standard so that she and her childrem can become successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to expand her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer colaboradora y activa, vive en el caserío de Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el kilómetro 21 carretera de Torna vista en el distrito de Campo Verde región de Ucayali, tiene 54 años, madre de once hijos de los cuales ocho son mayores de edad, Margarita se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pues tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es agricultor. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 500 soles que le permitió invertir en productos para su tienda, en la actualidad Margarita necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en implementar su negocio comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc. La meta de Margarita es tener una tienda grande y bien surtida.
texts.en:
Margarita is a cooperative and active woman who lives in the Señor de los Milagros hamlet which is located at the 21km marker on the Torna highway in the Campo Verde district, Ucayali region. She is 54 years old and the mother of 11 children, 8 of whom are adults. Margarita sells groceries from a little store she operates from her home. Her husband is a farmer and he supports her efforts. She has been a member of the “Mi Señor de los Milagros” communal bank for the past year. Her first loan was for 500 soles and she used it to invest in items for her store. Margarita currently needs a loan of 1000 soles which she will use to purchase rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. to stock her store. Margarita's goal is to have a well-stocked, large store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory items such as rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias has owned a bird shop since 2005 in his town because he really loves raising birds. He is a 31-year-old married man with three children. Elias is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase food and cages for the birds.

loans.use: To purchase bird food and cages

loans.name: Isolda Nicolasa

texts.es: Isolda Nicolasa tiene la edad de 45 años. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, que lucha por sacarlos adelante y que los prepara para el día de mañana. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa de manera  ambulante. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que dio inicio a esta actividad desde muy joven ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y seguir adelante, su mayor desafío fue que no tenía conocimientos de los lugares en donde ofrecían las mercaderías a un precio favorable, pero fue por medio de una amiga que salió adelante. Por lo que ahora el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pantalones para caballeros, trajes para damas, camisas, faldas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Isolda Nicolasa, 45, has three childen under her care; she struggles to get them ahead and prepare them for the future. She has been a traveling clothing merchant for the past 10 years. She began working very young because she has always enjoyed work and to get ahead. Her greatest obstcle was that she wasn't aware of the places where merchandise could be had for a favorable price but a girlfriend helped her continue forward. She needs financing now to buy men's pants, women's outfits, shirts, skirts, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth sells clothing materials of various colors at retail prices to her customers. Her customers are within and outside Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. She loves this business because of the profits that she makes from the business. She has been in business for six years.

Janeth is 29 years old and is married with a child. Her husband is also involved in her business.

Janeth is requesting a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more clothing materials to sell. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Karambi Tutengukye Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Jessica K. is a hard working and devoted lady, living in the Kancinga trading centre in Ibanda. Jessica runs a shop and hotel that have been running mostly with the help of her loans. She has been able to restock her shop with more goods because of past loans she has received.

Jessica is married and her husband is a farmer with plantations, cows and goats with a family livestock enclosure. Jessica needs a loan to be able to recapitalize her businesses.

loans.use: Restocking her shop and hotel with more food stuffs

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Mrs. Barbara P. is from the village of D'Ban Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. She is married and blessed with three adult children. She owns and operates a business providing manicures and pedicures in the local community. Barbara has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos a month for these activities. In 2003, Barbara joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Barbara has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional materials to use. Barabara is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Barbara from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English

loans.use: Purchase materials for her existing business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
Luciana tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Luciana se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Luciana tiene su propia chacra donde siembra hortalizas y verduras. Luciana también tiene animales como toros, gallinas y chanchos. La socia nos cuenta que los días jueves, martes y domingos, lleva sus productos a vender al mercado de Huancalle de la Ciudad del Pisaq. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Luciana requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas y alimento para los animales. Luciana pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Luciana is 42, married, and has four children. Luciana gets up very early to do her household chores. For example, she makes breakfast and gets her younger children off to school. Luciana has her own farm where she plants vegetables. Luciana also has animals like bulls, hens, and hogs. She tells us that on Thursdays, Tuesdays, and Sundays she takes her products to sell them in the Huancalle Market in the city of Pisaq. She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Luciana needs the loan to buy more seeds and food for her animals. Luciana belongs to the Villa Rayanniyoc Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time. The city of Rayanniyoc is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more seeds and food for the animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries for resale

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María Mercedes P. S., nació en Santo Tomas municipio del Departamento del Atlántico,  donde aun vive y goza del cariño de sus habitantes,  que la llaman  “ la Seño”  por el gran número de niños que han estado en su proyecto escolar y que hoy son  adultos, profesionales, padres de familia, no dejan de apodarla como cuando ellos eran niños.  Para ella Santo Tomas es un municipio de gente que siempre quiere ayudarse entre sí y a sus forasteros; les gusta la fiesta por eso realizan el Carnaval Intermunicipal del Atlántico que integra a todo el Departamento; pero  dice que más allá del  baile el Tomasino (su gentilicio)  es  un ser humano muy estudioso y con una gran capacidad de superación.
María Mercedes tiene al lado de su vivienda, unas instalaciones donde se dedica a cuidar y preparar a  niños  para que superen los niveles  de jardín, prejardin, transición y donde también desarrolla actividades de refuerzo y complementación de estudiantes que le llevan sus padres, para  ser ayudados a superar logros educativos a través de su programa de tareas dirigidas. Cuando ella inició esta actividad no había terminando su bachillerato y lo hizo ayudando a niños de sus vecinas sin cobrarle dinero, pero ellos llevaban los pupitres donde sentarse; poco a poco con el nivel de progreso de estos niños,  muchas madres tomasinas  requerían de sus servicios;  fue así como decidió  con la ayuda de ellos, ampliar los salones y  adecuar lo que hoy son 3 salones, donde los niños aprenden en un mejor espacio. Por eso en aras de continuar brindándole un mejor ambiente formativo a los niños, solicita un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 que  invertirá en adecuaciones de sus instalaciones como: repellar paredes, cambiar la cubierta, adecuar las zonas húmedas, e invertir en meriendas económicas y sanas para ofrecer a sus pequeños.
Su sueño a mediano plazo es ampliar la cobertura y entrar al sistema educativo formal, para lo cual se está preparando, pues aunque no tiene hijos biológicos, su vocación maternal y educadora,  está volcada especialmente  hacia los niños y los que están  en su proyecto de escuela, no son la excepción; en este sentido ella estimula la finalización de sus niveles integrándolos con sus padres, mediante pequeñas ceremonias de cumplimiento de logros, con la que todos se sienten muy felices de su progreso, especialmente “La Seño” como todos la conocen en Santo Tomás.
texts.en:
María Mercedes P. S. was born in the municipality of Santo Tomás, department of Atlántico, where she still lives and enjoys the affection of its inhabitants; they call her “La Seño” (short for “Señora” or “Señorita”; commonly associated with a teacher but with respect and affection) because of the great number of children that have participated in her school project and are now adults, professionals, parents who continue use her nickname as when they were children. To her, Santo Tomas is a municipality of people willing to help each other and even outsiders; they like festivals and that is why they have the Carnaval Intermunicipal del Atlántico that integrates the entire Department; but beyond dancing, the “Tomasino” (as people from Santo Tomas are called) is a human being who likes to study and has great capacity to improve herself or himself. María Mercedes has a facility next to her house where she takes care and prepares children to get through pre-kinder, kinder, and transition period; she also conducts activities to reinforce and compliment the work of students brought by their parents; the students are coached to exceed their school achievements through guided work. She had not finished high school when she started this line of work, and she begun by helping the neighbor’s children without charging them, but they brought their own desks to sit on; little by little, with the level of progress achieved by these children, many “tomasina” mothers sought her services; for this reason and with their help, she decided to expand the classrooms and she equipped what are now 3 classrooms, where the children learn in a better space. In the interest of continuing to bring a better learning environment, she is requesting a loan of $2.000.000 that she will invest in improvements of her facilities, such as: plaster walls, change roof cover, accommodate ecological areas and buy inexpensive and healthy snacks for her children. Her mid-term dream is to expand the coverage and enter the educational system officially, for which she is preparing; even though she has no biological children, her calling as a mother and a teacher is completely dedicated to the children, and the ones in her school project are no exception. She stimulates the completion of the different levels by integrating the children with their parents through small ceremonies for fulfilled achievements, in which all participants feel happy with the progress, especially “La Seño”, as she is known by everybody in Santo Tomás.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve classroom facilities (walls, roofs, ecological areas) and buy inexpensive and healthy snacks for the children

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana Sardón vive en casa propia en la zona  de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo y su hijo.
La señora Juana trabaja junto con su esposo en la construcción en viviendas particulares de esta ciudad, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de gradas de concreto en dos pisos de su vivienda, ya que con la que cuenta es de madera de construcción y propensa a generar accidentes.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana S. lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz with her husband and son. Juana works together with her husband in construction particular to apartments in the city, the income of which supports her family. The loan she is asking for is for the construction of concrete steps on two floors of her apartment as the current steps are made of wood and have a propensity for generating accidents.

This is the third time that she has asked for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis indicates that she qualifies favorably and should be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The construction of concrete steps in two floors of her apartment to replace wooden steps in poor condition

loans.name: Mary Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mary Mercedes tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad, los cuales están a su cargo. La señora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ella trabaja con la Avon, con Zermat, además de esto, ella para obtener precios más baratos viaja al mercado de Managua a comprar mercadería. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 6 años esto fue con el propósito de obtener una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, ya que en ese tiempo se acababa de separar de su esposo. Con el tiempo ha ido ahorrando y ha establecido un buen negocio, gracias a sus clientes que nunca le han fallado a sus pagos. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito en Fundación León 2000 con el propósito de realizar compras de productos Avon, ya que es ahora cuando tiene bastantes encargos de artículos, por la época de verano y las vacaciones que se acercan. Es importante mencionar que la señora realiza sus ventas de manera ambulante distribuyéndoles a sus clientes los encargos, por lo que su deseo es establecer una tienda en su casa de habitación para que sus clientes puedan acercarse confiadamente a buscar los productos que deseen.
texts.en:
Sra. Mary Mercedes, 36, is married and has two children, 8- and 10-years old, both in her care. Mary Mercedes makes a living selling cosmetics, working with Avon and Zermat products, among others. To get the best prices, she goes to a market in Managua. She started the business 6 years ago because she needed a source of income to support her children after she separated from her husband. Over time, she has saved up and, thanks to customers who are diligent about paying her, she now has an established business. She is applying for a loan from Fundacion Leon 2000 so that she can stock up on Avon products, merchandise that will be much in demand now that summer and summer vacations are coming. It's important to mention that Mary Mercedes works as a street vendor now, but she would like to set up a store in her house so that her customers can easily find her to buy the products that they want.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Miriam N. owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She is 53 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Brgy. Common, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. Miriam has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Miriam joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Miriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to repair her vehicle to provide a better service. Miriam is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. Miriam is the leader of a 12 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of cassava flour

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, 52 years old, lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 40 years.

She is a wife of I. M.. They have three sons who are 29, 25, and 22 years old. They all got their education up to 8th standard and couldn’t study further due to little financial resources. Now they perform their duties of a mason and generate income for the family.

Parveen’s husband is involved in the livestock business. He purchases the animals from the animal market and sells them. He has been in this profession for 15 years. Parveen is very supportive. She helps her husband by taking care of his animals.

She is a regular client of Asasah and has successfully repaid three loans. Now she is applying for her fourth loan, to purchase animals and expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase animals to sell.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon C., 38, is a professional basket weaver, making US $1 each day in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is married and has three children. Her husband, Meach Norng, makes approximately US $2.50 every day as a construction foreman.

Chuon C. would like a loan of US $800 to finish her construction.

loans.use: To finish construction

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 8 years old. Two of his children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from western Kenya near Nyamira town. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years and has employed one person from the community. His main products are tomatoes, milk, meat, maize, and coffee which he sells at the local market. He also runs a butchery in the same area. His biggest challenge has been limited agricultural land which has made it hard for him to expand, and lack of farm equipment.

George has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of Kes.45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to send his children to a better school.

In future, he would like to expand his farming activities by acquiring more dairy cows and acquiring a vehicle for transportation.

He would like to request Juhudi to grant him a larger loan amount in future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TRES MARIAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Valentina; ella tiene 29 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, la socia vende en el mercado de San Pedro productos secos y todo lo referente a abarrotes en un stand; La socia aprendió el negocio este de su mamá, el stand que ella tiene ahora en el mercado central es de su madre quién le cedió para que ella pueda así criar y educar a su menor hijo, ella quiere estudiar enfermería asi que ahorrará también para poder tener un capital para sus estudios. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio con productos. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member lives in Santiago district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She’s a member of the “TRES MARIAS” (Three Marys) communal bank. The member is Valentina, 29. She and her significant other have a son. She sells dry goods and groceries in a stall in the San Pedro market. She learned this business from her mother and the stand she now has in the central market used to be her mother’s but she passed it on to her so that she could raise and educate her son. She would like to study nursing so she will save in order to have capital for her studies. She is asking for funds to stock her business. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted because it permits her business to grow and improves her quality of life. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele F. is 25 and married with one child. She owns a business venture of planting and harvesting taro for sale. Mele has one year of experience in this business. Mele needs a loan of 1,000 Samoa tala to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or about $167 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2010, Mele joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Mele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en: Monsieur Kokouvi B. is a nurse in Lomé, Togo. He is 43 years old and has a small medical practice called "Le Diagnostic". He has had this practice since 1999 and is looking to expand. He would like to purchase different kinds of medical equipment and some medical products in order to offer better service to his clients. For this reason, Monsieur B. has requested a loan of 500,000 XOF in order to purchase these items and invest in his practice. Kokouvi is married to a hairdresser and they have two children.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment and other items

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul E. is a resident of Kadamjai, a nice town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 39 and divorced. She has raised two sons; the older son went to work in Russia and the second helps his mom with housework. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Jumagul started to grow rice and is involved in retail sales of rice, earning 5,000 KGS per month.
