This profit made it possible for her to save money and purchase cattle for breeding.  With the money received from this loan, she wants to purchase mineral fertilizers for growing rice and to purchase 200 kg of rice in the village in order to resell it on the market at a higher price. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and 200 kg of rice

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
This is Porferia L., 46, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Zacarias L., a laborer, and is the mother of eight children, two of whom are already working, two are in college, one is in high school, and one is in elementary school.

By the grace of God, Porferia has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Porferia; she, herself, has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Porferia maintains a direct-selling business, selling clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, frozen foods and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, Pampanga’s Best and others. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and this provides the profits that dealers rely on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 650 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Porferia is requesting a Php 9,000 loan which she will use to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Porferia dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She also hopes to continue serving her fellowmen through her business, for the glory of the Lord Almighty. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon S. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Corazon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of theaccredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is a married forty-seven-year-old man blessed with eight children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels of learning. Friday is a very hard-working and enterprising businessman who started with buying and selling only two goats per week and has gone to fifteen goats per week. The look on his face shows that the business is fulfilling without any major challenges. Friday needs the loan to buy young goats to rear and sell after maturity.

loans.use: Buying young goats to rear and sell at maturity

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 32-year-old lady living in Fort Portal. Uganda. She is a single mother of two children aged 16 and 12 years. This means she is charged with the responsibility of looking after them in terms of welfare and maintenance. She lives in her own house with four people. Amina deals in selling cassava flour. She has been in this business for twelve years now, having started so small. She still hopes the business will grow into a bigger one in the near future. This is Amina’s seventh loan facility from HOFOKAM and she intends to use the loan proceeds to purchase sacks of cassava flour to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cassava flour to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married lady and has four children who are above twenty years old.  She makes and sells doughnuts for a living.  She sells the doughnuts in her neighborhood.  Since she joined Faulu kenya, her business has been picking up.  She hopes to provide proper education to her children in the future.  She has requested for 10, 000 Kes to buy cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and wheat flour

loans.name: Celeo David

texts.es:
El Sr. Celeo F. es comerciante y actualmente se dedica a la  venta de abarrotería, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de pulpería “El Pedregal”, que esta ubicado en la comunidad de El Pedregal el Zamorano.
El negocio de don Fidel esta ubicado en la entrada de la calle principal de su comunidad y esto le genera bastante clientela y por lo consiguiente suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Don Celeo es casado y junto con su esposa han concebido tres hijos, uno lo a logrado graduar y los otros dos estan cursando su educación secundaria en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. 
Don Celeo es una persona muy luchadora que a salido adelante, gracias a la buena administración de su negocio a logrado adquirir su propia casa y actualmente sus condiciones de vida son favorables.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Celeo F. is a storekeeper and he makes a living selling groceries. His business operates under the store name “El Pedregal”, which is located in the community of El Pedregal el Zamorano. Mr. Fidel’s business is located at the entrance of the main street of the town, which generates more than enough clientele and, consequently, sufficient earnings to support his family. 

Mr. Celeo is married. He and his wife have three children. One has successfully graduated and the other two are enrolled in high school in Tegucigalpa city. Mr. Celeo is a very determined man who is getting ahead thanks to the good administration of his business. He has successfully acquired his own house and currently his living situations are favorable. He will use the loan to purchase goods to stock up his business.

loans.use: The purchase of bread, beans, coffee, cookies, soft drinks, pills, vegetable juices, juices, water, soups, pastas, rice, sugar, churros, butter, oil, tortillas, flour.

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat K. has been operating her own small business from her home for years. She is skilled in weaving palm leaves by hand and has done this since she was a single girl. She turns leaves into furniture and roofing material to sell for a profit. Sat K.’s husband earns an income by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. This couple has five children, all of them are single, and the two of them are employed as garment worker. 

Sat K. would like to borrow some funds for her husband to purchase equipment form making palm sugar in order to making additional profit. Sat K. was not available at that day, so his husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for making palm sugar.

loans.name: Comercita

texts.en:
Comercita D. is 41 years old and married with six school-aged children. She is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. To make a living, Comercita owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling school supplies such as pens, pencils, calculators, and different kinds of paper to the local community. Comercita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

Comercita joined HSPFI in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase products to sell. Comercita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory such as school supplies, as well as junk food and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as school supplies, junk food, and canned goods

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. cecilia es una persona que  vive con su hermano mayor, y una hermana que esta en los estados unidos, ella ha estado mejorando la casa donde vive desde hace mas de 20 años, y actualmente están remodelando el techo y las paredes del interior de la casa, ella trabaja en el departamento de contabilidad de una empresa y esta solicitando el crédito porque quiere recibir el año nuevo con las paredes y el techo de su casa remodelados y con pintura nueva, ya que actualmente los tiene solo con el enjarre de cemento, y ella se sentiría muy a gusto ver que sus familiares al visitarla  vean que la casa ha ido mejorando.
texts.en: Cecilia lives with her older brother and has a sister who lives in the United States.  She has been improving the home where she lives for more than 20 years, and currently she is remodeling the roof and the walls of the interior of the house.  She works in the accounting department of a business, and is requesting the loan because she wants to enter the new year with the walls and the roof of her home remodeled and with new paint, since currently they are only plaster.  She would be very pleased to see her family visit her so they can see that the house has been improved.

loans.use: To remodel the interior of her home, the roof, and the walls

loans.name: Elsa Mariana

texts.es:
Elsa Mariana S. M., tiene 20 años, es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el  Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NARCISA DE JESUS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Temistocles perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembre de maíz y arroz.

Elsa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca con cacao.

Le gusta leer y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Elsa Mariana S. M., age 20, is married and lives with her husband and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has 2 children. 

The members of the V.R.C. Narcisa de Jesus are located in the San Temistocles district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work, sowing corn and rice. 

Elsa works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in the Peña market and also sells from her home or in the market every day. 

She is requesting this loan to plant corn, and to buy supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to have a cocoa farm.

She enjoys reading and listening to music.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA, toutes mariés ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent dans des  familles monogames au quartier SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pagnes wax, de condiments alimentaires, de légumes de savons à travers BINTOU S.. 
BINTOU S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt 12 cartons de savons au grand marché de Sikasso. Elle effectue sa vente au  marché de MEDINE à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et en détail. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95.000 FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Dembagnouma Group is composed of five married women, who on average are 37 years old and have five children. They live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their fourth group loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers. Their previous loans have been repaid on schedule. The women in this group sell wax pagnes (colorful African cloths), food condiments, vegetables and soap.

Mrs Bintou Sangaré intends to use her loan to buy 12 boxes of soap at the great market in Sikasso. She will retail her goods for cash at the Médine market in Sikasso to a clientele made up of men and women.

She expects to make an average profit of 95,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy soap

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and married with six adult children. To make a living, Portia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food and toothpaste in the local community. Portia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Portia joined HSPFI in 2007 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Portia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Portia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk food. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Portia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local gin

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is a farmer in Kitale Town in Western Kenya. She has been in mixed farming for five years  producing milk, eggs, vegetables and beans which she sells to the local market. She is married with six children of whom four are of school-going age. She has no other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the milk produce will be a great food supplement for the family as well as earn her income from her sales. Priscah is focusing on increasing the number of her dairy cows and buying a motorcycle to help in transportation of produce to the market.

Animal diseases and food shortage remain the greatest threats to business in her opinion.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potato and pea seeds as well as fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Simons

texts.en: Simons is a thirty-one-year-old married man with one child. He rents a house in Kasese Uganda. He has been in maize milling for two years as an employee. His hardship is power fluctuations and his vision is to own a machine and build a house. Simons intends to use the credit facility to buy a maize mill.

loans.use: to buy a maize mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy V. is 37 years old, married to a businessman and has one child who is in high school. She lives with her family in Caloocan City, Metro Manila, where she makes a living by selling rice and running a sari-sari or variety store. Joy is also a community partner in CCT*, where the weekly Bible fellowships and entrepreneurial trainings help compensate for her lack of a formal education. She has been running her business for two years, has one employee and earns about PHP 11,200 a month.

Joy is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy a commercial space in a densely-populated part of Manila. This will give her a greater opportunity to earn money. In the future, she would like to expand by opening a second location. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. The meetings also help her build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a new commercial space.

loans.name: Ankhtsetseg

texts.en:
Ankhtsetseg is 23 years old and lives with her husband, grandmother, son and daughter, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger districts of the city. Her son is 4 years old and her daughter is 1 year old. Her grandmother is retired and cares for the children at home. 

Ankhtsetseg started running her carpentry business with help from her husband in 2007. When they first began their business, they did not have any equipment. Now they have some carpentry equipment and usually make wooden washstands, wooden beds and other furniture.  They purchase wood from Tsaiz wood market and sell their products at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

Ankhtsetseg is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to purchase more wood to make furniture.  She and her husband want to improve their business with this loan so they will be able to build their own small house.

loans.use: buy more wood to make furniture

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 33 years old and married with 1 infant aged child.  His wife is a housekeeper, and engaged in the retailing business. 

Pablo is a farmer working in the Philippines.  He is engaged in growing of rice and has been doing it for 10 years.  Pablo is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase manure fertilizers and seeds of rice to be planted in his farm.  He wants to maintain and improve his farming business for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds of rice to be planted in his farm

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ILLIMANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Felicidad. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio de chalinas, producción y servicio.
 
La señora Felicidad,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de una promotora que visito su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chalinas, que viene trabajando hace veinte años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de material (compra de chalinas), este material lo compra de la calle Buenos Aires y viajes a Desaguadero, posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias de lunes a viernes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The “Illimani” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board headed by Felicidad.  The members of this communal bank are in a variety of businesses among which we have:  scarves sales, production and service.

Felicidad indicates that this is the first time she’s participated in Pro Mujer and she joined thanks to an invitation from a promoter who visited her at home.  She currently sells scarves and has been in business for the last 20 years having learned the business from her mother.

The loan she will take out is to buy merchandise (scarves).  She buys it on Buenos Aires Street and on trips to Desaguadero and then sells them later on at the Monday and Friday markets.  She generates income this way to help out her family as much as possible.  She is married and has two children.

loans.use: to buy scarves.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 47 years old and married with one school-aged child. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community. She has been doing this work for 12 years and she earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly.

Juliana is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase soap, shampoo, instant noodles and canned goods to sell. She hopes that she can acquire more customers to gain more profit.

In the future, Juliana hopes that her business will expand to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste, shampoo, noodles and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna lives in the village of Mukhrani in the eastern part of the country of Georgia. She is 44 years old, married, and has two children. 

Several years ago, Khatuna was employed as an accountant, but she lost her job due to Georgia's difficult economy. 

To earn a living, she started to trade textiles for clothing and home needs. She buys textiles in bulk at wholesale markets and then sells them in nearby villages. Khatuna travels to the wholesale markets on average once a month and stores the materials she buys in her home. Her most popular item in area villages are blankets. 

Khatuna requests a loan to purchase additional textile materials at wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and textiles for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a peddler of clothes, footwear and ladies wear in Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana. She wishes to increase the quantity of clothes she sells and needs a loan to purchase additional clothes to bring variety into her sales to meet the demands of her customers. Any increase that is realized from the sale of the clothes will be used to purchase a shop to display the clothes for sale. Ama is married to a driver and they have two children. Her business is five years old. Ama uses her income to help her husband to pay utility bills and other household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Gegie

texts.en:
Gegie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Gegie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gegie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gegie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
